story:
My small team and I, Steffen, have been working on a miniature tabletop skirmish game for a few months. I've been a big tabletop / wargame fan for a long time. I started, probably like many of you, with Warhammer Fantasy. I deal with all aspects of tabletop, including writing rules, making miniatures and building terrain ... At Kickstarter, the project was already successful

This crowdfunding campaign is mainly for everyone who missed the project on Kickstarter

Since the project is quite advanced (rule book, finished STL files for the resin models, sketches for other miniatures and the like) and we are a good team, I see the main risk in a late delivery due to the current situation (Covid19) . It is possible that printed matter and / or materials for production cannot be delivered on time. But I am hopeful that the situation will ease up in the summer ...At the moment everything is going very well.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Mein kleines Team und ich, Steffen, arbeiten seit ein paar Monaten an einem Miniature Tabletop Skirmish Game. Ich bin seit langem ein großer Tabletop/Wargame Fan. Angefangen habe ich, wahrscheinlich wie viele von euch, mit Warhammer Fantasy. Ich beschäftige mich mit allen Aspekten im Tabletop, incl. Regeln schreiben, Miniaturen herstellen und Geländebau... Bei Kickstarter war das Projekt schon erfolgreich

Dieses Crowdfunding Kampagne ist hauptsächlich für alle, die das Projekt auf Kickstarter verpasst haben

Da das Projekt recht weit fortgeschritten ist (Regelbuch, fertige STL.Dateien für die Resin Modelle, Skizzen für weitere Miniaturen und ähnliches) und wir ein gutes Team sind, sehe ich das Haupt-Risiko in einer verspätete Auslieferung wegen der aktuelle Lage (Covid19). Möglicherweise können Druckerzeugnisse und/oder Materialen für die Produktion nicht rechtzeitig geliefert werden. Ich bin aber guter Hoffnung, dass sich die Lage im Sommer entspannen wird... Im Moment klappt alles sehr gut

story:
Do you believe?

Do you believe in aliens? I have seen television shows, movies, and news articles about aliens and UFO's and believe human beings have an inherent fascination with extraterrestrials. I am one of those people and believe that we are not alone. There is a lot of historical evidence that suggests this may be fact. What do you believe? Has alien technology assisted us to develop so quickly as a civilization? What if there is alien technology available, but the governments of the world have covered it up?  Maybe they discovered an unlimited power source, but they are unable to stabilize it because of lack of knowledge or fear of the unknown. This power source could revolutionize the world and bring us one step closer to unlimited power, a pollution-free planet, and an understanding of worlds beyond our own.  

I had a vision a few years ago about writing a fictional book about a bizarre steampunk carnival powered by ancient alien technology. The book will appeal to all sci-fi and steampunk fans with its unique and colorful characters. The characters are dreamt from my imagination which all tell their own story. Each character has their own personality with special abilities, skills, and desires and they have the choice to enhance themselves at a mortal price. Most of the characters wear steampunk-like gadgetry which is not powered by steam, but with a smart alien power source called Lodscovium. The technology is unstable and produces a toxic mist which is deadly overtime without protection.

The Limited Edition Playing Cards

Tuck Boxes Trio

Before I release my book, I have brought my characters to life with playing cards for all to enjoy. These playing cards are limited edition and only 1000 decks will be printed!  This deck is the first deck of a 3-part series.  The future decks of this series will expand to include other incredible characters within Llod's Carnival and its origins. 

The playing cards contained in the first series are high-quality illustrations of some of the main characters in the Llod’s Carnival book. The characters are expertly designed to illustrate their special steampunk devices that enhance their natural innate abilities. However, they may pay the ultimate price for exploiting the technology without fully understanding the ramifications. The bottom pose of each character demonstrates the potential outcome if they decide to overuse and abuse the technology. The character transforms into a ghastly and dying image of their former self from the toxic alien radiation which emanates from their steampunk gadgets.

Numeric Examples

Example uncut sheet of Llod's Playing Cards.

*The last card in the sheet will be Thoth (see below image)

Symbolism

Each playing card will contain symbolic references. You will need to look closely and examine each character to draw your own conclusion of what you think it means. To find out more about each character and symbolic references, go to www.conethgames.com. 

Pips

There are two types of pips. One type is located in the corners of the face cards and the other type are on the numerical face cards. 

The corner pips of each suit are detailed to include symbolic meanings from ancient Egyptian times.  The spades use the scorpion which is to honor of the Egyptian goddess Isis. The diamonds suit is represented by a cobra which is often depicted spitting fire.  The suit of clubs represents the cycle of life with the sacred scarab beetle.  Lastly, the bee is synonymous with the heart suit and represents part of the title of the King of Upper and Lower Egypt.

The numerical face card pips are clean, with elegant line art which represents a nostalgic period of time. The design follows the same theme as the characters when they are exposed to Lodscovium radiation. The upper part of the card will always display as normal pips. However, the bottom pips are deteriorated and broken up. This design is used on each number of every suit to maintain consistency. 

Tuck Box 

The tuck box is visual eye candy that brings your eyes front and center. The beautiful Cassandra does not disappoint with her flowing hair, enchanting eyes, and a dress that she fills and expects your immediate attention. At the top, are highly detailed pips that are symbolic of ancient Egyptian times. 

The backside of the tuck box is complemented with painterly scenery from Llod’s Carnival. The carnival can be seen in the distance with its famous star wheel amusement ride attraction. In the foreground, approaches Llod’s train with its signature winged horse engine which pulls the locomotive forward. The train engine spews out a trail of green toxic fumes that can be seen for miles and glows in the night sky. 

On the side of the box, a nighttime scene evokes feelings of solitude with a floating balloon rising towards the heavens. Directly behind the balloon is Orion’s belt which illuminates the night sky in the distance. It’s believed that extraterrestrials come from that distant part of the sky. 

The tuck box design is unique when placing 3 tuck boxes together. If you place the front, side, and back together, it will display a brilliant panoramic view.

Card Back

Numbered Custom Seal


The Jokers Diptych

These joker cards are unique not only as characters but as a grouped panoramic image. Place the cards next to each other and they form a cohesive panoramic image between the two figures. The cards can be placed on either side which will create a slightly different perspective.
 

The Suits (Die Glocke)

The swastika was only intended for accurate historical representation.  This symbol will not be printed on the card.
 

The Suits (Thoth)

The suit cards are extra cards in the deck and may be used as gaff cards. For every deck in the 3-part series, there will either be one or two additional suit cards to add to your collection.
 

Printing

I have selected the United States Playing Card Company (USPCC) to print the cards. They have a great reputation for producing high-quality custom playing cards.  The playing cards are currently in the prepress queue.
 

FREE Wallpaper

With every order get a free wallpaper for your computer, tablet, and smartphone.


Delivery

The cards will be delivered before October 31, 2018.  All card decks will be delivered via USPS or DHL.
 

Learn More...

Visit www.conethgames.com where you can see in-depth information about each character, interactive cards, initial prototypes and different phases of the design process.

Thank you!

If you made it this far, then I want to personally thank you for taking the time to read about my project.  I appreciate any support and backing to make this project happen.  I look forward to sending these decks of playing cards out to you in October 2018 to your home just in time for Halloween celebrations!
 

Llod's Carnival Book Plug

The book is about a group of college students discovering their true identity, fears and learning how to survive based on life-changing decisions. Their journey takes them to a bizarre steampunk carnival where rides and games are not what they appear to be. The experiences will forever change who they are while they discover and face their inner fears. The carnival will forever be a part of them. If they risk telling the truth, then they will put their family and themselves in mortal danger. The book is slated to be released on October 31, 2020.

story:
Welcome to Spellcrow’s first crowdfunding campaign!

Who are we?

Spellcrow is a company from Poland with a wide range of fantasy heroes and creatures as well as sci-fi range of bits. We have years of experience in sculpting high quality miniatures in 28mm scale. You can find our previous works at www.spellcrow.com or on our facebook.

We are building our range constantly – lately we have released a bunch of big beasts. We have noticed that adding new miniatures to our range needs much time and money. But we think that this process could be speeded up with your help!


Some time ago we have released Helloween Mage miniature – our first representative of our pumpkinhead race the Dyniaqs. It attracted great interest and lots of people were sending us positive feedback. Next was Helloween Lord (the one on the right) who also was well received.



As the next halloween is coming we have an idea to expand our line with new high quality miniatures and we want to release the set of six pumpkinhead adventurers. They are going to depict the heroic fantasy archetypes such as mage, barbarian and other characters you can find in any fantasy RPG. Whether you are the collector, painter or gamer you should enjoy those miniatures! The starter set will include new and the existing miniatures. 


Also as the campaign develops we are going to expand the range by new miniatures as you can see in the 'Strech goals' section. All miniatures will be cast in metal. All the models are supplied unassembled and comes with slot base. The rules for starter set will be released and available for download as are the main rules which you can find here.

 

We would like to release whole set at once. To do so we need your aid as the Indiegogo campaign will help us raise funds to start production process. It is probably the most cash consuming part of releasing new minis. Your pledges will help us start making molds and casting process. We are planning to release our miniatures box within 4 weeks after the campaign ends but we hope to do that sooner. Last but not least this is the great way to get feedback from you and much positive energy to keep up with our work!


As we are really grateful for your support we created those cool perks for you! Depending on how much you would like to contribute you can select the right one for you. Postage costs are not included in the perks total so you will have to add +3 EUR so we can send yours miniatures to you. When picking multiple perks you pay shippng cost only once.


As the Seed Man you will receive high quality Halloween wallpaper and a big thank you on your e-mail.




As the Root Warrior you will receive one metal miniature of Dyniaq with a whip. Please add 3 EUR for shipping.



As the Leaf Master you will receive the Dyniaq mage miniature. Additionally you will receive the Dyniaq spawn for free! Please add 3 EUR for shipping.



As a Squash Prince you will receive Dyniaq starter set which contains 6 high quality metal miniatures. Also it is ready to play set - shortened version of the main rules and the party sheet are included. Please add 3 EUR for shipping.



As for special offer we offer you the Squash Prince level with additional 5EUR off the price. It only goes for first 10 persons so better be quick! Please add 3 EUR for shipping.



With Savagetable level you will get a savage Dyniaq beast - the Arachniaq. It's big, it's lethal and it is worth to have one. Arachniaq is high quality resin miniature and comes with scenic base. Please add 3 EUR for shipping.



As the Chancellor of Lanterns you will receive the Dyniaqs starter set, Dyniaq with whip, Dyniaq spawn and the Arachniaq - high quality resin beast model. Please add 3 EUR for shipping.




As the Pumpking you will receive the Dyniaqs starter set, Dyniaq with a whip, Dyniaq spawn, Arachniaq - the big high quality resin beast, resin Wicked Tree model and also you will receive the two additional Dyniaq miniatures - the kid and the vampire! Please add 3 EUR for shipping.



Stretch goals:

Creating those pumpkinheads is really enjoyable and we would love more minis that go with this theme! To help this happen we have set first two stretch goals to release new miniatures. Gathering more money than in our goal will allow us to release even more extra miniatures and some other stuff. Here is a list of possible stretch goals. As we will rise close to next level we will surely post some new stretch goals so try to keep up with updates!

1000 Euro - First leaf

Unlocks new model - little Dyniaq kid. Available for 8EUR in additional perk. Concept art coming soon.

2000 Euro - Fruit-thirsty Pumpire

Unlocks new model - bloodthirsty Dyniaq vampire lookalike :) Available for 8EUR in additional perk. Concept art coming soon.

3000 Euro – Rapid growth

To celebrate reaching our goal we would like to add free Dyniaq spawn miniture to each starter set. It means that each contributor of level 4 or more will receive one additional miniature for free!

4000 Euro - Bookworm trouble

Unlocks new model - Dyniaq with a book. Perfect as a scholar or wizard apprentice. Available for 8EUR in additional per. Concept art coming soon.

5000 Euro - Arrrr!

Unlocks new model - Dyniaq pirate! Available for 8EUR in additional perk.

6000 Euro - All hail Jack the King!

Unlocks new model - the Dyniaqs great PumpKing, Jack the King! Available for 8EUR in additional perk.


Thanks to all of you for your support and for helping us in expanding our range!

story:
In addition players can also keep organized the area of the enemies with the use of our monster mats (8''x20'').   

Our neoprene playmats are high quality, 2.5mm thick. The lower rubber surface ensures that the playmat doesn't slide on the table while the upper fabric surface ensures that the cards and tokens don't slip easily and allowing the easy pickup of the components. 

We are a company made up for people that love the graphic design and the board games. For a long time we have designed upgrades for our personal board games and now we have decided to share with you some of our favorite improvements for a best experience playing board games.   

 

IMPORTANT

Any mention and use of images of Gloomhaven in this campaign are for reference and for demonstration purposes only. We have designed our playmats with a compatible layout to be used along the game as a non-official complement. Gloomhaven is a registered trademark belonging to Cephalofair Games. All rights reserved by their respective owners. No challenge to intellectual property rights is included or implied in the representations of compatibility and is not implied or represents any endorsement of any of our designs by any other company.

 

CREDITS

  • Graphic & Video Art Direction by Even Design.
  • Video Soundtrack: Music and Lyrics by Wayne Sanders.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We are professional graphic designers with more than 20 years of combined experience and we have been backers for a long time, we have sponsored some projects related to board games personally.

This is our first Indiegogo project and we want to guarantee all our sponsors that the work done is transparent and responsible.

We do not believe there is any problem in the development of this project, however, there are risks and challenges that may arise along the way that are beyond our control. Production could be affected by problems at the factory due to equipment, material and labor failures, which could delay the project. The shipment may also experience problems that may affect delivery on time. In addition, events caused by the forces of nature can occur.

We have not chosen our suppliers of materials and shipping due to the price, we chose them because of their experience and good references. We are confident and ready to deliver the unofficial Playmats compatible with Gloomhaven as soon as possible and with the best quality that our sponsors deserve.

The shipment may also experience problems that may affect delivery on time. In addition, events caused by the forces of nature can occur.We have not chosen our suppliers of materials and shipping due to the price, we chose them because of their experience and good references. We are confident and ready to deliver the unofficial Playmats compatible with Gloomhaven as soon as possible and with the best quality that our sponsors deserve.

story:
Why did I take this Project to Indiegogo?

 After my 1st Successful run of these dice on Kickstarter I was planning on "rolling" the profits over into extra dice.  But "Life" happened and I was laid off from my full time job as a Mechanical Engineer.  Since Kickstarter doesn't allow you to re-run duplicate projects I decided to raise the funds here on Indiegogo to produce a 2nd run of these amazing dice.  

Does this project offer anything new from the 1st project?

Yes!!!  

I will now be offering these amazing dice in the lightweight yet strong material of ...

Titanium!


I will also be offering for the first time d6 dice with Numerals!

Anodized Aluminum, Steel, Brass, and Copper Solid Numeral Dice

Anodized Aluminum, Titanium, Brass, and Copper Floating Numeral Dice


What if I want more dice?

Indiegogo only lets you indicate one perk with your pledge, but you can still overpledge for additional dice now.  Once the campaign ends, the amount you overpledged will be converted into credit. I will be using Backerkit post-campaign to manage orders, credits, and add-ons.

You don't HAVE to overpledge now: you can wait until AFTER the campaign ends to add-on more dice via Backerkit (you will have to enter your credit card again).

When you are pledging and choosing your reward please choose the highest reward 1st then increase your pledge by the amount of the lower perk level(s) or by the amount shown in the Add-On Chart (below).

How do I select what Color(s), Type(s), and Style(s) of Dice that I want?

After the Project is successful and has ended you will all receive invites to Backerkit.

Backerkit is a post project system that will allow you to select the Color, Style, and Type of every dice that you order! 

You can also add more dice if you wish.

Precision Metal Dice! 

Your Contributions will go toward purchase the raw metal alloys and to commission a machine shop or two to make these unique dice in bulk.

These dice can not be molded.  They can only be machined from solid metal one at a time.  This ensures that each dice is perfectly balanced with no blemishes.  Each side has equal amounts of material machined from it to ensure Perfect Balance!

The Rewards you get for your contributions will be these wonderful dice themselves.  Choose from Anodized Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Brass, Copper, and/or Titanium.  Choose the style of Solid or Floating and the Type - Pips and/or Numerals.

The size of every dice will be 16mm.


The Anodized Aluminum Color Choices are seen below as well as Pink (not shown).

Purple, Orange, Yellow, Clear/Silver, Black, Green(Will be darker Forrest Green), Blue, and Red

Anodized Aluminum - Brass, Copper, & Stainless Steel


Anodized Blanks

Machining Floating Feature

Machining Pips


Anodized Aluminum Solid Dice

Floating Brass, Copper, and Stainless Steel - Also Available In Titanium



Anodized Aluminum Floating Dice

Brass, Copper, and Stainless Steel - Also Available In Titanium




Interactive 3D Model of the Floating Face Pips Design



Interactive 3D Model of the Floating Face Numeral Design


The Impact

Your contributions will be able to help me kickstart my business of designing unique products!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the links to this page on your social media pages so you have a better chance of these dice being funded!

Share on Facebook

story:
Short Summary

Okay so basically, I'm monky.

Aventador. Hot Wheels. Me want.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Hot wheels car Aventador 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Well an Aventador hot wheels model costs £4.99 on ebay so yeah your contribution will help me buy one please and thank you. 

Risks & Challenges

If I get no funds I won't be able to buy my hot wheels Aventador and my family will die.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Make some noise about your campaign, use your finsta.
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools!

That's all there is to it.

story:
Can you draw upon the power of the speaking stones, and prepare for the upcoming battle against Tenebris? Build your team to suit your strategy, and defeat your opponents in this skirmish style card game for 2-6 players!

 

The Stonebound Saga comes with:

1 25"X35" Game board

147 Card Resource Deck in Tuckbox

140 Card Character Abilities Deck in Tuckbox

70 Character Cards

12 Character Dashboards with moving sliders

72 Wooden pegs

110 Status Effect tokens

2 Pair of D10 Dice

28 Card 'Expansion Sampler'

1 Rulebook

In the Stonebound Saga you and your opponent control a group of 'Stonebound'; those from the world of Telios who have responded to the 'Speaking Stones'. These Speaking Stones began humming and pulsing when the lost city of Lux reappeared after disappearing thousands of years ago. Those who respond to the stones and hone their power become known as Stonebound. These stones are equipped to their weapons and armor to enable feats of incredible power and skill unlike anything the world has seen.

Players pre-construct or draft teams of Stonebound who are training against each other in preparation for an impending battle against a force known as Tenebris.

Players track their character's stats and abilities using dashboards with sliders to track dynamic stats and pegs to track activated abilities. Each Stonebound comes with two ability cards that are placed into each dashboard.

 

There are 70 unique characters for players to choose their teams from spanning 7 different character classes. Below you'll find descriptions and examples of Stonebound from each class.

 

 

 

Between all of the characters in The Stonebound Saga they have close to 300 unique abilities many of which can inflict various status effects. There are 11 different status effects to build your strategy around!

Each character comes with two ability cards based from the elements of speaking stones equipped to their weapons and armor. The bottom left corner of each character card indicates which element of speaking stones are for offensive abilities, and the bottom right corner for defensive abilities.

 

 

The game is played on a large grid-based gameboard spanning 25" X 35". On each player's turn they will strategically move their characters across the battlefield to outwit and overwhelm their opponents. 

 

Throughout the game, players will use speaking stone cards drawn from a community resource deck in order to perform various abilities in battle. Players will need to manage their resources effectively by choosing when to use their resources for offense or dedicate resources for passive defensive abilities that count against their hand size.

 

The Stonebound Saga is a great mix of unit positioning and strategy requiring each player to carefully plan their turns and manage their resources to achieve victory against their opponent. The numerous and diverse characters allow for a variety of play styles, and every match is an unique experience.

Games can be played between 2 players, or with teams of 2 or 3. The first player, or team to defeat their opponent's Stonebound by bringing their HP to zero is the winner.

 

 

From everyone at Sky Kingdom Games - Thank you for your support!

 

Games will be shipped out immediately at the completion of this campaign! We have a limited amount left from our first print run so once they are gone this title will not be available until late next year!

story:
Assembling your escape ship requires both skill and willingness to push your luck if you have any chance of escaping. Working alone or with your friend, you must use your time and commands wisely, or else you will run out of time.

Assembly is quick to learn, fast and eminently replayable; there’s plenty of variation for repeated attempts and the variable difficulty levels allows you to scale the game to suit you. 

Assembly was designed with both solo and 2-player game modes in mind from the beginning. The only difference in gameplay is that secret information and (optional) communication limits are added into the mix for 2-players. You can even play entirely with hand gestures!

Assembly has been created by indie publisher Wren Games, the wife and husband team Janice and Stu Turner. Short Summary

 

Note: Photos show handmade prototype components and mini-sized cards. The final version of Assembly will contain standard bridge-sized cards.

Note: Photos show handmade prototype components and mini-sized cards. The final version of Assembly will contain standard bridge-sized cards.

 

Glitches Expansion

Note: This expansion is only included at the 'Advanced Escape' pledge tier or higher.

 

You must fully assemble the spaceship that lies in front of you in order to escape by locking each module into its correct bay before you can escape!  

Working either alone or with a friend, you will take turns to manipulate the modules around the assembly line towards their correct bays. 

Unfortunately, the ship’s computer isn’t going to make your life easy, and just as you think you're a step ahead she'll throw a spanner in the works.  

There are multiple versions of the 2-player game allowing you to customise the game, ranging from simply not being able to reveal the cards in your hand, to playing in silence, only using hand gestures. 

Sounds easy? You might be in for a surprise!

Assembly's turn order is:

  1. Choose a Command card to play;
  2. Verify it (2-players only);
  3. Execute your chosen command;
  4. Apply any resultant effects;
  5. Draw up to hand limit.

And there are just 4 commands to remember:

Watch How to Play the Solo version with Ricky Royal at Box of Delights.

Watch a Quick Overview with Janice at Wren Games (note: prototype components).

Playing with 2?

Watch How to Play the 2-player version with Rahdo Runs-Through.

Each time you need to refresh the Command deck (when you can't draw a card), you must first Scramble the Bay (Blueprint) cards.

After scrambling, add one of the set-aside Command cards to the discard pile and shuffle the deck to create a new draw pile.

 

Glitches Expansion

The Glitches add an extra dimension to Assembly; it gives the computer the ability to actively disrupt your escape attempts. This expansion will increase the replayability of Assembly and will ramp up the difficulty. This expansion also includes 4 new Malfunction sets and 1 new Role card.

But what are Glitches?

With the Glitches expansion, when you refresh the Command deck, you must add a Glitch card to it as well as one of the set-aside Command cards. Glitch cards allow you to chose their outcome, between two undesirable effects of course! When you draw a Glitch card, you must resolve its effect immediately.

 

 

Add-ons are available in our pledge manager.

Multiple Copies

If you'd like to purchase more than 1 copy of Assembly, simply add them as an Extra in our pledge manager.

Premium Neoprene Play Mat, £20

2mm thick, 25x25 inch (635x635 mm)  neoprene play may.

T-Shirt, £19

 Note: Design, sizes and fit of the T-shirt are still being finalised.

Coasters, £4 for a set of 4

Note: Every backer at the Advanced Escape pledge level or higher will automatically get 1 of these coasters included with their reward.

Zinc Alloy Die, £4

The die shown in the graphic above is missing the coloured numbers because the factory add in the colour we choose. We have decided to ask them for a cream that will match the game so the final die will be a dark blue zinc alloy with cream numbers.

The best way to find out if you like a game is to play it. You can download and read the draft rules, play Assembly digitally or print it out and make your own copy. Just follow these links:

  • Draft Rules (Base Game)
  • Draft Rules (Glitches Expansion) 
  • Low Ink Print and Play 
  • Solo setup on Tabletopia 
  • 2-player setup on Tabletopia 

Note: You do not need an account to play Assembly on Tabletopia. Due to setup limits, these versions do not include Malfunctions - if you want to try them, please download the PnP files.

We continue to welcome constructive feedback on Assembly. It's at least 95% complete but we're happy to make mods and tweaks if it'll make the game better. We want you to have the best possible game we can make.

“Loved the game; a fiendish puzzle that will delight any soloist looking for a compact quick challenge. It’s a game you can keep playing for its simple ruleset and quick play time. It’s a big thumbs up from me.” Watch it.

 

"[Assembly]’s a lovely little design. It’s a fun fast puzzle of a game that’s tight and compact and has a Hanabi feeling. It's a sharp, sweet, fun little coop game." Watch it.

“Overall, I think Assembly is a lot of fun! If you’re looking for a fun solo puzzle, this is definitely it, but if you’re looking for a very strategic two-player cooperative puzzle, this will likely satisfy that part of your collective brain as well. I’d recommend at either player count. One thing that I particularly like is how clear and distinguishable the symbols on the Room Modules are so that players don’t have to rely on color (or their perception of color) to be able to effectively play the game. There are a lot of good design elements at play. I’m a fan.”  Read More.

"I highly recommend checking out the Kickstarter campaign as this is a game that I can honestly say I love everything about – the replayability; the wonderful quality of the wooden tokens; the gameplay; the exhilaration that comes with trying to beat the clock; learning to communicate differently and more effectively with my fellow players; literally everything!" Read More.

More Reviews:

  • Ann at Cards or Die
  • Rebecca at To Play is Human
  • Dave at Go Fatherhood
  • Joshua at Logan Chops Reviews
  • David at Cardboard Clash
  • Lindsay at Shiny Happy Meeples

Other related links include:

  • PC Gamer Article: Ten Best Kickstarters at the UKGE 2018
  • Interview with Janice by Girls Play Games
  • Interview with Wren Games by Cardboard Clash
  • Interview with Wren Games by Shiny Happy Meeple
  • Guest Blog about Designing Solo at BSoMT
  • Janice talks to Nathan and Alex on Delve Cast
  • Janice talks to Cathy on Our Turn Podcast
  • Janice talks to Richard on We're Not Wizards
  • Rahdo walks around the UKGE and spots Assembly!

We know shipping can be quite a contentious issue and we have thought long and hard about how to best meet the needs of our backers whilst also minimising our risk. We have therefore decided to use a pledge manager and charge shipping after the campaign and will be using a fulfilment partner to ship rewards. This allows us to to mitigate the risk of the highly variable shipping costs between different regions whilst also ensuring that you aren't negatively impacted by our estimates being off. See our FAQ for more info. 

However, we know you want certainty; we know we would. Therefore we will be as open and transparent as we can with regards to shipping, which will be based on actual cost. See each of the individual pledge levels for shipping costs.

Canada

The Advanced Escape pledge level is Canada friendly, however if you plan to purchase additional copies, the play mat or T-shirt, please contact us so we can let you know if your pledge will remain Canada friendly. See our FAQ or contact us for more details.

Retailers

Please message us if you are interested in purchasing multiple copies for your shop and we'll let you know how you can buy (crate size 12). 

Note: Only the Assembly base game will be available at retail.

Still not sure whether to back Assembly? Then read on!

Assembly was originally designed as a BGG Mint Tin Design Contest entry in 2016 where it came 3rd out of 26 entries for the Most Innovative Mechanic. Since then, we have been refining the gameplay as well as adding extra content to maximise replayability. 

But why should you help us make Assembly a reality?

Quick & Easy to Learn

We've kept things as simple, intuitive and thematic in Assembly. Additionally, key rules are included on player aids so you won’t have to refer to the rule book mid-game (one of our pet hates)! 

Plays Equally Well at Both Player Counts

Whether you are a solo gamer or a cooperative gamer, Assembly has been iteratively refined and tested at both player counts. We believe the solo experience should be as good as those at higher player counts (minus the player interactions!) and vice versa.

Replay Value

Assembly at its heart is a thematic puzzle and by its nature every puzzle will be slightly different. There are also multiple ways to scale the difficulty both up and down. Finally, there are mini-expansions in the form of Malfunctions. These change the parameters of the puzzle, influencing your win strategy. And if you want even more replay value, add the Glitches expansion to your pledge!

 Follow Us!

  • Twitter: @Dravvin (Janice) and @WrenGames
  • Facebook
  • Instagram
  • Web

Who are we?

Wren games is a wife and husband team based in the UK.  We first got into tabletop gaming over 5 years ago with Pandemic being the game that got us hooked. We are also avid Kickstarter supporters and our games collection is almost exclusive coop/solo games as these are our passion.

We first started designing games over 2 years ago when Janice was on maternity leave with our eldest daughter, Amelie. Assembly is our first game on Kickstarter so you have every right to be suspicious of us as a new publisher but please read on to find out why we think we can do it and why you should trust us.

Janice is a frequent cooperative gamer and occasional solo gamer. She's the lead designer of Assembly, with Assembly being her second game design. Janice is also a qualified professional Project and Product Manager with most of her experience lying in high-tech, high value products. She's taken several products from an idea through to manufacture, including inventing her own technology as part of her PhD. Although board game manufacture is new to us, the process is not unfamiliar to Janice. As an added bonus, she is currently on maternity leave with our youngest daughter, Sammie, so doesn't have the distraction of work to get in the way (just the distraction of kids!). 

Stu is an ex-teacher turned software engineer. He got the family started on the hobby of collecting and playing modern boardgames and loves to paint minatures. Stu is also the big solo gamer amongst the two of us. He has pretty high standards for solo games and has extensively tested and helped to develop both the solo and 2-player variants for Assembly over the past 2 and a bit years. He also has a knack for attention for detail, so if you spot any mistakes, it's his fault ;-)

Amelie is the eldest of our two daughters. She has a pretty decent dice and large meeple collection and loves 'reorganising' our game design bits and bobs. Already an avid gamer, her favourite games are Beasts of Balance and My First Orchard.

Sammie is the newest arrival to Wren Games, she is currently undergoing indoctrination about loving boardgames by her older sister and we're sure she will also turn into a little gamer in the not too distant future. For now though, she much prefers chewing electrical cables.

Inca the cat has shown little interest in board games. He doesn't even like boxes! Inca tends to keep to himself other than bringing us the occasional present of a (live) mouse or rat and then sitting and watching us try to catch it. He is however the star of one of our potential future games.

Risks & Challenges

So we're a new publisher, why should you trust us?

Risk 1: Can We Do It? 
Janice is an experience and qualified Project and Product Manager with over 10 years of industry experience (AMP-PQ / IPMA Level C). She has delivered multi-million pound high-tech projects on time and on budget. In comparison, this project is pretty small and she will be using her PM knowledge and expertise to manage it from kick-off to completion and beyond.

Risk 2: Manufacture - Quality 
To reduce the risk of poor quality, incorrect components, etc. we have chosen to manufacture all elements of this project in Europe. This will ensure that not only the required safety standards are met but also with our manufacturers in (almost) the same time zone as us it will make communication much easier and more efficient. It also has the added bonus that we are supporting fairly paid workers and local/small businesses.

Risk 3: Manufacture - On Time Delivery 
The delivery date of this project is not based on a 'best case' scenario. We have provided what is a realistic timeline based upon certain risks occurring (such as being bumped in manufacture due to being a small publisher in the lead-up to Essen, national holidays, etc.). However, we will be working to, and driving our suppliers to the optimum delivery schedule. We want to be realistic with you about what our schedule could be and will keep you updated every step of the way.

The Small Print

We hope that shipping will go perfectly for everyone but there's always a small chance that it won't so here's what we will do about it:

Lost and returned shipments will only be resent once. If you do not receive them the second time we will instead offer you: 

If we are at fault (i.e. lost shipment): A full refund of your pledge and shipping. 

If you are at fault (i.e. wrong address, didn’t collect, etc.): A full refund (minus fees) of your pledge only. 

We will reserve your pledge for 3 months from the date of receipt of games from our manufacturer or from the final call for address and shipping payments (this will be clearly labelled), whichever is later. If you have not provided us information/payment in order for us to ship your pledge to you: we will continue to attempt to contact you by all means available to us for 1 month after this deadline. After this point we will assume that you do not want your pledge and will put your pledge into our retail stock (storage costs us money!). However, if you contact us after this point and:

We have stock and receive shipping payment at the current rate, we will fulfil your pledge as ordered. 

We can only fulfil part of your pledge, we will give you the offer of fulfilment of as much of your pledge as possible plus a refund of any items that we cannot fulfil (minus fees) OR a full refund (minus fees).

We do not have any stock, we will offer you a full refund (minus fees). -

Missing and/or damaged components will be shipped out to you free of charge. Components lost or damaged by you will be replaced (if we have stock) but will attract a small charge to cover our costs.

You will have have 12 months from the date of shipment to lodge any complaints or issues with regards to the goods being received.

Mike Jessup is a good friend of Janice and Stu's. Mike by day is an engineer and by night an artist and gamer. The blueprint art that you see throughout Assembly is his work.

For most of the icons used, we are indebted to the wonderful resources provided by game-icons.net and thenounproject.org. They are some of the best online resources for game designers! 

And finally, a huge thank-you to al our playtesters and previewers who have helped to bring some attention to the fact that Assembly exists. We will be forever grateful to you all :)

Unfortunately, the ship’s computer isn’t going to make your life easy, and just as you think you're a step ahead she'll throw a spanner in the works.  
There are multiple versions of the 2-player game allowing you to customise the game, ranging from simply not being able to reveal the cards in your hand, to playing in silence, only using hand gestures. 
Sounds easy? You might be in for a surprise!

Assembly's turn order is:

Choose a Command card to play;
Verify it (2-players only);
Execute your chosen command;
Apply any resultant effects;
Draw up to hand limit.

And there are just 4 commands to remember:

Watch How to Play the Solo version with Ricky Royal at Box of Delights.
Watch a Quick Overview with Janice at Wren Games (note: prototype components).
Playing with 2?

Watch How to Play the 2-player version with Rahdo Runs-Through.

Each time you need to refresh the Command deck (when you can't draw a card), you must first Scramble the Bay (Blueprint) cards. After scrambling, add one of the set-aside Command cards to the discard pile and shuffle the deck to create a new draw pile.

 
Glitches Expansion


The Glitches add an extra dimension to Assembly; it gives the computer the ability to actively disrupt your escape attempts. This expansion will increase the replayability of Assembly and will ramp up the difficulty. This expansion also includes 4 new Malfunction sets and 1 new Role card.
But what are Glitches?
With the Glitches expansion, when you refresh the Command deck, you must add a Glitch card to it as well as one of the set-aside Command cards. Glitch cards allow you to chose their outcome, between two undesirable effects of course! When you draw a Glitch card, you must resolve its effect immediately.


 



 


Add-ons are available in our pledge manager.

Multiple Copies
If you'd like to purchase more than 1 copy of Assembly, simply add them as an Extra in our pledge manager.
Premium Neoprene Play Mat, £20
2mm thick, 25x25 inch (635x635 mm)  neoprene play may.


T-Shirt, £19

 Note: Design, sizes and fit of the T-shirt are still being finalised.
Coasters, £4 for a set of 4
Note: Every backer at the Advanced Escape pledge level or higher will automatically get 1 of these coasters included with their reward.

Zinc Alloy Die, £4
The die shown in the graphic above is missing the coloured numbers because the factory add in the colour we choose. We have decided to ask them for a cream that will match the game so the final die will be a dark blue zinc alloy with cream numbers.


The best way to find out if you like a game is to play it. You can download and read the draft rules, play Assembly digitally or print it out and make your own copy. Just follow these links:

Draft Rules (Base Game)
Draft Rules (Glitches Expansion) 
Low Ink Print and Play 

Solo setup on Tabletopia 

2-player setup on Tabletopia 

Note: You do not need an account to play Assembly on Tabletopia. Due to setup limits, these versions do not include Malfunctions - if you want to try them, please download the PnP files.
We continue to welcome constructive feedback on Assembly. It's at least 95% complete but we're happy to make mods and tweaks if it'll make the game better. We want you to have the best possible game we can make.


“Loved the game; a fiendish puzzle that will delight any soloist looking for a compact quick challenge. It’s a game you can keep playing for its simple ruleset and quick play time. It’s a big thumbs up from me.” Watch it.
 
"[Assembly]’s a lovely little design. It’s a fun fast puzzle of a game that’s tight and compact and has a Hanabi feeling. It's a sharp, sweet, fun little coop game." Watch it.

“Overall, I think Assembly is a lot of fun! If you’re looking for a fun solo puzzle, this is definitely it, but if you’re looking for a very strategic two-player cooperative puzzle, this will likely satisfy that part of your collective brain as well. I’d recommend at either player count. One thing that I particularly like is how clear and distinguishable the symbols on the Room Modules are so that players don’t have to rely on color (or their perception of color) to be able to effectively play the game. There are a lot of good design elements at play. I’m a fan.”  Read More.

"I highly recommend checking out the Kickstarter campaign as this is a game that I can honestly say I love everything about – the replayability; the wonderful quality of the wooden tokens; the gameplay; the exhilaration that comes with trying to beat the clock; learning to communicate differently and more effectively with my fellow players; literally everything!" Read More.
More Reviews:

Ann at Cards or Die
Rebecca at To Play is Human
Dave at Go Fatherhood
Joshua at Logan Chops Reviews
David at Cardboard Clash
Lindsay at Shiny Happy Meeples

Other related links include:

PC Gamer Article: Ten Best Kickstarters at the UKGE 2018

Interview with Janice by Girls Play Games

Interview with Wren Games by Cardboard Clash

Interview with Wren Games by Shiny Happy Meeple
Guest Blog about Designing Solo at BSoMT
Janice talks to Nathan and Alex on Delve Cast
Janice talks to Cathy on Our Turn Podcast

Janice talks to Richard on We're Not Wizards


Rahdo walks around the UKGE and spots Assembly!



We know shipping can be quite a contentious issue and we have thought long and hard about how to best meet the needs of our backers whilst also minimising our risk. We have therefore decided to use a pledge manager and charge shipping after the campaign and will be using a fulfilment partner to ship rewards. This allows us to to mitigate the risk of the highly variable shipping costs between different regions whilst also ensuring that you aren't negatively impacted by our estimates being off. See our FAQ for more info. 

However, we know you want certainty; we know we would. Therefore we will be as open and transparent as we can with regards to shipping, which will be based on actual cost. See each of the individual pledge levels for shipping costs.
Canada
The Advanced Escape pledge level is Canada friendly, however if you plan to purchase additional copies, the play mat or T-shirt, please contact us so we can let you know if your pledge will remain Canada friendly. See our FAQ or contact us for more details.
Retailers
Please message us if you are interested in purchasing multiple copies for your shop and we'll let you know how you can buy (crate size 12). 
Note: Only the Assembly base game will be available at retail.

Still not sure whether to back Assembly? Then read on!
Assembly was originally designed as a BGG Mint Tin Design Contest entry in 2016 where it came 3rd out of 26 entries for the Most Innovative Mechanic. Since then, we have been refining the gameplay as well as adding extra content to maximise replayability. 
But why should you help us make Assembly a reality?
Quick & Easy to Learn
We've kept things as simple, intuitive and thematic in Assembly. Additionally, key rules are included on player aids so you won’t have to refer to the rule book mid-game (one of our pet hates)! 
Plays Equally Well at Both Player Counts
Whether you are a solo gamer or a cooperative gamer, Assembly has been iteratively refined and tested at both player counts. We believe the solo experience should be as good as those at higher player counts (minus the player interactions!) and vice versa.
Replay Value
Assembly at its heart is a thematic puzzle and by its nature every puzzle will be slightly different. There are also multiple ways to scale the difficulty both up and down. Finally, there are mini-expansions in the form of Malfunctions. These change the parameters of the puzzle, influencing your win strategy. And if you want even more replay value, add the Glitches expansion to your pledge!

 Follow Us!

Twitter: @Dravvin (Janice) and @WrenGames

Facebook
Instagram
Web


Who are we?
Wren games is a wife and husband team based in the UK.  We first got into tabletop gaming over 5 years ago with Pandemic being the game that got us hooked. We are also avid Kickstarter supporters and our games collection is almost exclusive coop/solo games as these are our passion.
We first started designing games over 2 years ago when Janice was on maternity leave with our eldest daughter, Amelie. Assembly is our first game on Kickstarter so you have every right to be suspicious of us as a new publisher but please read on to find out why we think we can do it and why you should trust us.

Janice is a frequent cooperative gamer and occasional solo gamer. She's the lead designer of Assembly, with Assembly being her second game design. Janice is also a qualified professional Project and Product Manager with most of her experience lying in high-tech, high value products. She's taken several products from an idea through to manufacture, including inventing her own technology as part of her PhD. Although board game manufacture is new to us, the process is not unfamiliar to Janice. As an added bonus, she is currently on maternity leave with our youngest daughter, Sammie, so doesn't have the distraction of work to get in the way (just the distraction of kids!). 
Stu is an ex-teacher turned software engineer. He got the family started on the hobby of collecting and playing modern boardgames and loves to paint minatures. Stu is also the big solo gamer amongst the two of us. He has pretty high standards for solo games and has extensively tested and helped to develop both the solo and 2-player variants for Assembly over the past 2 and a bit years. He also has a knack for attention for detail, so if you spot any mistakes, it's his fault ;-)
Amelie is the eldest of our two daughters. She has a pretty decent dice and large meeple collection and loves 'reorganising' our game design bits and bobs. Already an avid gamer, her favourite games are Beasts of Balance and My First Orchard.
Sammie is the newest arrival to Wren Games, she is currently undergoing indoctrination about loving boardgames by her older sister and we're sure she will also turn into a little gamer in the not too distant future. For now though, she much prefers chewing electrical cables.
Inca the cat has shown little interest in board games. He doesn't even like boxes! Inca tends to keep to himself other than bringing us the occasional present of a (live) mouse or rat and then sitting and watching us try to catch it. He is however the star of one of our potential future games.
Risks & Challenges

So we're a new publisher, why should you trust us?
Risk 1: Can We Do It? Janice is an experience and qualified Project and Product Manager with over 10 years of industry experience (AMP-PQ / IPMA Level C). She has delivered multi-million pound high-tech projects on time and on budget. In comparison, this project is pretty small and she will be using her PM knowledge and expertise to manage it from kick-off to completion and beyond.
Risk 2: Manufacture - Quality To reduce the risk of poor quality, incorrect components, etc. we have chosen to manufacture all elements of this project in Europe. This will ensure that not only the required safety standards are met but also with our manufacturers in (almost) the same time zone as us it will make communication much easier and more efficient. It also has the added bonus that we are supporting fairly paid workers and local/small businesses.
Risk 3: Manufacture - On Time Delivery The delivery date of this project is not based on a 'best case' scenario. We have provided what is a realistic timeline based upon certain risks occurring (such as being bumped in manufacture due to being a small publisher in the lead-up to Essen, national holidays, etc.). However, we will be working to, and driving our suppliers to the optimum delivery schedule. We want to be realistic with you about what our schedule could be and will keep you updated every step of the way.

The Small Print
We hope that shipping will go perfectly for everyone but there's always a small chance that it won't so here's what we will do about it:
Lost and returned shipments will only be resent once. If you do not receive them the second time we will instead offer you: 
If we are at fault (i.e. lost shipment): A full refund of your pledge and shipping. 
If you are at fault (i.e. wrong address, didn’t collect, etc.): A full refund (minus fees) of your pledge only. 
We will reserve your pledge for 3 months from the date of receipt of games from our manufacturer or from the final call for address and shipping payments (this will be clearly labelled), whichever is later. If you have not provided us information/payment in order for us to ship your pledge to you: we will continue to attempt to contact you by all means available to us for 1 month after this deadline. After this point we will assume that you do not want your pledge and will put your pledge into our retail stock (storage costs us money!). However, if you contact us after this point and:
We have stock and receive shipping payment at the current rate, we will fulfil your pledge as ordered. 
We can only fulfil part of your pledge, we will give you the offer of fulfilment of as much of your pledge as possible plus a refund of any items that we cannot fulfil (minus fees) OR a full refund (minus fees).
We do not have any stock, we will offer you a full refund (minus fees). -
Missing and/or damaged components will be shipped out to you free of charge. Components lost or damaged by you will be replaced (if we have stock) but will attract a small charge to cover our costs.
You will have have 12 months from the date of shipment to lodge any complaints or issues with regards to the goods being received.

Mike Jessup is a good friend of Janice and Stu's. Mike by day is an engineer and by night an artist and gamer. The blueprint art that you see throughout Assembly is his work.
For most of the icons used, we are indebted to the wonderful resources provided by game-icons.net and thenounproject.org. They are some of the best online resources for game designers! 
And finally, a huge thank-you to al our playtesters and previewers who have helped to bring some attention to the fact that Assembly exists. We will be forever grateful to you all :)

story:
Thats right! Just share MatchBreaker on social media to receive a FREE foil Contestant card with your selected physical reward. Use these links to spread the word on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram.

 

 

Wanna know more? Click here to view the full instructions.

 

 

Our future's so bright we've gotta wear shades! We've included the following stretch goals in case our project exceeds our funding goal - and we sure hope it does! Because we'll be adding new Contestant cards to every copy of the game at the following levels.

Complete the following Social Challenges and we'll be adding even MORE Contestants to MatchBreaker! Use these links to follow us on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram and unlock the Pop Diva, Euro Hunk, and BEAR!

 

 

See what people are saying about MatchBreaker!

 

 

 

 

 

MatchBreaker is the brainchild of Bill Northcott. That’s me! The guy writing this! I’m a career animator, I’ve worked on some stuff you might have heard of - Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Kung fu Panda, Fallout 4. I started doodling my plans for MatchBreaker in my off time over 12 months ago, and then made it my sole focus at the start of this year. That was when I pulled in some help! Various friends have joined the MatchBreaker team, bringing expertise in playtesting, kickstarter bizniz, manufacturing and shipping. With our forces combined we toiled and playtested and ate pizza until MatchBreaker was PERFECT. We can’t wait to get it into your hands! You and your friends are going to LOVE it, and that’s all the reward we need for our hard work! (That and for you to back us of course!) 

 

Shipping to USA and Australia is FREE! Shipping to the rest of the world is minimal. We've partnered with a professional shipping agent to ensure quick easy delivery no matter where you're located. Did I mention we're EU friendly? Well we are!

The entire Candy Burger team has been put on a heavily regimented diet and exercise schedule to achieve peak performance. Every member has completed a regulation Rubik’s cube under WCA conditions while being able to recite pi to 8 decimal points (3.141592653, count the number of digits. It is 9. We always exceed the minimum requirements).

International manufacturing and shipping agreements defining all costs and responsibilities have been reached. Like a tiger in a cage ready to be unleashed, running over a Siberian tundra with the sun rising in the distance and Wham blasting, our manufacturing partners are ready to print, pack and ship your cards just as soon as you say go.

Not only are we physically, mentally and emotionally primed for anything this campaign can throw at us we have also taken the necessary steps to prepare for complete social upheaval. With an undisclosed underground location in the Australian desert prepared with solar and wind power, batteries, celebrity chefs, food, water, ventilation, Bon Jovi records, satellite uplinks and down links, gaming PC’s (for work stuff), weights, cardio equipment and Rubik’s cubes. Nothing will stop us from keeping in contact with backers or completing our mission; to deliver the best damn retro 80’s themed dating card game to the world.

story:
Hi, my name is Flavius Daniel and im a very smart game designer.

I personally love chess and i think chess is a great game to play for kids or even for adults.

The thing about chess is that it has been analyzed for many years, by chess grandmasters, chess professionals or even chess amateurs like myself and the chess game has almost become a repetitive and forced moves game, where the openings and early/late game blunders have a very important role if not critical in the chess game.

So i have decided to add a bit of fun to this great game that i love and make chess fans enjoy the game of chess by adding a expansion and overall innovate the chess game, that in my opinion its another great way for kids to learn chess.

I managed this by mixing the chess game with cards and make it even more exciting to play and overall adding more fun to it.

We made it easy to play and easy to understand and that is important for us because we also focused on making it for kids to enjoy. 

The chess expansion requires a bit of intelligence since we are focused more into the complex games and simple games are not our style.

Overall chess do require some intelligence and strategy so if you are a chess player you will not find it more complex than already is, but there is a twist to it.

To play the chess expansion you will only need the basic chess board, but don't worry if you do not have one, because you can even play it online with your friends.

You will just need the expansion set and you are ready to go.

By that of course we mean the rule book, chess cards and plenty hours of fun!

Revealing A bit of the core gameplay of the expansion and what is different from normal chess

Well there is a big difference since we added a core feature that was never done before: Cards.

I had this idea for some time but i never had the time to focus on it to actually make it happen.

But as i played chess and watched many grandmasters playing, i understood there is many aspects of this game that make it less enjoyable or even limits the people that will choose to become chess professionals.

  • Chess game have been studied for over 100 years and there is little about the chess game that is not know about (that makes it more repetitive and more focused on counter play).
  • Chess game has become more of a positional chess and require a high understanding of the chess openings (and there are hundred of openings variations).
  • The modern chess engines.

I think the chess game needs a change or a improvement, and we have been able to come up with a great idea to innovate the chess game by adding cards feature and make more people enjoy and be interested in playing this awesome game.

How is more different from the actual chess game and how the gameplay system works?

For kids, game of chess is about having fun and not about mastering the immense variety of openings and about positional chess, so in the expansion there will be no need to worry about openings (players will be able to play their openings as they like), without need to play positional chess.

In the chess expansion, players will be able to win by making secret missions, but also players  have to be careful to not be checkmated while doing that and also to discover what their opponent secret mission is, and prevent it from happening.

What we planning for chess fans and what is our goal

Our goal is to make kids and chess players have fun like never before.

Just to make clear, we dont plan on changing the classical chess but rather we want to make it more interesting and more enjoyable.

We think Chess Expansion: The card game will make kids to play the game of chess better and develop their understanding of chess in a creative way.

We are also planning on making a Mobile chess app where players can interact and play chess.

The Chess App

Featuring Chess Club and Scholastic Center of Saint Louis "Sinquefield Cup: Ultimate Moves" we are excited to build the first ever Chess app to make chess players have allot of fun and play chess like never before.

Some core features of our chess app: Featuring "Ultimate Moves with Garry Kasparov " Our Mobile Chess App will allow you to play 2 vs 2 players mode and from 5 up to 10 players team modes.

From amateur to Grandmaster AI with different levels of difficulty to play, our chess app is set to showcase Grandmaster AI like Garry Kasparov, Magnus Carlsen and much more.

We are also planning on adding old Grandmaster AI like Fisher, Mikhail tal, and Alekhine.

We are also thinking on adding a innovative (never done before) AI Reality* where you can see your AI opponent and his facial expressions in real time for the entire match.

But that is not all, we are planning on adding a Dungeons and Dragons mode where you will go trough adventures, and face one of a kind Bosses that will test your chess skills. We are also planning on making it possible to play D&D chess style together with your friends where your move and as well as your friends can decide the outcome of the game.

Make missions, earn chess points, save beautiful princesses, play together with friends and in teams, play vs legendary grandmasters, and much, much more. The game of chess never been this fun.

Of course, we need your help to make this happen. We are planning on making more then a chess app, we are planning to make a world of chess, innovative, brilliant, and amazingly fun.

We are planning on making tutorial videos even for the new chess players, in cooperation with chess international grandmasters so they can easily understand the game.

Right now this is just a project and with your help it can become a reality.

 

We are MindSIEntertainment

A team formed from myself Flavius Daniel and my 3 brothers Flavius Samuel, Flavius Petru and Flavius Iuliaan.

We want to innovate and make intelligent and fun games, not just for kids but for teenagers also.

We think making games its an art.

Our ideas are always original ideas of our own, because we like to be original and overall that is smart.

We have some great game projects and our goal is to innovate, improve and make the best games ever.

 

 

What do we need?

We need approximately 5000 $ to print the cards and also to make sure Chess Expansion: the card game and Chess Expansion: The party card game will deliver to you as soon as possible.

The money will go to:

  • Making sure you will have the best artwork and design.
  • Printing and packaging.
  • Shipping/Delivery costs.

Every extra funding we get from this campaign will go to create the - one of a kind, chess app and towards starting our other awesome game projects.

Of course, we will add some awesome stretch goals as soon our campaign will be almost fully funded.

We decided to keep it simple and give away only the Chess Expansions, but we are planning to add more perks along the way.

 

 

 

Questions and answers

 

  • When does the "Chess expansion: The card game" will start shipping?  We expect to start shipping the game most early sometime between August and September this year.
  • When does the "Chess expansion: The ultimate party card game" will start shipping?  We expect to start shipping the game most early sometime in September this year.
  • Do MindSIEntertainment offer discounts for business owners on high demands or for multiple purchases?  Yes. We do offer a special discount for business owners, the discount may vary depending on the amount requested (for this kind of requests we recommend you to contact us directly).

We do not offer any discounts on multiple purchases of  "Chess expansion: The card game" or "Chess expansion: The ultimate party card game" in our campaign.

  • Do MindSIEntertainment offer refunds for damaged items/parts discovered upon shipping? Our policy does not allow us to give a full refund for damaged items upon delivery, however we will take half of the responsibility and pay back 40% of the original costs (shipping costs not included).
  • Does "Chess expansion: The card game" or  "Chess expansion: The ultimate party card game" has the actual chess board included?  No. The Chess expansion sets from our campaign does not include the actual playing chess board (or any of the chess pieces).

The game of chess never been this fun.Of course, we need your help to make this happen. We are planning on making more then a chess app, we are planning to make a world of chess, innovative, brilliant, and amazingly fun.We are planning on making tutorial videos even for the new chess players, in cooperation with chess international grandmasters so they can easily understand the game.Right now this is just a project and with your help it can become a reality. We are MindSIEntertainmentA team formed from myself Flavius Daniel and my 3 brothers Flavius Samuel, Flavius Petru and Flavius Iuliaan.We want to innovate and make intelligent and fun games, not just for kids but for teenagers also.We think making games its an art.Our ideas are always original ideas of our own, because we like to be original and overall that is smart.We have some great game projects and our goal is to innovate, improve and make the best games ever.  What do we need?We need approximately 5000 $ to print the cards and also to make sure Chess Expansion: the card game and Chess Expansion: The party card game will deliver to you as soon as possible.The money will go to:
Making sure you will have the best artwork and design.
Printing and packaging.
Shipping/Delivery costs.
Every extra funding we get from this campaign will go to create the - one of a kind, chess app and towards starting our other awesome game projects.Of course, we will add some awesome stretch goals as soon our campaign will be almost fully funded.We decided to keep it simple and give away only the Chess Expansions, but we are planning to add more perks along the way.   Questions and answers 

When does the "Chess expansion: The card game" will start shipping?  We expect to start shipping the game most early sometime between August and September this year.

When does the "Chess expansion: The ultimate party card game" will start shipping?  We expect to start shipping the game most early sometime in September this year.

Do MindSIEntertainment offer discounts for business owners on high demands or for multiple purchases?  Yes. We do offer a special discount for business owners, the discount may vary depending on the amount requested (for this kind of requests we recommend you to contact us directly).
We do not offer any discounts on multiple purchases of  "Chess expansion: The card game" or "Chess expansion: The ultimate party card game" in our campaign.

Do MindSIEntertainment offer refunds for damaged items/parts discovered upon shipping? Our policy does not allow us to give a full refund for damaged items upon delivery, however we will take half of the responsibility and pay back 40% of the original costs (shipping costs not included).

Does "Chess expansion: The card game" or  "Chess expansion: The ultimate party card game" has the actual chess board included?  No. The Chess expansion sets from our campaign does not include the actual playing chess board (or any of the chess pieces).

story:
Who am I?

I’m Steven Ma from China, the author of mystery novel Red Ghost. I’m also a biggest fan of murder mystery games. I first knew murder mystery in 2011 and soon be obsessed with this kind of game. The role-playing, case solving and logic reasoning, they all get me crazy.

After playing dozens of murder mystery games, I started to write by my own. Hope we can enjoy the fun of murder mystery together!

What am I doing?

I'm raising fund for the first case of a series murder mystery game. The mystery happened in the Republic of China period and have many new things in it.

Why do I need your help?

I need your help to finish The Memento Mystery better and faster. Now I have frame of the whole story and many amazing ideas, but I can’t do it full time because I have to make a living. So I need your contribution.

What do you get?

If you contribute my project, you will get my great thank and the thank from all the possible players of The Memento Mystery (your name will be recorded in the contribution list of the game). Of course, you will get The Memento Mystery right after I finish it.

About The Memento Mystery

The nature of human may be a body filled with memories. And without memories we may be just walking dead. But can you be sure that your memories are true?

I'm offering a murder mystery happened in the Republic of China period. It’s time to make some difference now. No more last will, no more affairs, no more embezzlement…. no more these same old pattern. The Memory Mystery comes in a brand new system! Truly roleplay and crime solve, complete and meaningful story, full of fun, it’s a mystery you won’t regret after play.

Players will explore in rooms of the crime scene (showed by maps) to find clues or recall their memories. Each character has a complete story, including 4 different endings.

P.S. Host can take part in the mystery as a player.

It’s in 1913, China. The Qing Dynasty is just overthrown, and all kinds of forces are fighting each other in the ancient China. You 6 all come to an abandoned, scary and old mansion called Double Loong outside Guangzhou at night, holding your own goals. What are waiting inside? Are they ghosts, murder, truth? Or are they just your sealed memories? And what’s the connection of you 6 that rarely know each other? You will find out through the mystery.

Story

1913.12.8(the second year of Republic of China), deep autumn, Guangzhou city.

By now, China has been changed from feudalism to republic, but some people still want to go back. And in the meantime, many colonial forces are continually growing.

There is an abandoned mansion lying on a small hill outside Guangzhou city. Inside the collapsed wall, there is an old Chinese building and weeds all around. The statues that used to be amazing are now already crushed, and become home for rats.

More than a decade before, here is the most prosperous place. Party all night, full of people, and where all the people want to come. The owner of this mansion is very rich and generous to visitors. He’s crazy for collecting delicate blue and white porcelain, and once he meets some of his favorite, he will buy it no matter how high the price is. It’s said that one of his collection called ‘Blue And White Double Loong Plate’ was rewarded by an emperor from The Qing Dynasty. So the mansion is called Double Loong.

However, an unexpected disaster happened, people no longer go to Double Loong, and the mansion is abandoned since then…..

Characters

Elena: female, 19 years old, tall and slim, with curly hair. She’s a freshman in literature academy of Guangzhou Lionheart University.

Emily: female, 22 years old, with black hair, very gentle. Studying in divinity academy of Guangzhou Lionheart University.

John: male, about 25 years old, looks strong and sharp, wearing white shirt, trousers and leather shoes.

Jian Wu: male, about 20 years old. Average height and thin. Mature, like thinking.

Old Wang: male, about 40 years old. Bareheaded, little humpback, with grizzled beard and a scar on his face.

Man Without Memory: male, with tangled hair, red eyes and unkempt beard. Looks very dirty and gaunt, can’t see his age, dressed in grey gown with blood on it.

Introduction

There are 6 characters, not including detective and host. The memory mystery doesn’t need an extra host. You can add detective and host by your own depending on the situation.

What’s include

Host Guide×1，Character Booklet×6

Map, Comments, Background, Character List, Solution

Memory card×40-50

Clue card×20-30

Option card×7-10

Map

When the game start, all the players are inside Double Loong on the map. You won’t know what’s inside every room until investigation. There is a timeline blow the map for you to mark the time of the mystery (from 21:05). You can put a marker on the timeline, and move it to the next spot every 5 minutes (time of the mystery, every investigation will take 5 minutes).

Procedure

The mystery contains two parts: Investigation and Who done it.

Investigation

Location: inside Double Loong

Time: about 21:05 ~ 22:15

The structure of Character Booklet

Background

What’s happened recently (November ~ December 8th)

What’s happened before tonight (December 8th)

Outside the Double Loong

Investigation

Somebody you already know

Your behaviors

Your goals

Your memories

First of all, you should try to pick character that fit to yourself, and get the appropriate Character Booklet and Memory pack.

Then start to read your Character Booklet, from Background to your memories (stop at Don’t turn to the next page). In this part, you will learn why you are here, what you should act in Investigation and try to fulfill parts of your goals.

*The unfinished goals can be finished in next parts.

The mystery starts now. You should know each other by introduction and asking questions. Because some of the characters don’t know each other before. Then you can communicate together or fulfill your goals or act your behaviors. Always remember to role-play, you should do all these playing your own character.

Investigation

You can investigate Lobby 1st floor, Corridor and all the Room.

Investigate once in a room, the Timeline will past 5 min, and you will get a clue in the room. You should reveal the clue to others all.

Some rooms contain more than one clue, in the meantime, some contain none. If you investigate a room without clue, then you will waste a chance.

Option

You will meet options when you investigate. There is instruction for every option, and you should decide whether to make or not make the move. The decision you make will cause different events and some may cause Dangerous Accident or Sudden Time Pass.

You don’t have to make the decision immediately, you can wait later.

Memory

Every Character Booklet contains its own Key Word and corresponding Memory number. You can’t say your Key Word. When your hear one Key Word saying by another player or say it, you can get the corresponding Memory.

e.g., Character Hank’s Memory contain ‘Double Loong-Hank’s memory 05’. So, when Character Jack say the word double loong, Hank can get his Memory 05. You can’t let others see your Memory, but you can tell them or make it up.

For one Key Word, different characters will have different Memory.

Whodunnit

When the timeline pass to 22:15, all the investigation should stop. Everyone turns his/her Character Booklet to the next page and read.

Now you are at the murder scene, it’s about 22:20.

You should read this part on your Character Booklet. Open bag written Not open until 22:15 and take out two sealed bags inside. Then investigate due to the order required on your Character Booklet.

The clues you get in this part don’t have to reveal. Next you can question each other orderly, in public or privately.

Investigation Report

After several hours, when you get enough information, you should stop investigating and questioning. Then you should fill out the Investigation Report. At last, reveal everyone’s secrets and see who get the highest score and who play the best.

Endings

In the end, according to your action in the game (whether you accomplish your goals….), you will achieve an ending. You can read it on your Character Booklet, and one character has more than one ending.

Notice

You will question others or be questioned while playing. You can avoid giving real answer and making up answer according to your goals while being questioned. You can’t refuse to answer.

Some characters can’t keep lying, so you should pay attention to your action.

There are limited chances to investigate for every player. You can’t give the chances to others, so please use them carefully.
