story_txt:
We will send a survey via our pledge manager 1 - 3 weeks (est. end of september 2018) after the kickstarter's campaign ended. You could add an order for the add-on in there.
Please note that we will add shipping fee for the add-ons (including all pledge with the add-on items).What if everyone you know, loved, and remembered are just complex simulations in a computer-generated universe? What if you began to see through the shroud that separates what you think is your life from what is real? What if you wake up from this simulation, only to wonder if you are in another?Simulation Theory is a Boardgame for 1 to 6 players which combines elements of an escape room and a dungeon delve. The game has 3 major modes for different audiences from casual (17 minutes playtime) to hardcore (2+ hours). Simulation Theory is played with a combination of standees, cards, boards, and Dice. The dice are mainly used for tiebreakers.Simulation Theory was created by Mark G. Koh (Megacorp), Shawn Siow, and an international team. For the full credits, see team credits below. We put together this Kickstarter campaign because we cannot build this without you.The base game will include 3 realities, each with 5 unique characters. The 6th character per reality will be available as a stretch goal. Each of these characters has their own strengths and weakness plus a unique backstory which has a real impact in the Ultimate mode (rules and game components will update soon)Several ways to play

Casual mode: Easy to learn and teach, only 15 - 30 mins to play

Challenge mode: Additional depth for experienced players, try out a special Scenario

Competitive mode: Much more deterministic mode of the game, with fixed treasures and it relies much more on the skill of the players than a lucky topdeck or discovery

Ultimate Mode (Stretch goal): A different way to play with branching quests for each character and deterministic gameplay. Directly integrates the story and history of the different Realities together with the gameplay
Congratulations! You guys made it to unlocked "Ultimate mode - Stretch goal". In Ultimate Mode, players need to complete various quests, unique to each Character, to gain treasure and Ascend to the next Reality. Each turn, players also discover part of the story of Simulation Theory and can choose to take different actions towards one of four unique outcomes per Character.  This mode will take a much longer amount of time to play than the casual or challenge mode – we estimate around 2 hours for a full game with players that are familiar with the other modes of Simulation TheoryStretch Goal Unlocked : Ultimate ModeThis mode rules assume players are already familiar with the Challenge Mode and Comepetitive Mode rules an the basics of Simulation Theory are assumed here.SETUP 
Choose one reality. Take it's challenge deck. Find and remove the boos card, shuffle the challenge deck. Place the boss card at the center (3,3) position on the 5x5 board and fill out all the other spaces with the challenge cards face-up on the board from top to bottom, starting left to right. 
Shuffle both of coordinate decks (column and row) 
Take the top card of each coordinate deck - showing a pair of coordinates - row and column. 
Randomize the purple generic tokens face down. Take a purple generic token and place it face down (without looking at it) on that position, on top of the card occupying the card at those coordinates. Do this eight times. 
Each player chooses a character from the present reality. 
Setup each player with their story tracker card on the left hand side of their character card. place the life token on "2" position and the book token on the "1" story node position for each character
FIRST TURN POSITIONS During the first turn of ultimate mode, players each take their standee and choose a challenge card which is not surrounded by 4 cards orthogonically (e.g.: has a card above, below, left and right of it) - this is that player's STARTING POSITION. Each player's standee must be at least 2 spaces (horizontally or vertically) away from the next player. Two standees can be diagonally next to each other. All players must agree on their positions before the game commences. Players cannot choose a starting position with a token or standee on it.TURN SEQUENCE  There are three parts in each turn, a planning phase, an action phase and a quest phase.PLANNING PHASEDuring the planning phase, all players act simultaneously. Each player chooses which action to perform in this phase:  -MOVE  Move the character standee into an adjacent space by specifying coordinates with the dice. The space chosen must be horizontally or vertically next to the standee. A move cannot be made into a diagonal space. Do this by placing the two dice on one of the characters traits on the board (the first to represent a row number and the second to represent a column number.) The character must have an equal or higher trait value to the challenge card in order to move onto it, otherwise they will lose one health. Can move onto challenge cards with a token or another standee (e.g.: another player) on it, if they do  -REST [recover life]  If a player has 0 life, this is the only action they may perform The player gains 1 life and may not perform any other actions this turn. To perform a heal action. The player places his dice onto a trait of his choice but with the numbers 6/1ACTION PHASE  The action phase happens after all players are ready and reveal their dice placements. Each player who chose to move, moves their standees now. Then each player that chose the heal action, increases their health by one position. If their standee was lying down (0 health), they now place them upright.-INTERACT/ATTACKA character that lands on a challenge card with another player/character on it triggers an attack. If a character standee moves into a space with a token on it, this triggers an interaction. Interacting with a PURPLE generic token triggers a story event for that player in the QUEST PHASE -UNLOCK CHARACTER QUEST --UNLOCK CHARACTER QUESTCharacter Quests can be unlocked when a player moves onto a card which is any one part of a 1-3 card pattern matching a quest unlock pattern that that player has. The player must declare it when it happens when they resolve during the QUEST PHASEQUEST PHASE During the quest phase players resolve the story items that are triggered due to the course of their actions. For PURPLE TOKENS - these tokens are turned number side up. The player then refers to the ultimate mode manual pdf and will look to "Encounter Events" section of that reality and do the actions on encounter events.For CHARACTER QUESTS: these are the quests that are unlocked and are often narratives from a character's memories/past.INJURY AND DEATH IN ULTIMATE MODE  Taking damage: Characters are dealt damage as a consequence of story events or combat. Whenever a character is dealt damage, move their health that number of positions equal the damage to the left of their life trackASCENSION IN ULTIMATE MODE  Ascending from the present reality in ultimate mode is the objective of each session. A player that successfully completes any combination of 7 character quests and events will asend. Failing this, the player that enters the 3/3 position after the final boss of the reality is defeated OR if the final event runs out of time (in ACT 4) will ascend.  THE END OF THE GAME  Each session of ultimate mode is set in one reality. The players play until one player Ascends and then the session is finished and scores are taken.SCORING IN ULTIMATE MODE  At the end end of each session, each player counts the the following as their score1. ascension tokens - the player that ascends receives the gold ascension token and has 20 VP  2. treasure - the face value of each treasure card collected counts as VP3. Quests - each quest card has a VP value4. EVENTS -each major events card has a VP value5. HEALTH - every point of health a player has at the end of the session converts to 1VP6. Trait tokens - take the total number of positive trait tokens minus the number of negative trait tokens a character has, this converts to VP RETAINING SCORE Each player should record down their scores for an ultimate mode session. The scores should be cumulative into the next session. Until all available realities are completed, the final winner is the player with the highest total score of all sessions Basic Gameplay: Casual ModeThis describes fundamental core mechanics only: the game has much more to offer in two other modesSimultaneous TurnsPlanning Phase: Secretly select which card to hit, and which trait to useEveryone simultaneously reveals their plan Action Phase: Compare your stats to the card
Miss - Leave the card face up for later
Win - Gain a treasure!
Lose - Skip the next turn, or discard a treasure
Plan well and you could encounter rival players in the same location to help or hinder.Ascend through the three Realities Defeat the boss or find the Exit and wake up in a new Reality. Gain a new Character to face new challenges, or return to your previous Reality with Godlike power.AscendingGain a new characterFill board with new reality challenge cardsGames EndThe game ends after someone ascends from the third Reality Advanced gameplay : Competitive modeDownload and try the free print and play here.Try Simulation Theory on Tabletop simulator here.Note: The game pieces in both the print and play and the tabletop simulator only have rudimentary art instead of the illustrations used for the final production version.Explore three different realities. Which one is real? Who knowsThe Stone  Legend has it that millennia ago, a star fell from the heavens crashed into the world of Gaeus. It is said that this stone is imbued with such vast power that anyone that touches the stone would perish. Other stories claim that instead of dying from its touch, someone worthy would be able to wield its Godlike power. The stone was thought to be lost but has been rediscovered when a mighty quake cracked the earth asunder, revealing the ancient temple that was built around it. As it is, the primacy of the 8 God Kings is threatened by a warlord immune to their magic, who is also amassing a tremendous horde. Heroes have experienced fevered dreams, brought about by the stone calling to them.You are one such stoneseeker. You awake disoriented, having lived some other life in a place where magic does not exist and the God-kings do not rule.The land of Teres, where the stone fell, is now a hotbed of political intrigue, with adventurers and royals alike gambling their lives on reaching the stone first. And through it all, a horrid otherworldly blight twists all life it touches as it spreads unchecked. Will the stone grant you the power to fulfill your wishes?The Prison  You awake, wearing a prison jumpsuit and strapped to a Virtual Reality machine. You are deep in the bowels of a black site that officially does not exist; Level 44.The prison is the infamous Simbulan Penitentiary, located in the city of San Miguel. The prison is privately owned and staffed by sadistic ex-criminal guards and robotic EXA units.But you are not in any normal cell. The machine you were connected to moments ago should induce Virtual Enhanced Interrogation. The technology is so advanced that the life you just experienced feels more real than the shithole you are now trapped in. None of this is even remotely legal, even by the corrupt standards of San Miguel.Suddenly the locks on your cell open as a prison riot rages throughout the facility. The supermax inmates have spilled over into the black site, taking over section by section in a murderous rage. Is it too late to escape? Is it too late for answers?The Ark  After the near-apocalyptic singularity event on Earth, the newly risen AI's left behind a seemingly benevolent member of their kind, GENECIA. Her intervention veered humanity away from the brink of extinction, by providing them the gift of viable long-distance space travel. A part of that gift is the designs of the Genisis Ark. Like millions of others, you are on one such Ark. Yours is headed toward P4-11, a habitable planet.You awake in a cryo-pod as one of the privileged few who went on this journey to a new home with their entire body intact. Less important colonists only had their brains transported, awaiting their bodies to be reconstructed when the new world is settled.The Ark has virtual reality programs to keep the minds of those in stasis active. Your VR sim was strange, almost entirely too real. That, and you were woken too soon. Alarms are blaring, the life support system seems to have been damaged. The ship's AI is mysteriously absent. Where is the captain? Can you save the mission? Can you save yourself?Designer note: We didn't just 'tack on some lore' for our game - we take storytelling very seriously. The story behind each reality in Simulation Theory is part of the MEGACORP UNIVERSE

story:
Chess960 is a variant of chess that uses the same board and pieces as standard chess, but the starting position of the pieces is randomized. As the starting positions are generated at random, it neutralizes the advantage of memorized openings and forcing the players to use their true talent and ideas at the board. It's purpose is to bring back the romantic side of chess and expand the imagination of the players.

It is useful for both recreational and educational proposes, as it will tremendously increase your creativity, talent, judgment and ability!
 

 

 
Invented by the eleventh World Chess Champion Bobby Fischer and it is the only chess variation recognized by FIDE (World Chess Federation).
 
The play maintains the original chess flavor while ensuring the live creative spark.

Wins are based only on players skills and general understanding of the game , as opposed to openings preparation, tricks and memorization.





Chess960 lets me enjoy myself without having to disrupt my life for months of preparation.
- Garry Kasparov -
(Chess Grandmaster, 6 times World Chess Champion)
 
I get bored from playing the same openings over and over again. I think that in the future we will only be playing Chess960.
- Shakhriyar Mamedyarov -
(Chess Grandmaster, ranked as No. 3 in the world as of September 2018)

Τhis innovation will return us to the golden age of chess: the age of innocence and creativity, without losing any of the essential attractions of the game we love.
- Valery Salov -
(Chess Grandmaster)

If you get into Chess960 and not just move the pieces to achieve known positions it will really improves your chess vision.
- Levon Aronian -
(Chess Grandmaster, rank as the fourth highest rated player in chess history)



 


Roll the dice and place a bishop on the square indicated.
(This will be one of the black A, C, E or G squares)






Roll the second dice and place the second bishop on the square indicated.
(This will be one of white B, D, F or H squares)



 


Roll the third dice and place the queen on the first empty position indicated .
(always skipping filled positions)
(Thus, 1 is the first (leftmost) empty square, while 6 is the sixth (rightmost) empty square)





a) Roll the dice and place a knight on the empty position indicated.

b) Roll again the dice and place the second knight on the empty position indicated. (Roll again a 5).





These placements will leave three empty squares.
Place the king on the middle empty square, and the rooks on the remaining two squares.

Finally, place the white and black pawns on their usual squares, and mirror exactly the Black's positions with the White's.





Enjoy the game!

Play is much improved because you don't need to analyze or memorize any opening.
- Svetozar Gligoric -
(Chess Grandmaster)

No more theory means true creativity. 
- Artur Yusupov -
(Chess Grandmaster)
 
The power of memorization is so tremendous in modern era. Theory is so advanced, it used to be 10 or 15 moves, now is going to 20 or even 30 moves. We need a change and it would be a good idea to shuffle the first row of the pieces. This way we will get rid of all negatives that comes with theory.
- Bobby Fischer -
(Chess Grandmaster. Many consider him to be the greatest chess player of all time.)




 Chess is played very differently today when compared to the originality of the past. With modern-day computers, books and game databases, we know which openings and configurations are the best and we can learn to play them from memory. Older players can learn to play from memory even whole games.

Although this can successfully drive us to a win, the spirit of such play is not satisfactory to all chess players.

This approach to chess produced a general decline in creativity. The solution is to shuffle the back row of pieces (with constraints to allow castling and preserving the opposing colored bishop pairs).

Although the concept might seems radical, actual play comes quite naturally. This innovation offers players the chance to enjoy original, creative, and exciting games without compromising the core elements of chess.

 It’s extremely easy to learn, and most importantly, fun to play.

When the starting positions are random it would be impossible to memorize the moves of the game and players must create every move originally. From the first move, both players must devise original strategies and cannot use any well-established pattern, trick or opening.



 
We ship worldwide. We plan to ship the product mid/end of September 2019. We will keep you up to date for the expected delivery date of your order.
 




  

Nakamura, Carlsen and Kasparov playing Chess960.

story:
What is the City of the Steam Sun

1894

Forty years ago on Krk Island in the Adriatic Sea, the City of the Sun was built — a new Utopia created from dreams of Victorian scientists. Mathematically calculated, perfectly thought out, a hymn to  greatness of human mind, and a symbol of the unity of Europe; it became the largest scientific and cultural center of human civilization for almost two decades. 

Everything changed in 1872. On the night of June 20th, the city was struck by the Eclipse — a cataclysm of unknown nature, which left a turbulent whirlpool in the place where the island had been. The disaster was terrifying. Everyone was convinced the city, like Atlantis, had perished at the bottom of the sea, and all its inhabitants died; the price for its attempt to compare with the gods.

But the truth was different. On the night of the Eclipse the city was moved to another reality — gray, cold, and lifeless; where the sky was covered with low clouds. Later, this place came to be called Limbo; because most of all it resembled the threshold of Hell, come to life from the pages of Catholic manuscripts.

In Limbo, the forced immigrants found food, water, and even some deposits of metals. But the most important thing they found was brimstone, "hell stone," an amazing fossil fuel that burned several times hotter and longer than coal. The findings gave a powerful impetus to the development of steam technologies. Only one serious obstacle was in the way of the scientific and technological revolution: lack of a stable inflow of new resources. So, when three years after the disaster the Embassy of demons came to the City with a proposal to open a portal back to the real world in exchange for the right to trade, the authorities were glad to have such a bargain. 

In September 1875, appearing from thin air, a steam locomotive with several cars rolled out with clatter and clang onto the half ruined railway bridge which once had connected the island of Krk with the continent.

Over the next 15 years, the appearance of the city changed completely. Smoke from trains, factories, steam trams, and steam cars stained the walls that used to be snow-white. The streets were entangled with a network of pneumomail tubes. The metal steam-powered sun rolled on a huge metal rail in the sky.

The city received a new name: the Web. Once again it became a cultural, scientific, and financial center of society — but a society quite unlike the old one.  Other conditions, other creatures, other social rules, and other laws of physics gave rise to a new, wonderful world.

In this world, the authorities lead diplomatic negotiations with demons; inventor-technomages dream of creation of a reasonable automaton; researchers look for traces of ancient civilizations; leaders of the criminal world and brilliant detectives fight for the right to set the rules — here, in the shine of the metal steam sun.

What are you going to play?

The City of the Steam Sun is designed for stories in the genres of classic detective, Victorian horror, and adventures in the style of Indiana Jones and Alan Quatermain. Each story can develop within the same genre, or combine the features of several.

Detective – Stories in the spirit of Arthur Conan Doyle or Agatha Christie will be good for those who like to work with information, analyze it, and move step-by-step to victory. The heroes of such stories are employees of a detective agency, guards, or even individuals who were affected by the consequences of some crime. Search for clues, questioning witnesses, matching data from different sources – you will feel the gray cells of your brain wake up.

Horror – Stories in the style of Victorian horror or mystical horror are easy to imagine in the world in which here and there you meet fanatical scientists who are ready to sacrifice to science not only their lives, standards of morality, and ethics; but also the lives of anyone who happens along. That is why here, you can face out-of-control scientific experiments, crazy infernal machines and their creators, as well as numerous creatures and entities that live in the depths of Limbo: ghosts, ancient deities, cursed tombs and so on; as if from the fantasies of Howard Lovecraft.

Adventure and crypto-detective – Limbo is a place with a rich history; it keeps many secrets that excite the imagination of researchers. Confusing mazes on the outskirts, mysterious traps and vague clues, mystical coincidences leading heroes to the goal. And, of course, smart competitors following heroes to the finale.

And all this is in the atmosphere of the late XIX century; in the city which turned from the Utopia of the Rational Age into the dark Web; in the world of steam devices and technomagic —  the arcane background whose adherents use special equipment to work miracles.

Why you will like to play it

The City of the Steam Sun is a deeply developed world in which the latest steam technologies coexist with ancient powerful magic.

  • More than 40 new edges.
  • Three new arcane backgrounds with unique game mechanics: Technomages, relying on their equipment, Blessed Ones, who create miracle from their own life force and Dark Mages, who make grim sacrifices to gather power.
  • Flexible rules for creation of inventions, suitable for those who want to dive into creation of a new device and enjoy choosing components and their various combinations; as well as those who prefer to assemble their mechanisms quickly.  Create your own fine tuned weapons, transport and even semi-intelligent automatons.
  • Three ready adventures, one per each genre. Discover plot behind the robbery of the officer of Expeditionary Force in the Case of the Winged Statuette, face horrors of the House of Forgotten and reveal some ancient secrets of Limbo on the Path of the Piligrim.
  • Lots of secret societies.
  • And a wide range of air and steam guns for all fans of steampunk.

What We Need & What You Get?

The setting materials have already been published in Russian. Now we are launching the English version. The translation is complete; but we need funds for additional editing, proofreading and layout. We invite you to support the project: you will get the materials of the setting, as well as the opportunity to become a part of the City of the Steam Sun and enter its history forever.

Everyone who takes part in crowdfunding will be mentioned in the list of people who helped the project. We will print this list at the end of the main book.

The City of the Steam Sun will be published in two books. The first book will be intended for players, and will consist of three subsections: The Book of Human, The Book of Demon and the Book of Angel, for characters with different levels of knowledge. It will contain information about the world, new edges and hindrances, rules on inventions, and rules on magic with three new arcane backgrounds. This first book will have about 200 pages, and contain about 50 full-color illustrations (apart from the rules on inventions).

The second book, the Book of Creator, is intended for Game Masters only. It contains a detailed history of the world in a way that is unknown to any of the characters, bestiary, master tools, and three ready adventures. This book will have about 130 pages and 25 full-color illustrations.

The books will be distributed through the DriveThruRPG website. The printed version will be available in hardcover in premium color, using print-on-demand.

Please note that for printed versions, pledge price does not include shipping and the basic cost of printing. When the book is ready for printing, you will receive a code that will allow you to order its printing on DTRPG at the cost of printing and delivery. Base printing cost for player's book will be around 20$ and for the Book of Creator around 15$.

For the Benefactor pledge, we are planning to contract artist Evgenia Seminenko, who has already created some character portraits for our game.

Pledges

5$ Good Samaritan

Our immense gratitude is for those who understand how much a fine gesture means.

Even the smallest amount will help the project. And the feeling of joy it gives us that the City of the Steam Sun is important and interesting to the audience is really priceless. Therefore we will thank you and mention you in the list of people who supported the project.

10$ Librarian

The text file of the player's book is for those who prefers just letters.

You will receive only the text of the book of player, without illustrations and design. Only the text. The foundation and the skeleton of the world. And we will mention you in the list of people who supported the project.

15$ Desperate

PDF version of the player's book is for those who are ready to join the game.

You will receive a PDF version of the book of player — a full electronic copy with all illustrations. And we will mention you in the list of people who supported the project.

25$ Hermit

PDF versions of the player's book and the game master's book and stretch goals — for those who are content with little.

You get full copies of both books and all stretch goals in PDF format: with all illustrations, additional materials and adventure stories. Everything is exactly like in paper, just on the screen of any of your gadgets. And we will mention you in the list of people who supported the project.

25$ Researcher

A coupon for the printed player's book and a PDF version of the player's book are for those who are going to explore all the corners of the Web.

You will get a coupon for printed copy of the player's book, as well as a full copy in PDF format with all illustrations. And we will mention you in the list of people who supported the project.

25$ Surveyor

A signed postcard and PDF versions of all the books are for those who know something about brimstone.

You will get everything that is mentioned in the award "Hermit" and we will also send you a unique postcard with a picture on topic of the City of the Steam Sun signed by the authors. 

40$ Gentleman

Coupons for all printed books and PDF-versions of all books are for those who have a serious approach to business.

You will get coupons for both books in printed edition, copies of them in PDF format, and all stretch goal pdfs: with all illustrations, additional materials, and adventure stories. And of course we will mention you in the list of people who supported the project.

50$ Engineer

A signed brand-name postcard, coupons for all printed books, and PDF-versions of all books are for those who love complex systems.

You will get everything that is mentioned in the award "Gentleman" and we will also send you a unique postcard with a picture on the topic of the City of the Steam Sun signed by the authors.

100$ Blessed

The opportunity to write your own spell, coupons for all printed books, and PDF versions of all books are for experts on Arcana backgrounds.

You will get everything that is mentioned in the award "Gentleman". Also, you can offer us an idea for an Arcane power; we will calculate it and include it in the chapter "Magic" of "The Book of Demon".

100$ Guard

The opportunity to create your own weapon, coupons for all printed books, and PDF-versions of all books — for those who are ready to join the battle.

You will get everything that is mentioned in the award "Gentleman". Also, you can bring us an idea for steam, air, or clockwork weapons; we will calculate it and include it in the arsenal. The gunsmiths of the City of the Steam Sun have invented a lot of great things; but in a power confrontation it is always useful to be one step ahead, isn't it?

150$ Professor of Magemechanics

The opportunity to create your own character, coupons for all printed books, and PDF versions of all books are for true fans of the setting.

You will get everything that is mentioned in the award "Gentleman", and you can tell us what role you would play in the world; we will include this character in the life of the City — like the missing piece of the puzzle.

200$ Benefactor

The character you created will appear in the book with your portrait based on your photo; you will receive coupons for all printed books, and PDF versions of all books — for those who are ready to visit the Web in the flesh.

You will receive everything mentioned in the award "Professor of Magemechanics". In addition, our artists will draw a portrait of your character based on your photo, which will be included in the book.

450$ Lord-Council of the Iron Embassy

We will write an adventure with an antagonist that you will create; you will get coupons for all printed books, and PDF versions of all books — for those who don't mind playing for the bad guys.

The Web is definitely not a blessed place. Lack of vital resources leads to a fierce struggle for a place under the steam sun. If you back at this level, you will receive everything that is mentioned in the award "Gentleman" and you can offer us an idea of a character that will oppose the players. We will write a short adventure in which he will appear in all his glory. This adventure will be free and will be added for all backers.

3000$ Dean of the Occult Faculty

An exclusive cosplay-quality set of technomagic equipment, coupons for all books, PDF-versions of all books. And adoration of everyone. For those who feel the pulsations of a technomage in their heart.

You will get everything that is mentioned in the award "Gentleman" and we will make for you a one-of-a-kind full-size copy of the equipment set for powerful technomages in the City of the Steam Sun. The set will include an energy battery, a programming unit, an emitter, and goggles. It will be made of brass, wood, leather, and glass.

And to be honest, we would be thrilled to make one especially for you.

Pledge Chart

 

Stretch goals

If the wave of your support overwhelms us, we have some additional great plans:

5000$ We will translate a short adventure, "The Guards Of The Sunrise" — a story of a detachment of guards that protected the Steam Sun from the attacks of the Cult of the Eclipse followers; mad fanatics determined to establish a new order in the city. The pdf of this adventure will be added for every backer, and further it will be free to download on DTRPG.

7500$ We will add more illustrations to "The Book Of The Creator ". It already has some great art, but sky is the limit. We want to make it even cooler.

10000$ We will translate "Playing With Fire" — a collection of adventures, the events of which are connected with the appearance of explosive devices in Limbo. It was believed for a long time that it was impossible to create a bomb in Limbo, but the events of late November 1894 showed that the laws of nature can be circumvented. The hunt for new technologies began. This adventure will be added for free for backers with the Book of Creator pdf in their pledge and later it will be sold on DTRPG.

12500$ We will write and publish “Collector of the Automatons”, a dark horror adventure where players would explore the mansion of Albert Berstein, functionary of the guild of magemechanics and famous collector of human-like automatons, who gone missing. At the moment the plot for this adventure is complete, but the text isn’t and there is no art. When it’s ready, this adventure will be added for free for backers with the Book of Creator pdf in their pledge and later it will be sold on DTRPG.

15000$ We will make the Major Arcana of the deck "Tarot of the New Time", a set of cards with unique pictures by Maria Grobowskaya (Braderunner). Tarot of the New Time is a set of 22 unique edges in the City of the Steam Sun, representing the destiny of your character and it will be possible to get a physical copy of this deck for a deeper dive into the world of the City of the Steam Sun.

Licensing

This game references the Savage Worlds game system, available from Pinnacle Entertainment Group at www.peginc.com. Savage Worlds and all associated logos and trademarks are copyrights of Pinnacle Entertainment Group. Used with permission. Pinnacle makes no representation or warranty as to the quality, viability, or suitability for purpose of this product.

Music used in video: AShamaluevMusic - Cinematic Orchestral.

Music Link: https://goo.gl/Tk377U

Voice actor: Stanislav Yakubovskiy

Sound recording: Vladimir Koshevoy

Video editing: Ekaterina Birukova

Illustrators: Evgeniy Haruk, Alexander Plekhanov, Ilya Shalkov, Igor Savchenko, Evgenia Seminenko, Maria Kuravtsova.

 

Risks & Challenges

From our previous experience in publishing our game we know that sometimes things don’t go well in game development, due to the number of people involved. But the translation, which was the hardest part, is finished; so we think that we’ll be able to complete the rest of the project in time. Most problematic part is art. We have all the art we need for the current version of the book, but if we add new art to the Book of Creator – due to stretch goal or Benefactor pledge – there may be some delays; but they won’t affect release date of the player’s part of the book. The same goes with our tarot; we want the whole deck to be illustrated by one artist, so it may take some time.
story_txt:
What is the City of the Steam Sun1894Forty years ago on Krk Island in the Adriatic Sea, the City of the Sun was built — a new Utopia created from dreams of Victorian scientists. Mathematically calculated, perfectly thought out, a hymn to  greatness of human mind, and a symbol of the unity of Europe; it became the largest scientific and cultural center of human civilization for almost two decades. Everything changed in 1872. On the night of June 20th, the city was struck by the Eclipse — a cataclysm of unknown nature, which left a turbulent whirlpool in the place where the island had been. The disaster was terrifying. Everyone was convinced the city, like Atlantis, had perished at the bottom of the sea, and all its inhabitants died; the price for its attempt to compare with the gods.But the truth was different. On the night of the Eclipse the city was moved to another reality — gray, cold, and lifeless; where the sky was covered with low clouds. Later, this place came to be called Limbo; because most of all it resembled the threshold of Hell, come to life from the pages of Catholic manuscripts.In Limbo, the forced immigrants found food, water, and even some deposits of metals. But the most important thing they found was brimstone, "hell stone," an amazing fossil fuel that burned several times hotter and longer than coal. The findings gave a powerful impetus to the development of steam technologies. Only one serious obstacle was in the way of the scientific and technological revolution: lack of a stable inflow of new resources. So, when three years after the disaster the Embassy of demons came to the City with a proposal to open a portal back to the real world in exchange for the right to trade, the authorities were glad to have such a bargain. In September 1875, appearing from thin air, a steam locomotive with several cars rolled out with clatter and clang onto the half ruined railway bridge which once had connected the island of Krk with the continent.Over the next 15 years, the appearance of the city changed completely. Smoke from trains, factories, steam trams, and steam cars stained the walls that used to be snow-white. The streets were entangled with a network of pneumomail tubes. The metal steam-powered sun rolled on a huge metal rail in the sky.The city received a new name: the Web. Once again it became a cultural, scientific, and financial center of society — but a society quite unlike the old one.  Other conditions, other creatures, other social rules, and other laws of physics gave rise to a new, wonderful world.In this world, the authorities lead diplomatic negotiations with demons; inventor-technomages dream of creation of a reasonable automaton; researchers look for traces of ancient civilizations; leaders of the criminal world and brilliant detectives fight for the right to set the rules — here, in the shine of the metal steam sun.What are you going to play? Each story can develop within the same genre, or combine the features of several.Detective – Stories in the spirit of Arthur Conan Doyle or Agatha Christie will be good for those who like to work with information, analyze it, and move step-by-step to victory. The heroes of such stories are employees of a detective agency, guards, or even individuals who were affected by the consequences of some crime. Search for clues, questioning witnesses, matching data from different sources – you will feel the gray cells of your brain wake up.Horror – Stories in the style of Victorian horror or mystical horror are easy to imagine in the world in which here and there you meet fanatical scientists who are ready to sacrifice to science not only their lives, standards of morality, and ethics; but also the lives of anyone who happens along. That is why here, you can face out-of-control scientific experiments, crazy infernal machines and their creators, as well as numerous creatures and entities that live in the depths of Limbo: ghosts, ancient deities, cursed tombs and so on; as if from the fantasies of Howard Lovecraft.Adventure and crypto-detective – Limbo is a place with a rich history; it keeps many secrets that excite the imagination of researchers. Confusing mazes on the outskirts, mysterious traps and vague clues, mystical coincidences leading heroes to the goal. And, of course, smart competitors following heroes to the finale.And all this is in the atmosphere of the late XIX century; in the city which turned from the Utopia of the Rational Age into the dark Web; in the world of steam devices and technomagic —  the arcane background whose adherents use special equipment to work miracles.Why you will like to play itThe City of the Steam Sun is a deeply developed world in which the latest steam technologies coexist with ancient powerful magic.
More than 40 new edges.
Three new arcane backgrounds with unique game mechanics: Technomages, relying on their equipment, Blessed Ones, who create miracle from their own life force and Dark Mages, who make grim sacrifices to gather power.
Flexible rules for creation of inventions, suitable for those who want to dive into creation of a new device and enjoy choosing components and their various combinations; as well as those who prefer to assemble their mechanisms quickly.  Create your own fine tuned weapons, transport and even semi-intelligent automatons.
Three ready adventures, one per each genre. Discover plot behind the robbery of the officer of Expeditionary Force in the Case of the Winged Statuette, face horrors of the House of Forgotten and reveal some ancient secrets of Limbo on the Path of the Piligrim.
Lots of secret societies.

story:
Hi, my name is Aaron Prior and I run Culverin Models. I have been running this company for just over two years but have been playing wargames, tabletop RPGs and making scenery for over two decades. 

 

Titan Gate

The Titan Gate scenery set is a selection of 28mm scale fortifications designed to allow your troops to withstand almost any attack. 

  • With parts ranging from simple front line defensive walls to massive turret emplacements and gates designed to keep towering war machines out (or in!)
  • Whether you want to fight small skirmishes amidst enemy trenches or wage full on siege warfare there is something for you here!
  • The smallest set measures 30cm x 17cm and has space for 30 models on 25mm bases, whilst the largest set measures a colossal 105cm x 103cm and has space for up to 450 models on 25mm bases! 

  • Both STL and physical pledges are available (with a range of price points for physical pledges)
  • Physical pledges are 3d printed in PLA but have been designed to be strong and long lasting
  • The option to have your physical pledge pre-painted is available meaning that your pledge will be ready for battle straight out of the box!
  • All STL files have been test printed to ensure there are no problems when you start printing

The imposing guns of the Titan Gate from ground level! (Infantry miniatures by CP Models)

The Frontline Emplacement with its colossal armoured howitzer and minigun turrets (Infantry miniatures by CP Models)​

The massive size of the Titan Gate is visible here, dwarfing a battle tank sitting outside the gate! (Infantry miniatures by CP Models)​

Frontline Bunker pledge level, perfect for setting up a strongpoint! (Infantry miniatures by CP Models)​

 

THE REWARDS:

 

TITAN GATE SCENERY STL SET - £40 

This pledge level includes STL files for all of the available pieces for the Frontline Bunker, Frontline Emplacement, Bulwark and Titan Gate terrain sets.  All of the STL files have been test printed.

 

 

PHYSICAL PLEDGES

There are 5 tiers of physical pledge available, each tier also includes a painted option at extra cost. The painted option is for a hand-painted version of the Frontline Bunker/Frontline Emplacement/Bulwark/Titan Gate painted in-house in the colour scheme shown in the pictures.

 

FRONTLINE BUNKER - £30 (unpainted)/£50 (painted)

The Frontline Bunker terrain set is comprised of a sturdy barricade structure that measures 30cm wide in the standard configuration. This includes a central bunker with a removable roof and 2 perimeter turrets.

 

FRONTLINE EMPLACEMENT - £60 (unpainted)/£90 (painted)

The Frontline Emplacement terrain set is comprised of a large sturdy barricade structure that measures 56cm wide in the standard configuration. This includes a central bunker with a removable roof, 2 perimeter turrets and a massive armoured howitzer emplacement.

BULWARK - £120 (unpainted)/£180 (painted)

The Bulwark terrain set is a 26cm tall, 46cm wide and 45cm deep fortified defensive structure perfect for use as the central element of a battlefield. Featuring 3 large turrets, a walkway that goes the entire way around the lower walls and plenty of room at the top of the tower for snipers and other long range weapons. The Bulwark can fit 82 models on 25mm bases on the walls and tower.

TITAN GATE - £350 (unpainted)/£500 (painted)

The Titan Gate has been designed to not only provide excellent protection to the troops and gigantic warmachines hidden behind its massive walls (41cm at the highest point!) but also to allow troops stationed on the walls to fight back with the aid of the potent weaponry of the Titan Gate itself. 

 

  • The Titan Gate facility is 105cm wide, 45cm deep and 41cm high (at its highest point) and can hold approximately 200 models on 25mm bases on the various walls and walkways available!
  • The gate itself can be opened and closed and stands at an imposing 24cm tall and 26cm wide
  • The walls and tower levels are held in place using tabs and slots meaning that all the sections are held together nice and securely during gameplay

EXTRAS

These extras were unlocked as part of the previous fundraising campaign and will be included with the appropriate pledge levels whilst this InDemand campaign is active.

Triple Barrel Rotator Cannon for Titan Gate

Immolation Flamethrower weapon for lower wall turrets/Frontline Fortifaction turrets​

Gargantua Desolation Mortar weapon for Frontline Fortifications armoured howitzer emplacement​

Upgraded tower top for Bulwark​

Upper level for Frontline Fortification Bunker

Extra weapons for some of the smaller turrets

POSTAGE

 

Frontline Bunker - UK: Free, US: £18, Australia: £25

Frontline Emplacement -UK: Free, US: £25, Australia: £25

Bulwark - UK: Free, US: £30, Australia: £30

Titan Gate - UK: Free, US: £50

I have been running this company for just over two years but have been playing wargames, tabletop RPGs and making scenery for over two decades.  Titan GateThe Titan Gate scenery set is a selection of 28mm scale fortifications designed to allow your troops to withstand almost any attack. 
With parts ranging from simple front line defensive walls to massive turret emplacements and gates designed to keep towering war machines out (or in!)
Whether you want to fight small skirmishes amidst enemy trenches or wage full on siege warfare there is something for you here!
The smallest set measures 30cm x 17cm and has space for 30 models on 25mm bases, whilst the largest set measures a colossal 105cm x 103cm and has space for up to 450 models on 25mm bases! 

Both STL and physical pledges are available (with a range of price points for physical pledges)
Physical pledges are 3d printed in PLA but have been designed to be strong and long lasting
The option to have your physical pledge pre-painted is available meaning that your pledge will be ready for battle straight out of the box!
All STL files have been test printed to ensure there are no problems when you start printing

story:
The Mountain Circuit

The Isle of Man Mountain Circuit is the world's most famous, most challenging and most dangerous roadracing course. Each year it hosts the Isle of Man TT and Festival of Motorcycling and we've come up with a small, simple card game that'll keep up to 6 people laughing and playing.

Every deck contains 126 cards, 60 of which represent corners and locations around the course. Each turn, players lay down cards trying to get their total number of miles up to 38: the course is 37.75 miles long (but who wants to play a game involving fractions or decimals?!).

Other cards can interfere with other players, making it a sneaky game of strategy. And well-known features of the racing such a mist, marshals, and even running out of fuel are all represented.

The idea was to come up with a fun game that can be played in 15 minutes, fit inside panniers without overloading someone's motorbike, and be simple enough to pick up over pint in the Beer Tent!

So Why Not Call It "The TT Game" Then?

In truth, we'd have loved to have done that but the letters TT have been trademarked by the Isle of Man's Department for Enterprise, and they've come down hard on people who've used the initials without their permission in the past.

We emailed over a few months to try to find out what this might cost so we could factor that into our campaign, but never received a reply. Rather than risk producing a game would have to be pulped on the instructions of lawyers, we decided to rename it to avoid any possible legal difficulties.

This is definitely not  an official TT product of any sort (so please go away, ministers / civil servants / advocates)!

What We Need & What You Get

We need £10,000 to fund a production run of 1,000 decks. We have a manufacturer in China that can produce the cards, include an instruction sheet (in English, French and German) and put it all in a nice metal tin.

It means we can sell the decks for £10 each - a pretty reasonable price for a game!

One drawback, however, is the cost of postage from the Isle of Man - we're sorry it seems fairly high but we're stuck with the prices passed on from the Post Office. For shipping to the Isle of Man or UK, it's just over £3 per deck - but for the Europe it'll cost more than £11 per deck, and about £14 to the rest of the world.

If that's a little rich for your blood, our perks start at just £1 to have your name included on the instruction sheet that comes with every game - we obviously want to thank everyone who helped make this happen.

And if your company (or who knows, race team) really wants to get involved, you can sponsor a corner card for £100 - getting your logo or web address on that card in each deck. Think of it as the digital equivalent of hanging your banner from the Grandstand on Glencrutchery Road, or putting a sign up at Quarterbridge!

About our funding goal

This is an all-or-nothing campaign. If we don't raise the money we need to pay for manufacturing and shipping, we'll call the whole thing off and everybody will get their pledge money back.

You'll understand we're hoping that won't happen - but we won't take money for a product that doesn't launch!

Risks & challenges

From a product point of view, we're ready to roll. We've designed the cards, produced a prototype deck and playtested extensively with friends and family before taking it out to pubs around the Isle of Man. Total strangers who had no idea how to play picked it up almost instantly!

But our manufacturer is in China and so shipping the crates of decks may take a little while. That's unfortunately out of our control as the cartons will be loaded onto a ship as freight and sent to the UK, from where they'll be sent to the Isle of Man before we pop them into packaging to be sent to you.

At the moment, we don't know how long that shipping process will take - but all things being equal, we're hoping everyone can have their decks in time for TT 2018.

The only other risk to the game is from foreign currency fluctuations. We'll pay the manufacturer in US dollars and so we have to cross our fingers the value of the pound doesn't collapse before we can send the money to them. That, however, seems a very small risk at present.

Other Ways You Can Help

Buying a deck is great, and taking up our other perks would be awesome.

But as well as that, if you could help spread the word on Twitter and Facebook, we'd be very grateful. If you have friends who like motorsport and roadracing, let them know too!

story:
About the Game

FREE MARKET: NYC  is a competitive and strategic board game based on the principles of a free market economy, presented from a humorous and ironic perspective of life, making it both a social and fun game!

In this game, you will find yourself managing a group of people who work together in different assignments, aiming to grow their fortune according to your vision.

Throughout the game, you will purchase merchandise at the auction, deliver goods to shops and factories, establish partnerships in shops and factories, or possibly take over other players' business and capital.  

You will also attend events, influence politics, win awards, and garner all kinds of influence to help your businesses, partnerships, and assets flourish as you move forward in the game.

The trick is simple: buy when the market is low and sell when it's high to make the most profit before your opponents do. The most successful businessman wins the game.

FREE MARKET is played with 2-5 players, ages 12+ and 90-180 minutes long. The rules booklet is in 6 languages, but the game board is completely multilingual. 

This game is not language dependent - since the game board itself is fully generic (multilingual), any player regardless of his or her language can directly play this game, after a brief explanation.

Please be aware that this is a work in progress rules booklet. Rules may still be tweaked and changed, layout and graphics may still be altered. 

Nox' Spellenzolder - EN

"Free Market is a great game to play because there is so many ways of playing it, so many roads that leads you to a victory…"

 

Man VS Meeple - EN 

"The market price in Free Market NYC constantly fluctuates, either player controlled or not, forcing you to adapt your strategies and try new things in an interesting way." - MvM

 

La Mazmorra de Pacheco - Spanish

"The Fundraiser stage is brilliant too because it depends on how the tower goes.. The first player to gamble on the tower end up getting the goodies" 

 

Nox' Spellenzolder - Dutch 

"This is an excellent game and I really looking forward to the final product..."

 

Overview Video

"Another unique thing about this game is the Politician Panel... If we have a politician in our pocket, he can help us do a better business, improve sales and trade with shops..."

 

Gameplay Runthrough

Background

By the mid-1930s, the United States was still struggling to squeeze its way out of the Great Depression. These difficult times were characterized by hunger, crime, high unemployment, major wealth inequality, limited social mobility, and political strife that tested the fortitude of the American economy.

The government intervened, establishing new economic policies, which eventual led to reviving free market principles. By the early 1940’s it had become apparent that the US had pulled itself up by its bootstraps, restoring a stable and growing economy defined by the opportunity that a free market provides.

This game aims to mimic the spirit of the free market: To profit by investing, selling, trading, taking risks, paying attention to market trends, anticipating opponents' strategy, cooperating with others, but also profiting from them as well, all in the spirit of making the most money.

Objective

The game consists of 4 rounds of play. In each of which you are responsible for managing a group of people working together in different assignments aiming to grow their fortune together.

You will then have the option to invest in the stock market to further grow your assets, at your own risk of course, as well as a chance to participate in a fundraiser, attend events, influence politics, win awards, and garner all kinds of influence to help your businesses, partnerships and assets flourish as you move forward in the game.

One of the interesting aspects of the game is the emphasis on choice. Even at unexpected turns and twists, at any given moment there is usually a wide array of decisions that can be made in response.

Although all players begin at the same place, the often beneficial options of playing in different zones and different actions, adds a layer of complexity to the game that makes it unpredictable and further reinforces the value placed on optimal decision making. From management and worker assignments, to selling and delivering merchandise in the action zones, the ball is in your court.

There are multiple ways to get the biggest piece of the pie. Whether through retail, partnerships, by owning infrastructure, acquiring others' enterprises, making many small deals or few big ones, or some combination of them all; it is clear that the game accurately depicts the cutthroat and unexpected nature of a real life free market.

By the end of the 4th game round, each player will calculate his total accumulated wealth and assets. It's very simple: the wealthiest player wins the game.

Attractive features & Innovations

The Auction Phase

One of the attractive aspects in the game is the auction. The fully unrestricted gameplay of this feature, which relies on decision making alone and doesn't depend on a draw of a card or a roll of a die, adds a real element that creates endless possibilities and tests the players' risk evaluation skills. This phase contributes to the game atmosphere, adds a humorous element and enhances social interactions.

Donation Tower

The Donation Tower is an off-board element that brings the game an additional interesting value. Throughout the game, players contribute to the funds that are concealed within the tower. Alertness and timing are key. Wait until the sum is large, but don't wait too long to grab it before others have the chance. Either you hit the jackpot or you waste your opportunity.

Truck Design

A creative feature is the innovative design of the truck that can physically carry workers into other areas of the board to overtake opponents' businesses. 

This project is EU and US friendly. You will pay for shipping in the Pledge Manager after the campaign when we know the precise rates. However, although this is only estimates, there will be no additional cost than the maximum estimated shipping cost below! 

 

Special thanks:

Special thanks to my boys Peleg, Afik, and Kfir who were truly an inspiration for their countless days and weekends discussing and testing the game with me. Their great advice helped me improve the game and make it fun. I know that my youngest Elad will grow up to enjoy it one day just like his brothers.

 

Risks and challenges

UBG Unique Board Games LLC is an American company.
We have successfully launched, funded and delivered an additional Kickstarter project: "Heropath: Dragon Roar", which is rated 8.5 on Boardgamegeek.com. We attend international game fairs, including Spiel Essen on an annual basis.

The shipping is US and EU friendly, meaning that the shipping fees won't exceed $13 for the US, $14 for the EU. For all other countries, shipping fees will be $10-25 (not includes taxes).
Note: All shipping rates are for one game box only. There may be a discount in bulk, but we cannot guarantee it at this point.

The game and all its components will be produced in China. We are fully devoted to creating an amazing experience, so you can rest assured knowing that we're doing our best to take care of every aspect of the process. Please note that the actual product may vary due to product materials.

This game does not aim to make any social, historical or political claims. All related background, context, drawings and content shown here or on the game itself are for entertainment purposes only.

We're extremely confident about our product. However, if you're not satisfied for some reason, you can return our product for a full refund. Note: shipping fees not included.

©2019 All rights reserved to UBG Unique Board Games LLC, ⓇFree Market registered trademark owner.

story:
RAISE THE DEAD...

Up to four players will work together taking on the role of the narrator from Lovecraft’s original story in order to perfect the protagonist’s experimental reanimation formula. Classic characters including Herbert West, the City Watch, and the Undead wander through Arkham to help or hinder the players as they undertake their profane task. Subplots will develop through gameplay, forcing players to respond to new adventures and challenges only the world of the Reanimator can provide!

Following our highly successful crowdfunding campaign, Reanimator is already off to the presses and due to be released this April! If you missed your chance before, NOW is the time to pre-order your copy at a discount!

story:
The Ratmen Temple is a paper model underground dungeon section created for tabletop role-playing games. It is designed to fit with 25mm, 28mm and 30mm gaming scales.

This RPG paper model includes 2 cardboard bases (also called sections), the cardstock wall, 8 paper miniatures, 8 paper accessories and the assembly instructions.

The bases are printed on a thick cardstock and then glued to a cardboard. The paper miniatures and accessories are printed on a high quality white cardstock. The wall is printed on a thicker cardstock.

Assembly is simple, requiring only glue and exacto knife or scissors.

 

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The Ratmen Temple will be shipped to you within 2 to 5 business days after purchase. Depending on where you are located, the delivery time is between 1 and 2 weeks. For delivery outside the United States and Canada, delivery times may be longer due to customs and other unforeseen details.

story:
Ancient Rome T-shirts Collection! Because every WARGAMER should wear their uniform to battle... T-SHIRTS of your faction!

We have designed T-shirts for wargamers to wear while playing their favorite wargames… or whenever you want!

Would you like different designs, from other historical periods? Tell us in the comments section.
 

 

Below you can see all the different designs and colors available. You can choose among the following factions: Romans, Celts, Dacians, Germans, Parthians and Sarmatians.

 

Romans


The Aquila, prominent symbol of Jupiter Optimus Maximus, which represented the power and bravery of the Romans, stands above the omnipresent motto Senatus Populusque Romanus, unmistakable reminder that, under the reign of the emperors, the wars of the Empire are still fought in the name of the Senate and the people of Rome. And that is how it will remain, as long as Marcus Ulpius Trajanus, the Optimus Princeps, lives. Two lightning bolts, the fulmina, emanate from the proud eagle's claws. About to take off with a triumphant shriek the eagle carries the weapon used by Jupiter to personally destroy the enemies of Rome, while the Caesars in his name get ready to draw their swords.
 

 

Celts


The sun’s tireless motion from East to West is represented by this triskelion. Following the will of the god Lugh, master of all the arts, skilled with every weapon, and rightful king of the Tuatha Dé Dannan, the sun will always shine on the land of the brave and daring Celts in an endless cycle. And, as the sun, Lugh, the most beloved among all deities, will guide the Celts into battle, towards a glorious and immortal fate.
 

 

Dacians


They say the Dacians descend from the wolves that inhabit their mountains surrounded by mist. The Dacians, however, know that their dear and sacred lands, scattered with imposing sanctuaries and citadels atop cliffs, protect and are protected by a mysterious creature the Romans called draco. With the head of a wolf and the body of a sky-blue dragon, this clever mythical creature, son of the supreme god Zalmoxis, has been spotted coming down the valleys towards the south. They say its predatory gaze rests upon the Danube, upon the Roman lands beyond its waters, heralding winds of war.
 

 

Germans


Odin, king of the Aesir, is many things. He is wise, he masters magic and witchery, and is aware of everything that happens, has happened, and will happen. He is the patron of war, a cruel one, who claims the heroes fallen in battle and takes them to Valhöll. He is both smart and twisted, a brilliant strategist and a master of deceit. A symbol of multiplicity, the Valknutwas often depicted with Odin in many engravings by the Germans, always willing to follow his teachings and awaiting the day a violent and glorious death would grant them the honor of sitting at his table.
 

 

Parthians


Simurgh flies above the plains of Persia, carrying wisdom and royal majesty. It protects Iran and its almighty kings since ancient times. Sometimes invisible, others intensely bright, its presence is always clearly noticeable around legitimate and skilled sovereigns, since the whole world bows down before them. It is under the mantle of Simurgh that the Parthian kings of kings, the shahan shah of the Arsacid dynasty have regained the Achaemenid throne, willing to reign, as their titles suggest, over Iran and beyond.
 

 

Sarmatians


Life on the steppes is a constant cycle of migrations, always under the scrutiny of the beings that inhabit the skies. Sarmatian gods live in the Sun, the fire, and the starry sky, governing the lives of these fearless riders with cold and distant diligence. The elderly say that griffins and other fantastic creatures are the guardians of the gods’ undaunted will, and some even claim to have seen them unleash their rage in the midst of battle, guaranteeing the steppe is, and always will be, free.
 

 

The following sizes are available (in cm; 1 cm=0,39 inches). To take your measures, you have to do it from side to side of your chest, 1 cm below the sleeves, for WIDTH (A), and from the top of your shoulders down to the end of the T-shirt for HEIGHT (B).
 

 

If you want more than one T-shirt, click on “Select a perk" and choose another of the T-shirts you want. When the campaign is over, we will open a Pledge Manager, so each backer can select the T-shirts they want and sizes.

 


ALL-IN: 6 +1 High quality T-shirts for Ancient Rome wargamers.  The free T-shirt will have an exclusive logo with the shields of the 6 factions.
 

 

 


The shipping cost is 6€ for 1 T-shirt, regardless of your location. If you add T-shirts to your pledge, shipping costs may vary slightly. Shipping costs will be estimated in the Pledge Manager, once the campaign is over.


Help us to share it!

  • TWITTER: https://twitter.com/DracoIdeasEN/status/1301571303690952704
  • FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/DracoIdeasEnglish/posts/3582295658447458


If you want more information visit our website or our social networks:

Website: http://dracoideas.com/editorial/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/DracoIdeasEnglish

Twitter: https://twitter.com/DracoIdeasEN

story:
Written For DMs . . . By DMs

5th Edition Dungeon Masters have very few ready-made tools for creating immersive and challenging wilderness environments. The limited resources that are available have been spread across core rulebooks, supplements, and adventure modules, but until now, there has been no comprehensive source for a Dungeon Master who wants to craft a living, breathing exploration experience within a natural biome.

 

Grio’s Guide to the Wildlands catalogues an assortment of natural environments into easy-to-access chapters, each with inspirational imagery, detailed information on dozens of hazards, specific backgrounds and proficiencies for nature-focused characters, and skill challenges for overcoming the threats of the natural world. With Next-Level Gaming's dedication to balanced mechanics for any level adventuring party, we aim to make travel a meaningful part of the adventure again.

Design Philosophy

Grio’s unique layout has been designed with all types of Dungeon Masters in mind. For the advanced planner, there is incredible depth and mechanical detail in even the most neglected environments. For the improvisational specialist, there's a plethora of organized knowledge that can be accessed quickly and easily.   For the most dedicated of storytellers, there are new ways to use wilderness encounters as part of a powerful narrative. 

 

 Part One: The Narrative Thread

Each encounter description begins with a brief explanation of the hazard and its origins.  It’s important for a Dungeon Master to understand what causes the hazard and how it might occur in the fantasy world of the campaign.  This brief overview also gives a DM some inspirational suggestions about how the encounter might be used to impact the story that is being told at the table.

 

Our wilderness challenges are never designed as simple ambushes, or space fillers, or taxes on character resources.  All of them are designed with player enjoyment and narrative depth in mind.  Our goal is to give a DM many ways to include a unique experience that fits well with the story of the adventuring party.

 

 Part Two:  The Next-Level Description

Characters should always be given the opportunity to spot and anticipate dangerous situations, whether those situations are caused by monsters or the hazards of the wilderness.  Each of our encounters includes suggested descriptions that the Dungeon Master may choose to utilize as the player characters approach the moment of an encounter.  The wording in these descriptions has been carefully crafted to prompt player engagement and character interaction.

 

Additionally, these Next-Level descriptive elements provide the DM with flexible ideas on skills, background features, and other character abilities that may be useful in helping the players to overcome the challenge.  All relevant Difficulty Class information is provided for quick reference, and we also provide options to scale encounters to the overall power level of the party.

Part Three: Player Action Opportunity

If characters are able to spot the threat posed by a natural hazard, they should be given a brief moment to describe how they react.  The third part of our encounter system helps to guide the Dungeon Master in providing players with that opportunity.  However, there is always the risk that a character may be completely surprised by the calamity that has befallen them.  These results may be determined by passive skill checks or rolls of the dice, and our simple layout puts the appropriate information right at the DM’s fingertips.

 

 Part Four: Mechanical Resolution

When the hazard has been introduced into the campaign world, and the players have been given their opportunity to perceive it and react to it, all that remains is a straightforward and balanced set of mechanics to resolve what happens to the characters in that moment.

 

Each environmental encounter has its own set of unique characteristics, and this is where the Next-Level design team has toiled endlessly to ensure that players at the table will view these events as enjoyable challenges rather than pointless impositions.  The mechanics of each hazard are created through a collaborative effort among a number of DMs and players.  Each situation is playtested and balanced in such a way that a DM may use it with confidence.  We work diligently to ensure that these are not TPK machines, but they’re not so soft that the characters can render them meaningless either.

 

With this supplement, any Dungeon Master can overcome the tedium of cross-country travel. No more clunky conversions from previous editions! No more complex mathematical calculations! No more overly simplistic, unrealistic mechanics that bring absolutely nothing to the table! The end result will be a memorable, engaging experience that feels truly wild.

 

Grio’s Guide to the Wildlands is the definitive source for exploration in 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons. Pledge today, and master the Wildlands!

 

 

The hardcover books will be printed in much the same format as you might expect from any TTRPG sourcebook on the shelves of your Friendly Local Game Store.

Trim Size - U.S. Letter 8.5" x 11"

Gloss Cover Finish

Heavy-weight glossy stock

Full color interior printing

Our current estimate for the 9 major biomes and stretch goals that are likely to be unlocked is just over 200 pages.  We are committed to keeping the book under 300 pages for ease of use and to keep shipping costs at reasonable levels.

 

For this project, we will be charging for shipping through a pledge manager after the campaign ends. YOUR PLEDGE DOES NOT INCLUDE THE COST OF SHIPPING.  We ship from the United States, and we will not be able offer refunds on pledges after the project funding window has closed.

We are working diligently with our third-party fulfillment partners to keep shipping costs as low as possible, but if you're concerned about the price of shipping, we'd encourage you to back at the PDF level.

Shipping charges will be collected as close as possible to the actual shipping date of the hardcover books.  Each backer will be contacted by email shortly after the funding window has closed to complete the pledge manager survey, but we plan to hold off on shipping charges until closer to the final fulfillment date.

Risks and challenges

A project of this size comes with inherent timeline risks. We have a dedicated team in place, and we are working diligently to prevent delays in design, printing, and shipping. We are also working very hard to keep shipping and customs charges for our international backers as low as possible through the use of third-party fulfillment relationships.

story:
What's in the GREED game box?

A solid box contains: a beautiful designed foldable game board, 32 Opportunity cards, 12 Profile cards, 32 Private cards, 24 Commodity cards, 24 Share cards and 64 Connection cards. In total 188 cards. Ofcourse we also supply you with 8 different colored pawns and 2 lovely Greed-purple dice. And on top  1 loan register cashbook and the great Greed manual.

Manual & Loan register


 

Order The Greed Game now  and experience it for yourself!

story:
The dice come in four varieties: Standard, CCG, Mini & Fate/Fudge

Standard dice are traditional 10mm dice with pips (dots).  

CCG dice are specialty 10mm dice with +1, +2, +3, -1, -2 & -3, this is for representing counters or the change in stats of various creatures in collectible card games.  

The Mini dice are traditional 5mm dice with pips.  The pens hold a little over 30 of these dice and they have one additional 10mm die in the cap to keep the smaller dice from spilling out whenever you open it.

The Fate/Fudge dice were unlocked as a stretch goal in my previous crowdfunding campaign.  These dice have two blank sides, two + sides & two - sides.  I do not have pictures of these yet just the general design, they will be available in Purple, Green & Black.

Here are some pictures of the different color options:

Standard and CCG dice are available in Black.

Standard and CCG dice are available in Pink.

Standard and CCG dice are available in White.

CCG dice are available in Dark Grey.

Mini dice are available in Black, White, Green, Red, Blue & Mixed Color

This is the Fate/Fudge dice design but it will be available in Purple, Green & Black

story:
Welcome to King Pong

King Pong is all about bringing good people together & keeping the party going... 

King Pong was thoughtfully designed to offer you a variety of exciting & innovative ways to play pong... extra gaming platforms encourage more players & more fun... 

With so many versions to choose from, King Pong easily transforms to the size of your party... 

Cheers y'all  

 

 

 

                                                                                     

 

About King Pong

King Pong is your newest best friend when it comes to partying & getting together with friends. 

King Pong puts a twist on the classic by not only inverting the pyramid style rack but by providing a tiered platform that ultimately Elevates Your Game! 

Better yet, King Pong is the first party-game that transforms to the size of your party... Multiple sets of King Pong can be arranged to create a variety of different playing experiences which means more cups & more fun! The game-changing design of 360° King Pong allows for 40-50 cups to be in play with shots sailing in from all sides of the compass! 

Whether you're throwing the party- or heading to it- King Pong is the perfect way to celebrate getting together with friends. King Pong is ultra light & breaks down flat making it perfect for travel. You can take King Pong anywhere & instantly Elevate the Party! 

 

Risks and challenges

The journey of bringing King Pong to market has been wild thus far & there are still many miles to go... Between the engineering & production considerations that were tried & tested, to creating a logo & identity for party people everywhere to connect with, it has been a rewarding combination of hard work & creative challenges that, win or lose, were worth every bit of sweat, dollars & time.

With this Indiegogo campaign underway, King Pong is full steam ahead for 2018. Reaching my goal will allow us to best promote/market/package King Pong & it will help manage our distribution methods as the orders roll in... most importantly, these funds will get King Pong to the next level with customizable sets made available in a variety of colors...

So much thought & research has already gone into the engineering, production, packaging, retailing & marketing... but without the funds to keep pushing forward, King Pong is unable to reach party people everywhere.

Upon reaching our goal...

Because our first shipment of King Pong is already safe in its warehouse, I am happy to announce that all of our backers are guaranteed timely shipments & that they will most certainly be kept up to date with all things new & developing with King Pong thanks to our social media & web sites already in place.

The vision for King Pong is an ambitious one. There are many things ahead for us to accomplish, but at this juncture, I'd like to take the time to say thanks to Indiegogo & everyone supporting us here for letting the most important leg of the journey begin!

 

 

PARTY ALL THE TIME...

 

 

THANK YOU WILDLY,  

Vin Convertito // Creator & Chief
