story:
Cloud Control is a family party game for 3-10 players that plays in 15-30 minutes.  Players try to score the most points by forming clouds into recognizable objects and having the other players guess the shapes before time runs out.  With the ability to overlap and move the cards, you can make almost any cloud shape come to life!  Cloud Control is a game that can be taken out at family gatherings and enjoyed by all ages for years to come!   

Cloud Control has been chosen as 1 of 5 finalists in Hasbro’s Next Great Family Game Challenge, and at the end of this campaign, Hasbro, along with guest judge, Shark Tank’s Daymond John, will determine the grand prize winner that will receive $25,000, a trip for 4 to Hasbro headquarters, and the opportunity to work with Hasbro.

To begin the game, the cloud cards are placed in a grid in the center of the table.   

On your turn, choose a shape card and study the listed shapes.  

Once you are ready, the timer is flipped and you must get the other players to guess the shapes listed on your card before time runs out.  To do so, take cloud cards from the center grid and orient them to form a recognizable cloud shape.  You can turn, twist, stack and overlap the cloud cards, move and animate the cloud cards, or create anything related to the shape.  Just don't speak or make sounds!

Both you and the player who guessed correctly receive points based on the difficulty level of the guessed shape, and play continues until each player has taken a turn.  The player with the most points is the winner!

Cloud Control isn’t just for solo play – there are team play rules as well. Additionally, if this campaign reaches $12,000, the all-play lightning round (where all players frantically create the same cloud shape and then vote for the best one) will also be included to allow for even more ways for your family to enjoy Cloud Control!

Watch the below video to see Cloud Control in action:

 

Read the full review of Cloud Control from Board Game Authority HERE:

“The game is a lot of fun and caused a lot of laughs around our gaming table.”

“…you might not even want to keep score because no one will want to stop playing”

“Having your head in the clouds has never been so much fun.”

We took Cloud Control to Unpub 6 in Baltimore, Maryland, and here are just a few of the quotes we received:

"Best game I've played at Unpub so far this year."

"Fun party game!!"

"The creative nature and fun aspect of the game was a high point for me."

"Fun, quick game for all"

My favorite part of the game is:

"The fun fast paced nature.  We were laughing constantly."

"The creativity!  The idea of animating it is really cool to me"

"The creativity element and fun togetherness!!"

"The creativity"

"The quick motions"

"Keeps everyone involved and talking which is fun."

Cloud Control will ship worldwide from fulfillment centers located in the United States, Canada and the EU, and we will be paying customs and VAT taxes and fees for supporters located within the United States, Canada and the EU.

Although we are not offering "friendly" shipping to other areas at this time, we hope our international supporters outside of these "friendly" areas can coordinate pooling orders for the Cirrocumulus (4 games) or Cirrostratus (5 games) perk levels in order to save game and shipping costs.  In order to stay fiscally responsible, however, we do not believe we can offer any other "friendly" shipping right now.  This may change if we receive a significant number of supporters in one area, and we are already in contact with fulfillment partners in Asia and Australia to make this possible. 

If you are not contributing to this campaign because of shipping costs, please let us know by contacting us directly through our website so we can keep track of demand.  Our international supporters are very important to us, and we will try to keep your costs down in a way that makes financial sense for both of us.

We cannot do this without you, so please BACK NOW and SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN with your friends, family and colleagues and ask that they do the same.  Visit our website to join our newsletter, like our Facebook page, follow us on Twitter, and give Cloud Control some thumbs up on boardgamegeek.com.

Dudley Games Website

Dudley Games Facebook

Dudley Games Twitter

Board Game Geek: Cloud Control

Eugene Bryant is originally from the small rural town of Lincolnton, Georgia and currently resides in Suwanee, Georgia.  In between, he went to school at the University of Georgia (Go Dawgs!), met the love of his life, and became father to 3 beautiful children.  He is an attorney by trade, rock star by wishful thinking, and game designer with what little time is left over.

Some of Eugene's fondest memories are playing classic board games with his father, Dudley.  Whether it was playing music, writing plays, constructing elaborate stage sets, or just coming up with projects around the house, Dudley always had something creative up his sleeve.  Eugene began Dudley Games in memory of his father to create lasting moments between families, and from the first moments of playing Cloud Control with his daughter and watching her make a butterfly, he knew he wanted to share Cloud Control with the world and bring the same enjoyment he had as a child to families everywhere.

Thanks to the joys of worldwide logistics, there are always complications to be had and mistakes to be made.  As first time creators, we have chosen to keep this project as simple as possible by keeping our perk levels straightforward, using a manufacturer with a proven track record in board game production, and utilizing an experienced and reputable fulfillment company to handle worldwide shipping, including coordination with international fulfillment partners.  We realize that problems and complications can arise in any project of any size, but we promise to address any problems head on and communicate with you to keep you informed as to the status of the final game.  We greatly value your faith and trust in us to deliver this game, and we cannot wait to get Cloud Control in your hands.

Will you make Cloud Control if you do not win the Hasbro contest?

Absolutely!  If this campaign funds, we will be bringing Cloud Control to you regardless of the Hasbro contest results.  Cloud Control is a fully developed game that has been playtested hundreds of times, and we have spent many late nights speaking to manufacturers and fulfillment companies about the specifics of making and shipping Cloud Control.  While we would welcome the chance to work with Hasbro on Cloud Control, we are not reliant on them for manufacturing or development and will be making the game whether we win the contest or not.  We are up against some stiff competition, and you can check out the other finalists' games below:

Steve Ehrensperger: Aardvark’s Runaway Railroad

Kelly North Adams: Chibi Quest!

Jason Wiser: Monsters in The Elevator

Michael Eskue and Lisa Eskue: Trash Pandas

Do you offer any other buying options for retailers or distributors?

If you are a retailer or distributor interested in purchasing Cloud Control, please contact us directly through our website.

Are there any IndieGoGo exclusives?

At Dudley Games, we believe in being inclusive, not exclusive, and to us, that means that everyone who buys our game, whether they heard about this campaign or not, receives the same product.  We also think that having multiple products and SKUs opens up the opportunity for mistakes in manufacturing and fulfillment that do not have to exist.  While we understand that you have trusted us with your hard-earned money in advance and have given us a huge boost in making this dream become a reality (and we greatly appreciate it and sincerely thank you), we hope that having this game before anyone else, helping us meet stretch goals to make the game better for everyone, and having that warm fuzzy feeling for helping us out will be incentive enough for you to support us. 

We truly appreciate your support and thank you for taking the time to view Cloud Control!

story:
I have been working in animation and illustration for the past 20 years. Almost exclusively for apps for the last four years making 2D animation and illustrations. All the apps are for children. The experience gained gave me the knowledge and the strength to start my own app. Several ideas came to me before I started this project. Attending all the apps targeted for children, I always tried to find something different. Despite the amount of responsibility involved, an educational app was not an option but a priority. I can say that the fact of being married to a teacher has left me more relaxed to face the difficulties that lay ahead. So the idea of putting together an app, a book and crafts seemed to me the best choice and the best idea to start with. Children spend so much time on their smartphones and tablets, neglecting books and crafts. With the project “I Like to Be…” children can have a cool learning experience playing with the app and spending time together with their families building creative ideas as a complement for each task accomplished. The picture book associated to the theme will provide children with relaxing moments, always digging into their imagination.

 

What am I talking about anyway?

 

It all started with the idea of joining together an app, books and crafts. 

The idea grew up to a broader concept: "I Like" to Be, to Learn, to Play, to Do. Different approaches with a common propose: Play, Discover and learn.

This campaign aims to develop the first product of this concept; "I Like to Be...!"an app and books about professions.

Why, you can ask.

Because we  talk less and less with kids about the professions that  we come in contact with in our daily lives. For instance the Sailor, the Postman, the Fireman or the Baker.

In the app the children assume the role of apprentices in each profession. With explainer videos, interactive games and crafts, the child plays with the professions and involves the whole family in the fun. All games are pedagogical and promote motor skills, visual memory and mental arithmetic.The crafts proposed are to be shared with the family. One picture book is associated with each profession. It is not an enhancement of the content of the app, but an adventure or a tale related to the theme.

 

What has been done so far:

 

  • Script for the first game.
  • Interactive pipeline.
  • Avatar and main character for the first game.
  • Sketches from the menus and games assets.
  • Storyboard of the explanation videos.
  • Sketches from the pages of the first book.

The Impact

This campaign intends to raise funds so that we can spend 6 months working on a prototype , hire a developer and a musician, print the first book in two different languages and do some marketing.

Is impossible to go forward without your support. Nobody likes to work for free and developers, musicians, translators and marketing experts are no exception.

I'm very committed with this project and I dedicated all my free time to develop the first game and the first book. I want to bring this project to the day light and share it with children.

This is why I need you!

Risks & Challenges

There is always a risk involved in the crowdfunding: unsuccessful financing. Well this is a risk that I'm prepared to stand up to and go ahead with the project even if the funding is not enough. 

A different stratégie or a plan B is already prepared to face the difficulties. Of course will take more time and financial effort, but I'm very committed to build this project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help in different ways: founding, sharing the campaign and make a lot of pressure in your friends and acquaintances. Twitter, Facebook, Skipe, Instagram, you choose the best way. 

You can also use the Indiegogo share tools,

story:
The Art of War: Card Game is a non-collectable tabletop game where you can lead one of four factions and fight for dominance in fierce card battles in which you can challenge as many as three opponents!  Four factions to choose from:

  • The Kingdom of Etlia is a kingdom of the middle lands, which for a long time existed without wars and gave the world many literature and art masterpieces of. Its culture is known far beyond the borders of the kingdom, but the civil war made the country easy prey in the eyes of its neighbors. The self-defense units of Etlia are not so strong, but the heroes of these lands are able to inspire the troops by restoring their health and recruit additional units under their banners.
  • Nordkönigraich is the kingdom of the north, a nation that has tempered its character in centuries of incessant wars. Artillery, battle mages and warriors of this faction can unleash all their power and fury on the enemies of the Kaiser and inflict large damage upon them, from which they can never recover.
  • The Sarioantian Empire, which was once the most powerful nation on the continent, is now in a political crisis. Despite the shaky position and unrest in society, its new leader intends to return the empire to greatness. This faction specializes in covert operations that can leave the enemy without an army and disrupt enemy strategy before Sarioantia deploys its main forces.
  • The Greatunion Tsardom is a religious kingdom of the east, in which the practice of magic is prohibited. However, despite the absence of magicians in the ranks of its troops, the troops of this nation are the most powerful and disciplined, and clerics give protection to soldiers from enemy magic attacks.

 

 

Non-collectible Card Game

This game is non-collectible card game and you do not need to hunt for new cards. The game focuses directly on the four factions and their distinctive tactics, and not on the collectible aspect. Therefore, the game is ready to play immediately after purchase.

Support of up to 4 players

his game is intended for a larger number of players than it is customary in such games. Basically, games of this kind are designed for two players, but The Art of War can be played with up to 4 people at the same time.

Social game

This game is more social than other similar card games. The outcome of the game in play sessions with more than two players depends not only on the tactical abilities of the player, but also on the talent to persuade, manipulate or cooperate. Playing in “deathmatch” mode, pitting opponents against each other can mean more than good military tactics, and in “alliance” mode, the cooperation of two different factions can open the way to powerful moves and combinations.

Reach replayability

There are many different modes available in the game, which can be combined with each other in order to get a rich gaming experience.

  • Time options: Long game and Quick game.
  • Game options: 1 on 1, "Deathmatch" for three or four players, Military alliance mode for four players.
  • Rule options: Classic rules, "Iron Will", "Gold and Silver". 

We are a small team from Latvia, and we have never been involved in the development of tabletop games before. It all started when the final version of the video game “Gwent: The Witcher Card Game” was released, which was completely different from the beta version.

The nostalgia of forever gone beta-Gwent inspired us to create our own game. We decided to recreate what we really loved in the old Gwent and improve other aspects that were missing in other similar games. Our game was intended to be tabletop, non-collectible and player moves should be easily and quickly calculated by the players themselves without using any additional means. And on top of that, the game should become more social and can be played with more players at the same time than comparable games like Gwent, Magic: The Gathering or Yu-Gi-Oh!

And in the end, we succeeded and “The Art of War” was born...

The BattleCast
Meeple reporter
Northern Dice

Board's Eye View

    GAME MODES

    Three different game modes are available (for playing with up to 4 players)

    • Classical mode for two players.
    • Deathmatch mode for three or four players.
    • Alliances mode for four players.

     

     

    FACTIONS

    • 4 factions to choose from: Kingdom of Etlia, Nordkönigraich, Sarioantian Empire, Greatunion Tsardom.
    • Each faction has 19 faction cards.
    • At the beginning of every game each player needs to choose 10 cards that will make up their Faction Reserve - a deck that can only be used by the player controlling a specific faction.

     

     

    COMMON DECK

    • All players have access to the Common Deck.
    • The common deck consists only of iron cards (cards of the lowest value).
    • The size of the common deck depends on the number of players - from 20 to 40 cards (10 cards per player).

     

     

    TURNS

    • Each player rolls a 6-sided die.
    • The player who rolls the most points goes first.
    • During his turn, the player must either play one card from his hand and perform its effect or pass.
    • Player moves are passed clockwise. Each player can place cards in two rows under their control.
    • The round continues until every player has no cards in their hand to play or declares pass.
    • The player who declared pass does not play a card this round, but the effects of cards already set on the board continue to apply.

     

     

    END OF THE GAME

    • When every player has passed, the number of health points for each player is calculated. The player with the most health points is the winner of the round.
    • The game lasts until two wins, so winning the first round might not be as important as keeping key cards for later rounds.
    • After the first round, players draw one card from their Faction Reserve and two from the Common Deck.
    • If the second round turns out to be a draw, then an additional third round is played, and all players draw two cards.

     

    If the third round has not revealed a winner (which is extremely rare), a series of blitz rounds is assigned.

     

     

    The game is designed for 2-4 players. Each player chooses a faction they are going to represent and takes 10 cards of his choice from the deck of that faction. Those 10 cards will form a deck which is called the Faction Reserve. Depending on the number of players, in the same way, randomly, from 20 to 40 common cards are taken - this deck will be called the Common deck. The Common deck and the Faction Reserve are placed on the table. Each player rolls a 6-sided die. The player who has rolled the most points plays first and draws cards first. Players choose their faction leader and draw 4 cards from the Faction Reserve and 5 cards from the Common Deck. In the beginning of a round each player must have 10 cards in their hand. Before starting the round, players can replace up to 3 cards in their hand by placing them at the bottom of the deck those cards were drawn from and drawing a corresponding number of cards from the same deck. Player moves are passed on in a clockwise direction. During a turn, a player must play a card and perform its effect or pass. If the player has no cards left, the pass is declared automatically. The round lasts until all players have declared pass. The player who has the healthiest army (has the most health points) is declared the winner of the round. A player must win two rounds to win the game.

     

     

    We provide tax-friendly shipping to the following regions: USA, Canada, European Union, UK, China and Australia. Additional fees may apply to other regions! Please check with your local customs or tax authorities for details!

    The delivery price depends on the country of residence and the distance of the country from the nearest transport hub used by us. For EU countries, UK, China and Australia, we use local warehouses. For other countries, the game will be sent from the United States!

    We use a fair shipping cost policy which is based on country and weight. We cannot provide a table with all prices here due to the very large amount of information, but you can get the shipping cost when placing an order! 

     

     

     

     

    This is our first crowdfunding campaign. However, we will do our best to ensure that the process is as smooth as possible.

    All design work has already been completed. The manufacturers of the regular and limited editions have been selected, and they are currently waiting only for the payment to start work.

    We carefully read all comments and listen to feedback from beta testers, so we still allow some design adjustments, but this should not affect the process and timing of production and release.

    However, there are still reasons that do not depend on us and that may affect the timing of sending and delivery of the game to backers. The main such reason is the outbreak of COVID-19 and the restrictive measures imposed by the government of different countries to overcome the spread of the disease. There is no way we can control or anticipate the actions of governments, but we will try to meet the promised deadlines. In the case of an unforeseen situation, we will immediately notify the backers about it and give all the information about the situation and the options for resolving it.

his game is intended for a larger number of players than it is customary in such games. Basically, games of this kind are designed for two players, but The Art of War can be played with up to 4 people at the same time.
Social game
This game is more social than other similar card games. The outcome of the game in play sessions with more than two players depends not only on the tactical abilities of the player, but also on the talent to persuade, manipulate or cooperate. Playing in “deathmatch” mode, pitting opponents against each other can mean more than good military tactics, and in “alliance” mode, the cooperation of two different factions can open the way to powerful moves and combinations.
Reach replayability
There are many different modes available in the game, which can be combined with each other in order to get a rich gaming experience.

Time options: Long game and Quick game.
Game options: 1 on 1, "Deathmatch" for three or four players, Military alliance mode for four players.
Rule options: Classic rules, "Iron Will", "Gold and Silver". 


We are a small team from Latvia, and we have never been involved in the development of tabletop games before. It all started when the final version of the video game “Gwent: The Witcher Card Game” was released, which was completely different from the beta version.
The nostalgia of forever gone beta-Gwent inspired us to create our own game. We decided to recreate what we really loved in the old Gwent and improve other aspects that were missing in other similar games. Our game was intended to be tabletop, non-collectible and player moves should be easily and quickly calculated by the players themselves without using any additional means. And on top of that, the game should become more social and can be played with more players at the same time than comparable games like Gwent, Magic: The Gathering or Yu-Gi-Oh!
And in the end, we succeeded and “The Art of War” was born...



The BattleCast

Meeple reporter

Northern Dice

Board's Eye View



GAME MODES
Three different game modes are available (for playing with up to 4 players)

Classical mode for two players.
Deathmatch mode for three or four players.
Alliances mode for four players.

 

 
FACTIONS

4 factions to choose from: Kingdom of Etlia, Nordkönigraich, Sarioantian Empire, Greatunion Tsardom.
Each faction has 19 faction cards.
At the beginning of every game each player needs to choose 10 cards that will make up their Faction Reserve - a deck that can only be used by the player controlling a specific faction.

 

 
COMMON DECK

All players have access to the Common Deck.
The common deck consists only of iron cards (cards of the lowest value).
The size of the common deck depends on the number of players - from 20 to 40 cards (10 cards per player).

 

 
TURNS

Each player rolls a 6-sided die.
The player who rolls the most points goes first.
During his turn, the player must either play one card from his hand and perform its effect or pass.
Player moves are passed clockwise. Each player can place cards in two rows under their control.
The round continues until every player has no cards in their hand to play or declares pass.
The player who declared pass does not play a card this round, but the effects of cards already set on the board continue to apply.

 

 
END OF THE GAME

When every player has passed, the number of health points for each player is calculated. The player with the most health points is the winner of the round.
The game lasts until two wins, so winning the first round might not be as important as keeping key cards for later rounds.
After the first round, players draw one card from their Faction Reserve and two from the Common Deck.
If the second round turns out to be a draw, then an additional third round is played, and all players draw two cards.

 
If the third round has not revealed a winner (which is extremely rare), a series of blitz rounds is assigned.
 

 

The game is designed for 2-4 players. Each player chooses a faction they are going to represent and takes 10 cards of his choice from the deck of that faction. Those 10 cards will form a deck which is called the Faction Reserve. Depending on the number of players, in the same way, randomly, from 20 to 40 common cards are taken - this deck will be called the Common deck. The Common deck and the Faction Reserve are placed on the table. Each player rolls a 6-sided die. The player who has rolled the most points plays first and draws cards first. Players choose their faction leader and draw 4 cards from the Faction Reserve and 5 cards from the Common Deck. In the beginning of a round each player must have 10 cards in their hand. Before starting the round, players can replace up to 3 cards in their hand by placing them at the bottom of the deck those cards were drawn from and drawing a corresponding number of cards from the same deck. Player moves are passed on in a clockwise direction. During a turn, a player must play a card and perform its effect or pass. If the player has no cards left, the pass is declared automatically. The round lasts until all players have declared pass. The player who has the healthiest army (has the most health points) is declared the winner of the round. A player must win two rounds to win the game.
 

 



We provide tax-friendly shipping to the following regions: USA, Canada, European Union, UK, China and Australia. Additional fees may apply to other regions! Please check with your local customs or tax authorities for details!
The delivery price depends on the country of residence and the distance of the country from the nearest transport hub used by us. For EU countries, UK, China and Australia, we use local warehouses. For other countries, the game will be sent from the United States!
We use a fair shipping cost policy which is based on country and weight. We cannot provide a table with all prices here due to the very large amount of information, but you can get the shipping cost when placing an order! 




 

 





 
 

This is our first crowdfunding campaign. However, we will do our best to ensure that the process is as smooth as possible.
All design work has already been completed. The manufacturers of the regular and limited editions have been selected, and they are currently waiting only for the payment to start work.
We carefully read all comments and listen to feedback from beta testers, so we still allow some design adjustments, but this should not affect the process and timing of production and release.
However, there are still reasons that do not depend on us and that may affect the timing of sending and delivery of the game to backers. The main such reason is the outbreak of COVID-19 and the restrictive measures imposed by the government of different countries to overcome the spread of the disease. There is no way we can control or anticipate the actions of governments, but we will try to meet the promised deadlines. In the case of an unforeseen situation, we will immediately notify the backers about it and give all the information about the situation and the options for resolving it.

story:
CAMPAIGN

This deck has already been successfully funded on Kickstarter and we are now entering the second phase of production and taking pre-orders! The deck will be ready for delivery in March 2019! All tiers also come with a handy "Guide to the Moon Crystal Tarot"!

BACKGROUND

I grew up watching Sailor Moon as a child and teenager and was always enamoured by the great individual strengths of the characters and the journey of Usagi Tsukino. Growing up I also became attracted to the Tarot, especially the over aching archetypes of the Major Arcana which can repeatedly be found in various religions, cultures and psychological theories. I wanted to link all these things together by creating a special Sailor Moon-themed Tarot. This led to the creation to the Moon Crystal Tarot (Major Arcana) which was successfully funded in 2018 via Kickstarter. The overwhelming response pushed me to start working on the rest of the cards. Attributing characters to card meaning and illustrating 56 more cards was by no means an easy feat, but I am proud to say that after a year's worth of work (and some figure drawing assistance from SenshiStock) I can finally bring you the full Moon Crystal Tarot. 

CARDS

The cards will be professionally printed in Italy on 330gsm triplex Casino quality board which is easy to shuffle and resistant to wear. The cards will be varnished for extra durability. 

The pack features 78 cards measuring 65x115cm and will come in a full colour casket style cardboard box with gold foil detailing. Package upgrades are also available and will be hand screen printed by myself in my Berlin workshop.

 

Additional Items

All additional items, will be hand screen printed in my Berlin studio creating a glitter hologram effect with a pastel split fountain (rainbow/ombre print) using water based inks. 

 

POCKET MIRROR ADD-ON

The mirror can be added on at any level. Simply add €5 to your pledge and write a message to notify me!

 

Galaxy background by freepik.com

Risks & Challenges

Everything is planned to work and be delivered on time, as with my first campaign. The cards and all add ons will be printed in January and March and send out in March 2019. 

Shipping times to EU countries is around 2 weeks while International shipping is 5-8 weeks. Postage rates include tracking.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute but love the project? Help spread the word by telling your friends, family and pets in person and on social media! Every bit helps!

story:
Short Summary

We are Jake, Joel and Joenee - three globe-trotting dads who decided to create a valuable product for world discovery and intercultural understanding. The three of us grew up in third-world countries, pursued careers that took us across the world, got married to our soul mates, and had 9 children between us, all who are curious about the people, places and practices of the world. The World Card Series embodies much of what we want them to discover about the amazing continents and countries of the world. Let's 20/20 our view of the world by 2020... with the World Card Series: Discover Your World, Discover Yourself. Thank you for your support!

The Problem

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help launching the World Card Series to market. Basically, if you want steep discounts + free shipping to help us do that, you get up to 50% off the expected retail price!

 

Note on Shipping

For all U.S. based pledges, shipping is free. For all non U.S. based pledges, shipping is outlined in the pledge descriptions. We have done a lot of research on shipping and will do our best to decrease shipping & handling costs. Fortunately, each ContiDeck weighs only half a pound = 8 oz = .23 kg... the lighter weight and smaller packages definitely make for less expensive shipping costs. We also hope to secure international fulfillment partnerships soon. We are working on getting the best rates for our Backers. 

The Impact

We've started receiving review videos from early adopters on the impact the World Card Series is making:

Unpack & LearnPlay

Risks & Challenges

We've been very thoughtful about the World Card Series, leveraging many years of product and business development experience between the three of us... Joenee, Jake & Joel. We engaged the expertise of veteran curriculum, geography, and cultural specialists to make sure the world facts of the World Card Series are accurate. However, world facts evolve as countries do. The World Card Series will likewise evolve. We plan to involve interested backers in the very exciting World Card Series roadmap.

Thanks to a healthy relationship with a 20 year printer of quality playing cards, we are on track for on-time delivery. Playing cards are not currently included in the trade/tariff war, but if they are impacted, we will quickly adjust to contingency plans.

Thanks for your trust and partnership as a backer. Get ready to discover your world and master your world facts. 

***The World Card Series is designed for reference and educational purposes only. The World Card Series was/is not designed or intended for use in casinos, or for betting or gambling. :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Many backers have asked how they can assist beyond the campaign. Please help us spread the word about this important journey of world discovery and intercultural understanding - using the Indiegogo share tools!

One Last Look at the World Card Series

story:
Journey To The Overland is a new Solo Tabletop Roleplaying game that allows you to enjoy the fun and adventure of a role-playing game all by yourself in the comfort of your own home!

Journey To The Overland is a game published by Overland Games and inspired by Dwarfstar’s Barbarian Prince but also includes elements of games like Lone Wolf and Magnunmund, Dragonquest, Conan the Barbarian and of course Dungeons and Dragons.  In short, if you like Gloomhaven or enjoyed Legacy of Dragonholt you will love Journey To The Overland!

Journey To The Overland is a completely solo game played on a numbered hex map that allows you to create a character, travel and adventure throughout the world of The Overland in search of Five Weapons of Power.   Journey To The Overland features open ended tabletop role playing that allows players to:

•         Seek News and Information

•         Seek An Audience with the Town Mayor

•         Seek To Hire Help in a town or castle

•         Obtain new Skills and Advanced Skills

•          Earn and Spend Experience Points

•         Become a Knight, Samurai or Gladiator

•         Travel and explore new lands

•         Gain NPC friends and comrades

•         Hunt for food

•         Gain Experience Points and Level up

In addition,  in lieu of totally open ended play, characters can also attempt to fulfill one of several pre-set thrilling game objectives which include:

• Obtain The Five Weapons of Power
• Overthrow King Overlord
• Acquire Gold to Raise Your Own Army, or
• Defeat the Wizard Morcai at his Castle

In addition to a rules manual and over 100 game cards Journey To The Overland also features a full color 2′ x 2′ numbered hex map gorgeously rendered by artist Robert Altbauer.  Backers of this new Second Edition will also be able to obtain a new completely reorganized, revised and expanded rulebook together with event, encounter and weather cards previously unreleased. 

Risks & Challenges

As this is an Indiegogo Indemand Campaign the risk of the game not being published, printed or produced are few.  The game exists and has been funded through other crowdfunding platforms and many of the rewards offered in this campaign are already being created.

story:
Short Summary

It all began in the confines of our offices one day. We met as men and decided we weren't going to live like this anymore. So we set out to Mongolia (The name of a local coffee shop) in search of an answer. "What was the meaning of life?" , "How do we break the wheel?". "What of these lemons that life keeps giving us?!"

 Then one cold night, as the wind was piercing while the stars watched us. It suddenly dawned on us. BLANK cards!

Now we can create the world that we want. Through the power of positive imagination and love and respect. You now can do it too. An intricate masterpiece of art or a stick man pooping. The choice is yours. Choice Freedom!

What We Need 

Bringing freedom back to the world is no easy task. We will need all the support we can get, it doesn't matter if its a dollar or a hundred or even a post on Facebook, every act of kindness will bring us closer to a greater world! We need you!

The Impact

By backing this project, you will be helping mankind take a step towards a more ideal future. You will be:

  • Bringing freedom back to the world.
  • Building your own destiny.
  • Making Earth Great Again!

The Technology

The Cards:

  • 54 Completely Blank Cards. Unlimited Creativity.
  • Revolutionary Blue Core Centre Layer
  • Game Changing Smooth Premium Card Stock.
  • Dimensions: 2.5" x 3.5"
  • Innovative Blank Technology. Allows users to write on cards.
  • 100 kilograms of Freedom per Card. 5.4 Tonnes in Total.

The Box:

  • Revolutionary Design (lid and base) to capture your creativity!
  • Innovative Limited Edition Material Composition (128g C2s + 600g GB + 250g CCNB).
  • Bleeding Edge Matte Lamination Technology.
  • Highly efficient storage. Up to 54 cards, nothing more!

Risks & Challenges

The development of Blank Cards is of an extremely complex nature. That nature is reflected in the risk associated with the development of Blank. Throughout the development of these blank cards we were constantly exposed to radioactive material and threats from the Russian Military as well as the Chinese Triads with regards to our material sources. However, we bravely overcame these challenges. What got us through the tough times was a firm belief in our idea, the idea that our Blank Cards would be able to change the world.

We do not see any material risk which would prevent us from delivering these game changing blank cards to our valued backers. However, in the unlikely event of nuclear warfare, a zombie apocalypse, or Canadians becoming rude people, we would be unable to deliver our blank cards.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't contribute monetarily to our cause because even just sharing our project on Twitter or Facebook would bring the world a step closer to freedom. It is the little steps that pull us forward!

story: Card game
story_txt: Card game

story:
Download Cheer Up! for free or join our email list at Cheerupgames.com.

"This game was very creative and I'm drunk and I like it." - Beer & Board Games

You make the jokes, you make the rules. Cheer Up! is an adult party card game unscientifically designed to make your sad friends laugh. (Also, there's a funny dog.)

Cheer Up! takes a laughably short time to learn. In fact, you can learn right now! It works like this:

The dealer picks up a Question card and reads the letters at the top aloud:

Everyone else grabs two of each Answer card that match the requirements at the top (in this case, 2 A's, 2 B's, 2 C's).

The dealer reads the question and everyone must use the cards in their hands to form a funny phrase, discarding the cards they did not choose. Then, the dealer asks the question to each player, who must then read their phrase out loud.

But wait! There's one more twist! Before everyone reads their answers, the dealer picks up a Rule card, which will feature some wacky rule that everyone must follow for that round. This could range from

  • Talking in accents
  • Swapping cards with other players
  • Changing the question completely
  • Trying not to laugh
  • And many more!

And that's about it! Read the full rules or even download a black & white version of Cheer Up! for free, right now!

"This was great, I loved it, I thought it was so fun!" - Beer and Board Games 

"A really silly game...definitely one to bring out at your parties." - Let's Level Up

"The additional opportunity for creativity is most welcome...a worthy way to begin or end a game night." - Game Theory

"Simple but hilarious...we'll definitely be on the lookout." - The Lifecast

"I have a permanent wheeze from laughing so hard." - Natalie, an unfortunate playtester

"I'm not saying this word." - Chris' Aunt

photo courtesy of The Lifecast

 
 
"Wait a minute, I've played party games before," you say, in our imagination, "What's so great about this one?" Glad you asked! 

There are three main things that set Cheer Up! apart from other party card games. We've conveniently laid them out here like a good boy:

 

All the cards in Cheer Up! are written for you, but in this game you get to take credit for your creative jokes. The cards give you some helpful puzzle pieces and your job is to put all the pieces together. Sometimes this will result in crazy nonsense. But, when paired with the right card, a benign word can skyrocket to extreme ridiculousness, and you get to own it, baby.

There are also a handful of cards that require a little bit of advanced strategy, such as the A card "Every." It won't always make sense on it's own, but when paired with a great B it can work wonders.

After multiple sessions of Cheer Up! you will likely run across the same cards, just like in any other game. However, due to the number of possible combinations, we can guarantee that no two games will ever be the same. In fact, you may never play the same combos again. Even though answer cards are recycled, it's the combination of the answers, plus the question, plus the rule that changes the context completely. If the maximum of 5 cards are used in a round, you're looking at a 1 in like...40 kablillion chance of having the exact situation come up again. We didn't do the math, but it's big.

For example, in Round 1, you might get the question "What's the worst that could happen?" Maybe you chose this as your answer: 

The next night, the same question comes up again, but someone plays this answer:

A week later, the same question comes up, and you play this unfortunate answer:

So the same card was used three different times, each in a totally different way. And that's not including the fact that in the third round, you had to say it like the Queen of England.

Cheer Up! was built with universal appeal in mind - the game has very few pop culture or political references, slang terms, inside jokes, or proper nouns. We want to make sure everyone has the best chance of laughing at all times. There should never be a time when you don't "get it."

Furthermore, Cheer Up! is as much about performance as it is about saying funny phrases, and sometimes doing a great (or horrible) accent is the difference between winning a round or not. It's a great game to break the ice or to force shy people out of their comfort zone.

For your safety.

Cheer Up! can get plenty dirty and is definitely an adult party game, but none of the cards are overtly shocking or disturbing unless you create the answers that way. We find this makes for an inclusive experience that leaves people wanting more and removes the problem of a handful of cards being far superior to others. Think "silly-nasty" rather than "I'm going to Hell."

However, we realize there are also times when you want to break out the big guns. Which is why:

Every copy of the game will come with a 50-card NSFG (Not Safe For Grandma) Expansion Pack, for free.

What's the difference you ask? The NSFG pack is full of swear words, more explicit sex stuff, darker situations, crazier rules, and slang phrases. We decided to separate it to give people even greater flexibility when playing with certain groups (or relatives...). But we also figure most people are going to want everything, which is why we decided to just straight up include it instead of splitting off an expansion pack.

All of the NSFG cards are clearly marked and are sectioned off in the box. Nothing ever offend you? Shuffle in all the cards every time. Aunt Sally coming over? She'll still get a kick out of the game without having to hear you talk about your body parts. Twenty years old and still don't know what the birds and the bees are? Destroy the extra cards and tell no one.

40 Questions & Rules might not seem like a lot at first glance, but each round is fairly long. With an outgoing group of six players, it would take about 4-5 hours to get through the entire stack of questions in one go.

This game is already prototype'd and play-tested, and has been in the works for over 2 years. At this point we're confident that the basic game rules are complete, but during this campaign we will happily take feedback and suggestions. The time immediately after this project will be spent finalizing the design and the contents based on feedback and card suggestions. We will have to do a little playtesting with the suggestions as well to be sure they work.

Our timeline is purposefully being kept loose to allow for unforeseen problems (shipping delays, misprints, Global Economic Collapse, etc.) We do not want to rush this, however, we realize you'll want this ASAP, so we will try to stick to this as bestest as possible.

These are based on conservative estimates from our manufacturer, so it's possible that it would all happen faster. However, we can't promise a release in time for the holidays, though it is possible it would be ready.

We have also aligned with some great partners who we are confident in, such as AdMagic for manufacturing, and multiple shipping companies depending on our final needs.

Chris Rio is mostly a comedy writer from Boston. He came up with this idea in a dream (seriously) two years ago to try and help a friend get through a tough time, and now it actually looks like a real thing. He doesn't know why he is talking in third person.

Niko is his off-the-books personal assistant (he gets paid in Busy Bones). Niko was the "November" in a dog calendar modeling contest one time, and he thinks all this was his idea.

We make a great team.

Risks & Challenges

This may be the first project in which I reach the funding goal, but it's not the first time I've run a project. I've learned so much over the last few months it's ridiculous. 

First off we are keeping things extremely simple. There's pretty much only one physical product you can get which reduces shipping complications. Secondly, we are working with extremely experienced partners in manufacturing and shipping, which I can't wait to dump all my work onto.

There are always chances things get away from you through either extreme success or failure, but I can assure you that this time I will do anything to make sure this game gets made and arrives in your hands, even if I have to drive it there.*

Chris Rio
Top Dog | Cheer Up Games

*I'm not going to actually drive it there.
story_txt:
Download Cheer Up! for free or join our email list at Cheerupgames.com."This game was very creative and I'm drunk and I like it." - Beer & Board GamesYou make the jokes, you make the rules. Cheer Up! is an adult party card game unscientifically designed to make your sad friends laugh. (Also, there's a funny dog.)Cheer Up! takes a laughably short time to learn. In fact, you can learn right now! It works like this:The dealer picks up a Question card and reads the letters at the top aloud:Everyone else grabs two of each Answer card that match the requirements at the top (in this case, 2 A's, 2 B's, 2 C's).The dealer reads the question and everyone must use the cards in their hands to form a funny phrase, discarding the cards they did not choose. Then, the dealer asks the question to each player, who must then read their phrase out loud.But wait! There's one more twist! Before everyone reads their answers, the dealer picks up a Rule card, which will feature some wacky rule that everyone must follow for that round. This could range from
Talking in accents
Swapping cards with other players
Changing the question completely
Trying not to laugh
And many more!
And that's about it! Read the full rules or even download a black & white version of Cheer Up! for free, right now!"This was great, I loved it, I thought it was so fun!" - Beer and Board Games "A really silly game...definitely one to bring out at your parties." - Let's Level Up"The additional opportunity for creativity is most welcome...a worthy way to begin or end a game night." - Game Theory"Simple but hilarious...we'll definitely be on the lookout." - The Lifecast"I have a permanent wheeze from laughing so hard." - Natalie, an unfortunate playtester"I'm not saying this word." - Chris' Auntphoto courtesy of The Lifecast  "Wait a minute, I've played party games before," you say, in our imagination, "What's so great about this one?" Glad you asked! There are three main things that set Cheer Up! apart from other party card games. We've conveniently laid them out here like a good boy: All the cards in Cheer Up! are written for you, but in this game you get to take credit for your creative jokes. The cards give you some helpful puzzle pieces and your job is to put all the pieces together. Sometimes this will result in crazy nonsense. But, when paired with the right card, a benign word can skyrocket to extreme ridiculousness, and you get to own it, baby.There are also a handful of cards that require a little bit of advanced strategy, such as the A card "Every." It won't always make sense on it's own, but when paired with a great B it can work wonders.After multiple sessions of Cheer Up! you will likely run across the same cards, just like in any other game. However, due to the number of possible combinations, we can guarantee that no two games will ever be the same. In fact, you may never play the same combos again. Even though answer cards are recycled, it's the combination of the answers, plus the question, plus the rule that changes the context completely. If the maximum of 5 cards are used in a round, you're looking at a 1 in like...40 kablillion chance of having the exact situation come up again. We didn't do the math, but it's big.For example, in Round 1, you might get the question "What's the worst that could happen?" Maybe you chose this as your answer: The next night, the same question comes up again, but someone plays this answer:A week later, the same question comes up, and you play this unfortunate answer:So the same card was used three different times, each in a totally different way. And that's not including the fact that in the third round, you had to say it like the Queen of England.Cheer Up! was built with universal appeal in mind - the game has very few pop culture or political references, slang terms, inside jokes, or proper nouns. We want to make sure everyone has the best chance of laughing at all times. There should never be a time when you don't "get it."Furthermore, Cheer Up! is as much about performance as it is about saying funny phrases, and sometimes doing a great (or horrible) accent is the difference between winning a round or not. It's a great game to break the ice or to force shy people out of their comfort zone.For your safety.Cheer Up! can get plenty dirty and is definitely an adult party game, but none of the cards are overtly shocking or disturbing unless you create the answers that way. We find this makes for an inclusive experience that leaves people wanting more and removes the problem of a handful of cards being far superior to others. Think "silly-nasty" rather than "I'm going to Hell."However, we realize there are also times when you want to break out the big guns. Which is why:Every copy of the game will come with a 50-card NSFG (Not Safe For Grandma) Expansion Pack, for free.What's the difference you ask? The NSFG pack is full of swear words, more explicit sex stuff, darker situations, crazier rules, and slang phrases. We decided to separate it to give people even greater flexibility when playing with certain groups (or relatives...). But we also figure most people are going to want everything, which is why we decided to just straight up include it instead of splitting off an expansion pack.All of the NSFG cards are clearly marked and are sectioned off in the box. Nothing ever offend you? Shuffle in all the cards every time. Aunt Sally coming over? She'll still get a kick out of the game without having to hear you talk about your body parts. Twenty years old and still don't know what the birds and the bees are? Destroy the extra cards and tell no one.40 Questions & Rules might not seem like a lot at first glance, but each round is fairly long. With an outgoing group of six players, it would take about 4-5 hours to get through the entire stack of questions in one go.This game is already prototype'd and play-tested, and has been in the works for over 2 years. At this point we're confident that the basic game rules are complete, but during this campaign we will happily take feedback and suggestions. The time immediately after this project will be spent finalizing the design and the contents based on feedback and card suggestions. We will have to do a little playtesting with the suggestions as well to be sure they work.Our timeline is purposefully being kept loose to allow for unforeseen problems (shipping delays, misprints, Global Economic Collapse, etc.) We do not want to rush this, however, we realize you'll want this ASAP, so we will try to stick to this as bestest as possible.These are based on conservative estimates from our manufacturer, so it's possible that it would all happen faster. However, we can't promise a release in time for the holidays, though it is possible it would be ready.We have also aligned with some great partners who we are confident in, such as AdMagic for manufacturing, and multiple shipping companies depending on our final needs.Chris Rio is mostly a comedy writer from Boston. He came up with this idea in a dream (seriously) two years ago to try and help a friend get through a tough time, and now it actually looks like a real thing. He doesn't know why he is talking in third person.Niko is his off-the-books personal assistant (he gets paid in Busy Bones). Niko was the "November" in a dog calendar modeling contest one time, and he thinks all this was his idea.We make a great team.Risks & ChallengesThis may be the first project in which I reach the funding goal, but it's not the first time I've run a project. I've learned so much over the last few months it's ridiculous. First off we are keeping things extremely simple. There's pretty much only one physical product you can get which reduces shipping complications. Secondly, we are working with extremely experienced partners in manufacturing and shipping, which I can't wait to dump all my work onto.There are always chances things get away from you through either extreme success or failure, but I can assure you that this time I will do anything to make sure this game gets made and arrives in your hands, even if I have to drive it there.*Chris RioTop Dog | Cheer Up Games*I'm not going to actually drive it there.

story:
Hello Dear Friends  !   

We are happy to show you our new project with exclusive products again. Do not think that this little one is so easy to do, we did not sleep at night to these cute dice have become so brilliantly good!   You know me as one of the creators of the projects:

  • Tron Dice (T-Dice) - Lines of the Hyper-universe world in Board games 
  • Iso Dice (Isomorphic Dice) - the concept of identity forms  in Board games  
  • Heroes of the Nations - playing cards printed by USPCC
  • Aces of Egypt - collectible deck of playing cards handmade artist
  • Skull Dice Glow - exclusive set with 3D technologies 
  • Suits Dice - modern technologies in metal 

I have always sought to create unusual and exclusive things, and now I'm offering you a completely new approach to the design of the dice, complex colors combined with high technology. In addition, it's beautiful and unusual! All my friends have asked for a collection of these new dice! I hope You enjoy my project!  

  • https://www.ra-april.com/aprilglobalstore 
  • E-mail:aprilglobalstore@gmail.com

DESIGN

will become a new line of products for Board games from April GS. Even though we have big plans for a multi-color project for this line, we decided to start with two kinds of products: dice classic anodizing colors and multi-color Dice. Multicolor Symbol Dice is not designed for mass production - it is a long hard work of painting each product in an electro-galvanic bath. But metal Symbol Dice Pure colors anodizing, I suggest with the hope that we will tempt other Board game stores to purchase and promote these products

MULTICOLOR T-DICE

I added in Reward a limited limited edition Multicolor T-DICE !  To place an order, go to the rewards section and simply add $14 for one to Your order or $28 for a pair in the dedicated T-Dice section

3D

 IDEA OF CREATING 

Studying the ancient symbols of the world, we saw in them associations and numerical regularity and created a cube that is original in design and no less functional in the game, I hope you see the figures of signs in the form of numbers, like me ! In addition, we went further and came up with multi-color anodizing, it is also unusual ! Appreciate my plan ! 

MULTICOLOR ANODIZING (SUCH YOU HAVE NOT SEEN)

Technology: Download in dyeing electro-plating bath is performed several times and each item is dyed individually. In addition, it is impossible to get exactly the same color combination ! With confidence I claim-Your Dice is UNIQUE and it is the only one in the world ! 

We have worked out the technology of creating cubes, this is a very accurate product. Here You can see the billet machined strictly to the exact size of 16x16 mm. is Then processed edge and corners of 0.5 mm for better turning, then the workpiece is polished and then sent to a milling (depth 0.7 mm) and color anodizing. The balancing of the playing cube is also at a height, because the metal is not hollow, the blanks are cut from a cast all-metal sheet of aluminum alloy. This metal is safe for health, it is used in the automotive industry for the manufacture of motor parts

  • e-mail: aprilglobalstore@gmail.com
  •  https://www.ra-april.com/aprilglobalstore 

 

Risks & Challenges

We have come a long way in the production of previous projects Skull Dice, T-Dice, Suits Dice, Iso Dice. All these projects provide a basis for understanding the technology. To fulfill your plans and obligations on orders, you need to have a base and capabilities. I have experience of sending orders, besides we really learned how to make our products ourselves. We experiment and move purposefully to make your life more fun and interesting in Board games. We hope for your support. I work with every Becker personally and on a long term basis. I do not see any particular obstacles to the implementation of the project. The pursuit of quality and originality is very important. Take a look at our project, and we will support mutual !

story:
How many times have you been socialising with friends and heard the words - "We always play this game. Does anyone have anything new we could play?"Get Decked was created when myself and a group of friends who absolutely love game night needed something new to play. We were bored of the same old party games such as Kings Cup and Never Have I Ever which began to feel repetitive. Having played hundreds of games together, we set out to create Get Decked by combining all the most hilarious parts of our favorite games. Anytime we cried with laughter during game night, we found a way to bring that into Get Decked and it quickly became our go to drinking game!

We began playing the game with more and more friends and tested hundreds of cards, resulting in a wickedly hilarious game that never fails to get the party started.

Get Decked's mission is to create a fun filled night that breaks the ice every time! It's simple to use, endlessly fun and will spice up any gathering in minutes.

 

It's easy to explain, can be played anywhere in the world and doesn't even need a rule book. All you need is a few friends and a shuffle of the deck!

 There are two types of cards, Rule Cards and Mini-game Cards.

Rule Cards

For some cards you take a drink, others you give a drink, and for the lucky few, we have thrown in some extra special cards where you will have to take a shot.

To put it simply, there's only one rule - if the card applies to you, drink.

Mini-game Cards

As a result of many many game nights, we have played hundreds of games discovered at countless parties, bar crawls, camping trips, gatherings and events with friends across the world. We have handpicked the ones that were truly unforgettable to play and crafted them into mini games for you and your friends to enjoy time and time again.

Instructions for these games are on an explanation card included in the deck.

Example Mini-game Cards (2 of 25)

 

We know drinking games can get confusing, so we've focused on making Get Decked easy and fun. Wherever you are meeting friends, you can bring Get Decked with you and explain the rules to them in under 15 seconds.

Simply choose a player to go first who draws the top card of the deck and reads it aloud to all players. If it applies to you, drink. Be prepared to learn some interesting new things about your friends.

If you're lucky enough to pick up one of our special mini game cards, follow the instructions and enjoy a game that might soon become one of your favourites.

 

Are you ready to Get Decked?

 

Back our project today!

 

 All rewards below include at least one copy of Get Decked!

Risks and challenges

We’ve built a strong relationship with a top card manufacturer who is waiting to receive the order for our backers. We have a member of our team working alongside the company allowing excellent communication. They know exactly what we are expecting based off the prototypes and have ensured us that the manufacturing process will run smoothly. The only risk would be an highly unlikely unforeseen event that delay's the production process. We will work diligently in making sure that Get Decked is shipped out as promised for the estimated time and if things run smooth, we expect it to be delivered earlier than this. We will continually update our backers on the progress of our campaign and answer any questions in a timely manner. You may reach out to us here, or through our company email team@getdeckedgame.com.

story:
Summary

This project is built on the basis of our previous project on Kickstarter. We successfully completed our first Kickstarter, implemented our ideas, and made significant improvements. Now we want to make our miniatures available to a wider audience.

 

 

 

What You Get

This system will make our products as affordable as possible. We are constantly improving what we are process and our miniatures, and in this project you will get the most recent improvements. Our customers love our miniatures, and we know you will too. You will get all available discounts if get at least 400 backers, and that is why it is so important to invite as many friends as possible.

All miniatures are made from premium resin, the best on the market. This project offers two size scales.

For fans of board games  and wargaming, 28mm HEROIC scale.

For artists who prefer larger models and collectors, 1:11 scale.


Advanced kits will include magnets, so you can easily switch parts without having to use glue.



 

 

Reviews

 

 

 

 

 

 

Shipping
 

Shipping will be charged after the campaign through our store-based pledge manager, based on the actual cost to ship your pledge and any additional rewards you select.

worldwide shipping from $8,86 to $23,53 

 

Risks & Challenges

We are not new to crowdfunding platforms; our first Kickstarter was completed successfully, and we received a lot of great feedback. 
 

All the miniatures are real and have been prepared for casting and will be delivered as soon as possible.

Delays can occur only if the number of people is more than we expected.
