story:
Story

The Torshn Puzzle is a surprisingly difficult challenge and an alluring addition to your desk, shelf, or coffee table.

The objective is simple– align the colors to each other by sliding the marbles and twisting the halves. Solving the puzzle may initially seem straightforward, but you’ll quickly find that it’s trickier than it looks! 

The dichotomy between simplicity and complexity is what makes the Torshn Puzzle a special puzzle for people of all ages and backgrounds. While an 11-year-old may not have a fully developed brain, she does not have the hindering ego of a 30-year-old college grad. While the working adult may have the spatial awareness and problem solving skills to manipulate the puzzle more efficiently, they may not have the patience and perseverance of a retired grandma with time to kill. Everyone that has picked up the Torshn Puzzle thus far has had a completely different approach to solving it and unique challenges specific to their personality and skillset. 

Like the Rubik’s cube and the original orb puzzle, the Torshn Puzzle is complex enough to be fun after multiple solves. However, it is simple enough that it is approachable. You don't need to discover or memorize a bunch of fancy algorithms to solve the Torshn Puzzle, but it sure does help if you do.


 

In a world that increasingly fills your mind with clutter, it’s important to take a step back and focus your energy into a single objective. The Torshn puzzle is a simple challenge yet requires your undivided attention. We’ve found that playing with the Torshn Puzzle allows us to reduce stress and increase our productivity in other aspects of life. It stimulates, yet eases our minds simultaneously.

The origins of puzzles go back as far as 2300 BC when Ancient Greeks and Egyptians developed and solved labyrinths. Since then, puzzles have grown and evolved into countless shapes and forms. However, the physical and mental benefits of puzzle solving remain all the same.

Puzzles exercise the left and right sides of the brain simultaneously. They’re a mental workout that improves problem-solving skills and attention span. Doing puzzles reinforces connections between brain cells, improves mental speed, and is an especially effective way to improve short-term memory.  It’s no surprise that Bill Gates is an avid puzzler!

Being a three-dimensional challenge, the Torshn puzzle promotes the development of a wider perception to the process of problem solving. It requires spatial awareness and memory, as not all of the spheres are visible simultaneously. Playing with the puzzle develops finger-eye coordination and requires dexterity to reposition the spheres efficiently. Perhaps most important of all, patience and perseverance are also necessary because it's trickier than it looks!

 

There are more than seven hundred thousand different possible ways for the colors to be arranged, and only 6 different combinations that leave the puzzle solved.

 

This journey began as a design exploration of the sphericon but quickly became a consuming pursuit to make the greatest puzzle that we could. We wanted to create a unique, forever lasting, and beautiful puzzle that anybody could enjoy and play with.

We know that design must embody purpose– that every aspect of a design must consciously add to its whole. We wanted to make something breathtaking but also ergonomic and simple.

 

We combined form and function to achieve these three goals:

A design that could easily fit into a museum

A challenge not too difficult for anyone, but tricky enough to be interesting and replayable

A puzzle built with exceptional quality and in a way that would last forever.
 

We drew inspiration from a puzzle we grew up playing with– the Orb Puzzle invented by Christopher C. Wiggs and Christopher J. Taylor in 1981.

After months of design, brainstorming, and prototyping, we landed on utilizing the continuous face of a sphericon as cavities for spheres to move along. This allows for extremely smooth and simple movement of the pieces, something that the Orb Puzzle lacked.

The dimensions of the Torshn Puzzle was a challenge to perfect. Larger cavities and spheres made the puzzle easier to work with, but created less visually harmonious proportions. Smaller cavities and more spheres were prettier and closer resembled the original Orb Puzzle, but resulted in a puzzle that was more difficult to solve and difficult to manipulate smoothly.

 

We played with and tested over 50 iterations of the puzzle. With each puzzle, we fine tuned every curve, track, and divet by as little as a quarter of a millimeter to a develop a puzzle that is as sturdy as a rock, pretty to look at, and graceful to handle.

Longevity is extremely important to us. We despise how unsustainable plastic is. We wanted to create something that would last forever– something that will be passed on for generations to come and won’t end up in a landfill somewhere. We wanted something that had little chance of breaking and would be repairable if it did. So we knew the final product would be constructed from a sustainable metal body.

 

When we made our first metal prototype, we were blown away. It became a sculpture that you can play with. Steel was too heavy and titanium was too expensive. We decided on anodized aluminum– sturdy yet lightweight.

It’s not cheap to mill from a solid chunk of metal, but after considering countless different manufacturing methods, it’s the only way to make the best Torshn Puzzle that we can. Metal construction allows us to achieve the strict tolerances required for the puzzle to spin smoothly while being everlasting. It also doesn’t hurt that aluminum is the most abundant metal on the planet and 100% recyclable! +1 for sustainability.

It took us a while to perfect the finish– we wanted something that was smooth to the touch and beautiful to look at under all lights. We tried brushed, coated, polished, but ultimately landed on anodized and finely sandblasted. We think that the result is breathtaking.

 

We’re a team of tinkerers and makers with over 15 years of combined experience in industrial design and contract manufacturing. We share a passion for puzzles of all kinds, and want to share our personal creations with the world. Torshn Design is the product of us being tired of working on projects that we lacked autonomy over. Our goal is to create puzzles that are unique, mind-tickling, and forever-lasting. We’re a small team located in Oakland, California, and we’re excited to embark on this journey with you! 

Why support our campaign?

You or someone you know loves puzzles
 

You like conversation starters and desk art
 

You need a stress-relieving escape from everyday life
 

You have a child and you know that puzzles are one of the greatest tools for their development
 

You want to keep your brain sharp and prevent early onset of diseases like Alzheimer's and dementia
 

You’re fascinated by rare mathematical shapes
 

 You want to support designers who are truly passionate about the product they build
 

You hate unsustainable products made by conglomerates and want to put your money where your mouth is by helping small creators bring their ideas to life (ok that was a little bit specific...)
 

The design is finished, the manufacturing process is solidified, and we’re so excited to share the Torshn Puzzle with the world. We need your help to make our first production run and bring it to life.

Below is a table that represents what our estimated shipping costs are for the Torshn Puzzle. Your pledge does not include shipping and you will pay for shipping AFTER the campaign ends. We are handling shipping this way to get backers the lowest possible shipping price. We don't want to unnecessarily over-charge for shipping. These are estimated costs based on an average range of shipping quotes we've attained from different carriers and may change depending on our final results. We believe we have a pretty efficient solution for US backers (shipping directly from our studio) but are still working on finding even better solutions for international backers (more fulfillment centers). Please keep in mind that the Torshn Puzzle is heavy and the shipping costs reflect its weight.

After the campaign ends, we will be sending you a BackerKit.com survey which will securely process your color choice, address, and shipping payment which will hopefully be lower than quoted below.

We plan to optimize distribution efficiency and minimize emissions by working with fulfillment partners in multiple countries, rather than shipping each individual package out from our studio. Regardless, please know that we are trying our best to optimize shipping so that everyone can receive the Torshn Puzzle at an affordable rate. Our goal is to make this process as transparent and accurate as possible, without any false promises or unexpected changes.

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.

Risks and challenges

Production Our manufacturing process is set in stone, and we’ve partnered up with an extremely experienced factory to bring each Torshn Puzzle to life. They’ve brought great expertise to the table and have been a pleasure to work with. However, in our years of experience in manufacturing and bringing designs to mass production, we’ve learned that seldom does a project go from start to finish without behind-the-scenes roadblocks. We have the experience to deal with that. We’ve mapped out every scenario we can think of to avoid any surprises. However, if anything unexpected does arise, we promise to be 100% transparent with our backers– communication is of utmost importance to us. We believe that great communication builds great relationships and therefore great trust. We look forward to embarking on this journey together! Shipping & Logistics Along with rising shipping costs in the last decade, the pandemic has only made logistics more expensive. Especially with the weight of the Torshn Puzzle, we have been quoted higher shipping costs than we would have seen before. We believe we have a pretty efficient solution for US backers but are still working on finding even better solutions for international backers. We want everyone around the world to be able to enjoy the puzzle. Regardless, please know that we are trying our best to optimize shipping so everyone can receive the Torshn Puzzle at an affordable rate.

Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Environmental commitments

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.

Long-lasting design

From the very beginning, we set out to make a puzzle that would last virtually forever– an heirloom that can be passed on from generation to generation. Mechanism: We designed the Torshn Puzzle to be as simple as possible to avoid any complications over time. The cavities through which the marbles move are milled from a solid chunk of aluminum. The precision and smoothness of the cavities prevent the marbles from getting worn down, and the sturdiness of the cavities themselves mean that they won't get eroded by glass marbles either. The spinning mechanism of the Torshn Puzzle is made possible by rare earth neodymium magnets, which are permanent magnets and only lose a fraction of their performance every 100 years. Material: We chose Anodized aluminum because it is extremely sturdy and will not degrade over time. It is more durable, wear resistant, and more life-proof than any wood or plastic alternative.

Reusability and recyclability

Aluminum is the only metal that can be recycled an infinite number of times, as it does not degrade during the recycling process. Although our packaging isn't set in stone, we plan to use either cork, hemp, or recycled paper to keep the Torshn Puzzle safe in transit rather than bubblewrap or packing peanuts. Plastic sucks. We also designed the Torshn Puzzle to be easily repairable if anything ever goes wrong. The marbles, magnets, and rotational axis are all easily replaceable if broken or lost.

Sustainable materials

As we've stated before, aluminum is lightweight, strong, and highly recyclable. It is one of the only materials out there that can be recycled an infinite number of times, as it does not degrade during the recycling process.

Sustainable Distribution

We plan to optimize distribution efficiency and minimize emissions by working with fulfillment partners in multiple countries, rather than shipping each individual package out from our studio.
story_txt:
Story
The Torshn Puzzle is a surprisingly difficult challenge and an alluring addition to your desk, shelf, or coffee table.
The objective is simple– align the colors to each other by sliding the marbles and twisting the halves. Solving the puzzle may initially seem straightforward, but you’ll quickly find that it’s trickier than it looks! 
The dichotomy between simplicity and complexity is what makes the Torshn Puzzle a special puzzle for people of all ages and backgrounds. While an 11-year-old may not have a fully developed brain, she does not have the hindering ego of a 30-year-old college grad. While the working adult may have the spatial awareness and problem solving skills to manipulate the puzzle more efficiently, they may not have the patience and perseverance of a retired grandma with time to kill. Everyone that has picked up the Torshn Puzzle thus far has had a completely different approach to solving it and unique challenges specific to their personality and skillset. 
Like the Rubik’s cube and the original orb puzzle, the Torshn Puzzle is complex enough to be fun after multiple solves. However, it is simple enough that it is approachable. You don't need to discover or memorize a bunch of fancy algorithms to solve the Torshn Puzzle, but it sure does help if you do.
 
In a world that increasingly fills your mind with clutter, it’s important to take a step back and focus your energy into a single objective. The Torshn puzzle is a simple challenge yet requires your undivided attention. We’ve found that playing with the Torshn Puzzle allows us to reduce stress and increase our productivity in other aspects of life. It stimulates, yet eases our minds simultaneously.
The origins of puzzles go back as far as 2300 BC when Ancient Greeks and Egyptians developed and solved labyrinths. Since then, puzzles have grown and evolved into countless shapes and forms. However, the physical and mental benefits of puzzle solving remain all the same.
Puzzles exercise the left and right sides of the brain simultaneously. They’re a mental workout that improves problem-solving skills and attention span. Doing puzzles reinforces connections between brain cells, improves mental speed, and is an especially effective way to improve short-term memory.  It’s no surprise that Bill Gates is an avid puzzler!
Being a three-dimensional challenge, the Torshn puzzle promotes the development of a wider perception to the process of problem solving. It requires spatial awareness and memory, as not all of the spheres are visible simultaneously. Playing with the puzzle develops finger-eye coordination and requires dexterity to reposition the spheres efficiently. Perhaps most important of all, patience and perseverance are also necessary because it's trickier than it looks!
 
There are more than seven hundred thousand different possible ways for the colors to be arranged, and only 6 different combinations that leave the puzzle solved.
 
This journey began as a design exploration of the sphericon but quickly became a consuming pursuit to make the greatest puzzle that we could. We wanted to create a unique, forever lasting, and beautiful puzzle that anybody could enjoy and play with.
We know that design must embody purpose– that every aspect of a design must consciously add to its whole. We wanted to make something breathtaking but also ergonomic and simple.
 
We combined form and function to achieve these three goals:
A design that could easily fit into a museum
A challenge not too difficult for anyone, but tricky enough to be interesting and replayable
A puzzle built with exceptional quality and in a way that would last forever. 
We drew inspiration from a puzzle we grew up playing with– the Orb Puzzle invented by Christopher C. Wiggs and Christopher J. Taylor in 1981.
After months of design, brainstorming, and prototyping, we landed on utilizing the continuous face of a sphericon as cavities for spheres to move along. This allows for extremely smooth and simple movement of the pieces, something that the Orb Puzzle lacked.
The dimensions of the Torshn Puzzle was a challenge to perfect. Larger cavities and spheres made the puzzle easier to work with, but created less visually harmonious proportions. Smaller cavities and more spheres were prettier and closer resembled the original Orb Puzzle, but resulted in a puzzle that was more difficult to solve and difficult to manipulate smoothly.
 
We played with and tested over 50 iterations of the puzzle. With each puzzle, we fine tuned every curve, track, and divet by as little as a quarter of a millimeter to a develop a puzzle that is as sturdy as a rock, pretty to look at, and graceful to handle.
Longevity is extremely important to us. We despise how unsustainable plastic is. We wanted to create something that would last forever– something that will be passed on for generations to come and won’t end up in a landfill somewhere. We wanted something that had little chance of breaking and would be repairable if it did. So we knew the final product would be constructed from a sustainable metal body.
 
When we made our first metal prototype, we were blown away. It became a sculpture that you can play with. Steel was too heavy and titanium was too expensive. We decided on anodized aluminum– sturdy yet lightweight.
It’s not cheap to mill from a solid chunk of metal, but after considering countless different manufacturing methods, it’s the only way to make the best Torshn Puzzle that we can. Metal construction allows us to achieve the strict tolerances required for the puzzle to spin smoothly while being everlasting. It also doesn’t hurt that aluminum is the most abundant metal on the planet and 100% recyclable! +1 for sustainability.
It took us a while to perfect the finish– we wanted something that was smooth to the touch and beautiful to look at under all lights. We tried brushed, coated, polished, but ultimately landed on anodized and finely sandblasted. We think that the result is breathtaking.
 
We’re a team of tinkerers and makers with over 15 years of combined experience in industrial design and contract manufacturing. We share a passion for puzzles of all kinds, and want to share our personal creations with the world. Torshn Design is the product of us being tired of working on projects that we lacked autonomy over. Our goal is to create puzzles that are unique, mind-tickling, and forever-lasting. We’re a small team located in Oakland, California, and we’re excited to embark on this journey with you! 
Why support our campaign?
You or someone you know loves puzzles 
You like conversation starters and desk art 
You need a stress-relieving escape from everyday life 
You have a child and you know that puzzles are one of the greatest tools for their development 
You want to keep your brain sharp and prevent early onset of diseases like Alzheimer's and dementia 
You’re fascinated by rare mathematical shapes 
 You want to support designers who are truly passionate about the product they build 
You hate unsustainable products made by conglomerates and want to put your money where your mouth is by helping small creators bring their ideas to life (ok that was a little bit specific...) 
The design is finished, the manufacturing process is solidified, and we’re so excited to share the Torshn Puzzle with the world. We need your help to make our first production run and bring it to life.

We are handling shipping this way to get backers the lowest possible shipping price. We don't want to unnecessarily over-charge for shipping. These are estimated costs based on an average range of shipping quotes we've attained from different carriers and may change depending on our final results. We believe we have a pretty efficient solution for US backers (shipping directly from our studio) but are still working on finding even better solutions for international backers (more fulfillment centers). Please keep in mind that the Torshn Puzzle is heavy and the shipping costs reflect its weight.

story:
It is said that the Chimeras would throw their cubs into an abyss as a test, for only the strongest ones would emerge. That is a lie and completely irrelevant.

Our story is one of hardship and misery but also of heroism. The Three, as We are commonly know, hail from different backgrounds.

The Sketcher, comes from the scorching deserts of Arabia. Banished from His homeland, the constant fight against thirst, sun, boredom, and the fact that He couldn't speak Arabic, forced Him to find different ways to communicate with the natives. He only knew how to draw camels, which either made the natives point Him to other camels, or just moved away, for His interest in camels was strange. As such, He had to develop better drawing skills as to express Himself, and find His way home. It is said that His drawing of a camel with wings was so good, that it made someone give Him directions to the airport, at long last.

The Taskmaster, comes from the legendary land of explorers, discoverers of the world as we know it. Portugal. Living in a poor, coastal area near the capital, He had to develop skills as to get by, scrounging whatever resources He could. Other poor souls would listen to Him, either to ask things to try and learn from Him and as such, The Taskmaster soon realized "Why work if i can force others to do my bidding?". Now that He had the means, He turned His gaze into the capital. For years has it mocked Him, with restaurants and better public transportation. But no more...

The Unfathomable, a survivor from lost Atlantis. Not much is known of Him, nor His reasons. Some say He has untold knowledge, some say He is the harbinger of the end times, others say He left His homeland because someone shared spoilers of His favorite movie before it even got to the theaters there. Be it as it may, when asked about it, He speaks in His ancient ways of speaking and accent. The man remains a mystery because everybody just nods and leaves without understanding a word He said. Seriously, His accent is just weird.

Fate was set in motion for The Three, mighty as They were, would soon find each other. The Taskmaster felt that the knowledge that The Unfathomable held could be of use to Him, but not knowing how to speak His language, asked The Sketcher to use His legendary skill of turning anything spoken into a drawing of a camel as translation. The Unfathomable was in awe as He saw the drawing and, to everyone's surprise, He wrote in the drawing a thing that changed everyhing:

"What does the camel mean?"

They realized They could now easily communicate and set in motion the plans that everyone really wanted... To offer the world the best most brutal card game possible.

 

 

Cards of Destruction is a fun party game with some big consequences, should you decide to take the challenge! Its our take on a "Truth or Dare" type game but with dares that will most likely leave you contemplating on where have you gone wrong in your life.

In short, you take a card and either do what the card says or pay the punishment!

"Oh, that hardly seems hard!" you say? Well then, allow me to retort! Would you prefer to suffer a punishment or:

*Call the third last number dialed and just scream your lungs out for 5 seconds then hang up*

Not impressed? how about:*For the next turn, you must be standing up, pole dancing (even if there is no pole)*

Oh we have a bad *insert gender here* huh? How about:*The person to your left can post on your most used social media news feed*

Would you still do it? Or is the punishment starting to look like a good choice?Be warned, those are one of the EASIEST ones we have...

 

 

OR

 

 

We might be a new company, but we’ve put our dedication and best efforts in making a
fun, hopefully controversial, card game that will provide any buyer with potentially
countless game sessions.


We are committed in delivering a high-quality product, within the limitation of the
materials chosen. We already have in our possession, prototypes from every Tier we
intend to make, so we will not be sending this product blindly, as we have checked the
printing quality and the material itself of the cards.


We have also proofread every single card, two times over, to make sure no spelling
errors, or poor written English, is printed.


Manufacturing will start as soon as the campaign ends. We have all the templates
needed for production settled with our manufactures, so we can minimize any delays or
problems that could arise.


Because of the current pandemic, there is always risk in global shipping, but we want to
make sure our products can reach everyone, and we will do everything in our hands to
maintain a regular and quick shipping pace.

Would you still do it? Or is the punishment starting to look like a good choice?Be warned, those are one of the EASIEST ones we have...
 
 








OR


 
 





We might be a new company, but we’ve put our dedication and best efforts in making afun, hopefully controversial, card game that will provide any buyer with potentiallycountless game sessions.
We are committed in delivering a high-quality product, within the limitation of thematerials chosen. We already have in our possession, prototypes from every Tier weintend to make, so we will not be sending this product blindly, as we have checked theprinting quality and the material itself of the cards.
We have also proofread every single card, two times over, to make sure no spellingerrors, or poor written English, is printed.
Manufacturing will start as soon as the campaign ends. We have all the templatesneeded for production settled with our manufactures, so we can minimize any delays orproblems that could arise.
Because of the current pandemic, there is always risk in global shipping, but we want tomake sure our products can reach everyone, and we will do everything in our hands tomaintain a regular and quick shipping pace.

story:
This campaign is a continuation of our previous successful kickstarter campaign. We decided to run an Indiegogo for those who missed the previous crowdfunding, and at the same time as an opportunity to reach new Stretch Goals for all backers from both Kickstarter and Indiegogo. We are very thankful and appreciate all of you who believe and support us!

HOW THE GAMEPLAY IS LIKE:




 

THE GAME CONCEPT

 

GAME RULES

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Mechanics of the game have been tested with more than 200 people. These are people we met at conventions and game cafes, along with retail partners that are interested in our game.

Artwork of the cards and box is completed so we do not see any issues there.

Production of the game is simple: it's just a card game. It's a relatively straightforward product to make. We're already working with the same card maker that has worked on and fulfilled successful crowdfunding campaigns before. This is to make sure that no matter how many people pledge, everyone gets their Sad Piggies quickly after the campaign ends.

If you support this project, we want to be sure you are in Team Sad Piggies right away. As part of the Team, you get first-hand information on how the progress of the production and any new improvements and variations of the gameplay for life.

We're keeping our rewards as simple as possible: support our project and in return, we'll send you the playable game so that it won’t complicate the shipping timeline.

story:
What is The Board?

The Board is a highly strategic card game about wacky scheming, cynical real startup scene—in other words, it is a game about winning the market share! In order to win the game, each player assumes as the role of the company's board of director must use different tactics to gain enough users. The deck is made of cards that let you sabotage other players or to gain enough users to win the game.

Play with up to 6 friends, of any company with an average time of 30 mins depending on the number of players. But are they really your friends? Remember: it’s not about the people. It’s about Winning The Market Share.

Why are we making The Board?

We want to make a world a better place through The Board card game. There are a lot of problems in the startup world. We want people to know what we know. This game can educate not only the people who think they know startup but also the general public about the problems startup has to deal with. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are interested in the project and cannot afford to contribute, you can surely afford to share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends on social media or even talk to your company to back us with Coworking Space Pack (9 Decks + 1 Company Poster From The Board Game ) and get a 50% discount!

Special Thanks To:

Icon made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com

story:
Dear viewers,

Dire times have come upon War Box Gaming channel. We have lost access to our high end camera. ;( ;( ;( That effectively forces us to suspend recording until further notice or to record using an old camera which has survived a salt water bath at some point in its history. We are choosing the latter alternative.

Despair not though! We are determined to recover and upgrade our quality with a new camera, better lighting and green screen asap. We are saving up and will be able to afford a new camera around September - mostly because we have already committed to expanding our model and scenery range, also into 40k - new armies and painting cost us many an arm and a leg. If you want to help us speed this process up please donate our cause. Any contribution will matter to us. Help make WBG greater still!

See our work here:

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCk-zgu6UQsyy5B...

https://www.facebook.com/WarBoxGaming/

story:
Unicorns and Zombies is the highly anticipated turn-based card game that is making its way to the masses. The game is a combination of humor, beautifully creative graphic art, multi-layered strategic options, and a cast of crazy characters. On one side, a gruesome army of undead zombies strive to destroy everything in an already war-torn dystopia. On the other side, a magical squad of colorful unicorns with deadly horns and a fatally enchanting glare prepare to go to battle. Players choose a side and fight for supremacy using a combination of character-specific skills, gear, and battle actions. You choose! #TeamZombies or #TeamUnicorns

TWO PLAYER GAMEPLAY

 

 

Our Press Releases! (There are a ton more!)

"Unicorns and Zombies: Hot New Card Game Expected to Be Among the Best of 2019 

The highly anticipated battleground card game, now available on Kickstarter, pits Unicorns and Zombies against one another in a war-torn futuristic world."

Unicorns and Zombies is the brain child of this guy

Jason Davis

 

Risks & Challenges

We did our first successful campaign on Kickstarter. This is coming off of a non-successful one prior. We learned from it. The goal is to build a community around the game, the idea, and the love for Unicorns and Zombies. 

We're already in the getting production phase up and running. This was made possible by our friends, family, and other passionate Tabletoppers on Kickstarter! Now we're bringing it here to you. This is a pre-order

There may be some hiccups along the way, we're learning. We will deliver a great game. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute with money? NOT A PROBLEM! Help us by sharing the campaign. Spread the word. Get the buzz rolling. Still not enough? Think you can really help? Contact us, you never know!

story:
About the project - Aadarsh Gaon game

Inspired by rural village life in North India, this cooperative board game provides a way for players to build an ideal community or 'Aadarsh Gaon' through social problem-solving. The safe, risk-free setting brings players together to work as a team, think critically, and form strategies.

We are a team of researchers, students and volunteers from Amrita University who have been working on solutions for inclusive empowerment. We have spent a significant amount of time with the disadvantaged communities to understand the issues that hamper meaningful community engagement. And from our research and fieldwork, we found that serious games, especially board games like these, can make a huge, positive difference in their lives. This game-based approach has made our initiatives more constructive, relevant and meaningful. Players become active problem solvers in the community. They become champions.

So with your help, we can reach out to more individuals and communities who need games like Aadarsh Gaon.

 

Select your perk - Are you 'Golden heart' or a 'Silver heart'

Silver heart: You get one copy of Aadarsh Gaon game kit including all goals cards, actions spaces, tokens and game guidebook.

Golden heart: You know deep inside your heart if you are a golden heart. If you are one, you will be contributing to our cause of building tools for constructive community engagement. Your extra support will cover the expenses of producing an Aadarsh Gaon game kit and use it the communities that require this the most. 

So you get a one full game kit of Aadarsh Gaon and we will ship one game kit to one of the villages in the Amrita SeRVe project where this game kit will be used as a teaching tool.

Read more about the villages and the Amrita SeRVe project: https://amritaserve.org/

Village women in Kanti, Haryana playing one of our prototypes with our field expert, Seema Chowdhury. The group devised a plan to solve their social problems in their community after this gameplay.

Games for Change

Project Mentor and Director of AMMACHI Labs, Prof. Rao R. Bhavani shares her insights and experience on games for change and Aadarsh Gaon.
 

Game Set Up

 

How To Play

Aadarsh Gaon kit at the start of gameplay

Team

Game Design: Sreeram Kongeseri [www.sreeramkongeseri.com]

Artwork: Bob Clausen  [http://www.bobclausen.com/]

Video & Photo: Fabien Zorin [https://www.flickr.com/photos/125082824@N06/]

Design & Development: Abhinav Madipatti

Sound: Yashwin Suvarna, Abhisekh Surathkal [https://m.soundcloud.com/abhishek09]

Early concept development of Aadarsh Gaon at AMMACHI Labs [www.ammachilabs.org]

Special thanks to  Renjith P, Amritesh Nair, Nair, Muralidharan T, Sooraj, Ajay Balakrishnan, Deependra Dev, Vishnu Vinod, Shalini T S, Bhagyalakshmi Nair, Priyanka Singh, Jamie Osterberg, Lizzie Corley, Sharanya M, Noelle, Sharada Iser, Akshay Mahesh and friends at AMMACHI Labs and Amrita University.

Risks & Challenges

The game kit will be manufactured and shipped from India.  Production is going to be the primary challenge. There are variables that I have no control over that may cause problems to occur. This is my first crowdfunding campaign, but I am confident that I'll be able to deliver on this as long as the campaign is funded. I will keep you informed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.                                    

Share this campaign with your friends and family and encourage them to support and spread the word around.

story:
Dirty Money is a strategic card game where players take on the role of criminals and corrupted politicians, trying to launder dirty money using artwork and businesses, while evading detection from government agencies.

 

Set in the same universe of Debtzilla, you now get to play the roles of the Villains and Dirty Money features fan favorite villains such as Loan Shark and Corruption Rat. 

Every turn plays fast!

You decide on a location to visit, collect the dirty money your organization has made and decide how to turn them into businesses and artwork. While this is going on, you need to be forward thinking, planning the types of currencies to be collected and what combinations of assets to buy in order to earn the most amount of points. In the meantime, you have to be careful of not hoarding too much dirty money as other players will be whistleblowing to the cops and unleashing them onto you, causing you to earn blacklist points which will lower your final score. Are you able to keep up a front of an upright businessman while trying to get rid of those ill-gotten gains as fast as possible? 

The game is designed by internationally acclaimed Singaporean board game designer Daryl Chow (Overbooked, The Artemis Project, Remember Our Trip, Ramen Ink etc), and illustrated by top Singaporean comic artist, Alan Bay (Sacred Legend, Once Upon a Singapore Traders etc). 

Harnessing the strength of Singapore's top talents, Dirty Money promises to be a treat, mentally and visually. 

 

Lion City Hideout Pack features famous spots in Singapore which you can use to replace the locations in the base set. These items will not be available in retail so grab them during the Kickstarter Campaign! 

 
 

 

 

If you want to give Dirty Money a try, you can visit our Tabletopia link! Note that the cards may not be the same as the final product as it is still work in progress! 

 

 

Check Out! The Convenience Store Game is produced by Mercat Games, designed by the same brains behind Capital Gains Studio. Instead of finance themed games, they have unleashed their creativity on Asian themed games. Check Out! comes with the Pandemic Protection Pack which was only available during its pre-order campaign and this Kickstarter. Limited copies only!

Other than Dirty Money, you can check out the published games by Capital Gains Studio and get a copy of them via the "Dirty Money + Check Out!" and "Master of Finance" pledge tier. If you wish to add a single copy of any of the game to your pledge, just add the amount below and we will advice you on the adjusted shipping charges on optional add-ons.

​

US & EU FRIENDLY SHIPPING

This project is US-Friendly and EU-Friendly, and therefore no additional charges or fees will apply due to taxes or customs. If you do come across issues on tax and custom fees, do drop us an email and we will take care of it.

Capital Gains Studio will be subsidizing a large portion of the shipping cost as a promotion for our campaign. We also reserve the right to decline any shipping to countries with an active armed conflict or a country with a high chance of non-delivery. We will refund any pledge made in this case after a review with our logistics partners.

The expected delivery date of Dirty Money is July 2021.

Capital Gains Studio is a Singapore-based tabletop publisher, best known for publishing finance focused games. We aspire to create games that explore various aspects of finance, while creating games with great mechanics and artwork. Our games, Cryptocurrency and Debtzilla have won top awards at Serious Play International. We have also worked with government agencies, multi-national corporations and individuals to help them design and publish tabletop games to engage and educate their stakeholders. The same team set up Mercat Games with the aim of publishing games for the Asian families, with Check Out! The Convenience Store Game as our first game. Mercat Games also aspires to help Asian designers publish games with strong Asian influence.

Daryl Chow is a globally acclaimed and award-winning board game designer with extensive international experience and networks in the board game industry. In 2018, he launched two successful Kickstarter campaigns, The Artemis Project, that reached over USD $120,000 in funding, and Overbooked, which has been licensed in many languages with tens of thousands of copies sold worldwide.

Alan Bay (Smallguydoodle) is Singapore's top independent artist who works on comics, board games and illustrations. His comic book 'Once Upon A Singapore... Traders' had been nominated for Singapore Book Award 2019. His latest comic book Sacred Legends, was recently launched on Aug 2020.

Xeo Lye is the lead developer behind the games produced by Capital Gains Studio. Previously, he spent a decade in the financial world managing money, authoring financial books & blogs and giving public talks and later turned to the world of board game publishing to continue his passion in using board games to explore different aspects of the financial world. Xeo is the designer of Wongamania and Debtzilla.

Jaslyn Lim has many years of experience working in the banking and finance industry and continues to helm the finance role.  With an eye for detail, she helps with proof-reading and also assists with the writing of educational guide. Unleashing her creativity juices, she participates actively in the brainstorming process during the creation of games.

Kieran Gan is a graphic designer turned illustrator, assisting with the production of marketing collaterals for Dirty Money. He has experience in the field of concept design and illustration.

 

 

Risks and challenges

Capital Gains Studio has designed and published over a dozen games, both in-house and for corporate customers and individuals and we are confident that our team has a solid grasp on the process of designing, developing, manufacturing and delivering high quality tabletop games. When it comes to a project like this, there are always risks regarding production and delivery that are beyond our control and may cause delays. However, we are confident of delivering by the stated dateline.

Due to the uncertainty of the impact of COVID-19 on international freight services, the shipping rates may be adjusted to reflect a possible spike in shipping rates though we will try as much as possible to absorb small increases in shipping rates.

As with any foreign production/logistics, we may still be faced with unforeseen circumstances such as manufacturing and shipment delays or errors. If we were to meet with an issue, we promise to keep everyone updated and will share details of the problems and our solutions.

We may produce additional copies for the Kickstarter editions of the game as a result of the manufacturing process and we will sell these excess copies through our website or through special events and conventions.

Check out our previous campaigns on the kind of communication you can expect due to any manufacturing issue or shipping delay. If you have any question or concern, please do not hesitate to contact us at info@capitalgainsgroup.com. 

Thank you in advance for believing in us and supporting our project!

story:
Making a Difference

It's been a challenging year, but through it all the best of what it means to be human remains the same: to love others. That is why we are creating an opportunity to love using board games.

We have teamed up with Rio Grande Games to donate 20% of your board game purchase to Feeding America and assist the fight against hunger!

If you are going to buy board games, why not choose to buy games to help the hungry?

Our goal is to raise $1000 to feed the hungry, which also means bringing $5000 of board games to people like you!

 

The Games!

Rescuing Robin Hood
Rescuing Robin Hood is a collaborative deck-building game for the whole family. Build a Merry Band of villagers ready to defeat the Sheriff using Wit, Stealth, Brawn, and Jolliness and return Robin Hood back to the village of Nottingham. Gameplay includes mental math, elementary statistics, and is packed full of puns, history and fun strategies to discover as you prepare to storm the castle!

Since it is new game we have included a few reviews to help you get sense of the game:

  • Purple Phoenix Games - written review
  • Love 2 Hate Review - 1 minute video review summary
  • Better Half Reviews - 15 min video review with short how to play summary

 

Dominion (Base Game and/or Expansions)
Dominion is a deck-building game where the deck contains your resources, victory points, and the things you can do as the Monarch to grow your kingdom into a thriving civilization. Fend off other like-minded Monarchs and by the end of the game your kingdom could be brimming with Gold!

You can buy the base game or we have selected some of the best Dominion expansions for you to enjoy: Seaside, Prosperity, Menagerie and Adventures!

Power Grid
Power Grid is an economic game about creating power grids. By bidding against one another for power plants and raw materials, players attempt to expand their power supply to as many cities as possible while also finding the cheapest routes! However, as plants are purchased, newer, more efficient plants become available. How will you maximize your efficiency?

 

Every dollar helps a good cause!

Here is the breakdown of where your money goes, after transaction fees:

  • Feeding America (20% of game dollars) – A non-profit network of food banks helping solve food scarcity. US Charity Navigator has highlighted Feeding America as an “excellent cause providing excellent results” for 9 year in a row! 10% of game dollars will go to the national Feeding America organization and the other 10% to Second Harvest, the local southern WI food bank of Feeding America. 
  • Board game publishers (80% remaining of game dollars) – Support for the companies that bring us the games we love the most!

    • Blackstar Assets (100% of shipping dollars) – An amazing local small business whose goal is to get equipment that is difficult to sell into the hands of the right people rather than being thrown into a landfill. By fulfilling board games with Castillo Games they can gain more scale and lower their shipping prices which means less equipment thrown into landfills each year!

     

    How to Support

    Share with friends on Social Media -  Based on previous campaigns we estimate a share on social media helps to raise an average of $30 for the campaign which means you helped to raise $6 for the hungry just by sharing on social media. Make an impact today and share this project with friends!

     

    Timeline

    • September & October - games arrive to fulfillment centers
    • October - Games are delivered to your door

     

    Risks & Challenges

    With two crowdfunding campaigns under our belt, we are confident in our ability to fulfill perks to our backers. We believe in high transparency and good communication, providing regular updates.

    The risk of this campaign is very low. Mass production of all games is complete. For Rescuing Robin Hood, the games have left the factory, but they could experience shipping or customs delays. Rio Grande Games inventory is in the US, so delays are unlikely. Additionally, with a flexible funding goal you will get your game even if we don't reach out goal.

Blackstar Assets (100% of shipping dollars) – An amazing local small business whose goal is to get equipment that is difficult to sell into the hands of the right people rather than being thrown into a landfill. By fulfilling board games with Castillo Games they can gain more scale and lower their shipping prices which means less equipment thrown into landfills each year!
 How to SupportShare with friends on Social Media -  Based on previous campaigns we estimate a share on social media helps to raise an average of $30 for the campaign which means you helped to raise $6 for the hungry just by sharing on social media. Make an impact today and share this project with friends! Timeline
September & October - games arrive to fulfillment centers
October - Games are delivered to your door
 Risks & ChallengesWith two crowdfunding campaigns under our belt, we are confident in our ability to fulfill perks to our backers. We believe in high transparency and good communication, providing regular updates.The risk of this campaign is very low. Mass production of all games is complete. For Rescuing Robin Hood, the games have left the factory, but they could experience shipping or customs delays. Rio Grande Games inventory is in the US, so delays are unlikely. Additionally, with a flexible funding goal you will get your game even if we don't reach out goal.

story:
Pour la version Française cliquez-ici / French version click here.

For English readers

 

 

 

 

In Dice Seadog, you play a pirate captain who tries to become king of pirates, by being the first one to gather 17 Golds.

Pictures of the prototype

 

 The Boardgame

 Pictures of the Ex-libris

*Not contractual pictures.

 

 

We wish to raise funds to produce in France and publish a minimum of 500 copies of the game that we created : Dice Seadog. This represents a 9200€ investment, part of which is provided by ourselves.

 

 

  • The rules book : You will find the rules book here.

 

 

  • A notebook of rules(rulers) of 4 pages colors.

  • 4 individual trays .

  • 1 white die

  • 1 yellow die

  • 1 green die

  • 1 purple die

  • 1 red die

  • 1 blue die

  • 4 yellow cube of 8 mm of quoted(esteemed)

  • 4 green cube of 8 mm of quoted(esteemed)

  • 4 purple cube of 8 mm of quoted(esteemed)

  • 4 red cube of 8 mm of quoted(esteemed)

  • 4 blue cube of 8 mm of quoted(esteemed)

  • 6 boards of stickers for the dice

 

Every round, a player rolls the white, green, purple, red and blue dice. The one who rolled the dice takes the white die without changing its result. Then by beginning with the player having the white die and by turning clockwise, every player is going to choose and to set without changing the result, one of the thrown dice.

Then, beginning with the player having the white die and by turning clockwise, the players solve their dice. The player having the white die always solves it first, and after that, the colored die he has choosen.

When all the players have solved their die, dice are rolled by the player on the left of the first player and a new round begins.

 

 

  • An autographed Ex-Libris
  • A T-shirt of Dice Seadog, with the Kraken picture.
  • A set of dice game phosphorescent
  • A set of dice game imitation precious substances (ivory, ruby, jade, amethiste, gold, saphir)
  • A new tray acting as " mini extension ", on the theme of Poulpy.
  • Printable version of the extension of the game with :
    • 6 trays representing the pennants of 6 nations in presence (France, Spain, Holland, England, Portugal, America).
    • 30 tiles pennants and their supports representing nations forbidden in ports (5 tiles by nations).
    • 1 corsair Die (black), taking back sides of the other dice and a new one : the Privateer! (Die unfold, easy to assemble)
    • 1 notebook of rules, containing rules to play until 6 players, that introduces the notion of nation and the Privateer side.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • Coming soon!

 

All the contributors will receive a printable version of the game, once this one is financed, but without the definitive pictures .

 

 

Dice Seadog is produced in France, with the company Ferriot Cric. Once the necessary funds collected and the fundraising campaign ended, the game should be available around mid-June (accepting last minutes problems).

 

  • Your copy of the game will be sent to you as soon as available, by mail. An additional cost, depending on country, will be asked.

 

 

 

Payments are processed through Paypal, which ensures the security of your transaction and refund in case our funding goal isn't reached. 

 

 

Please note that the published product may have differences regarding sizes, quantities or layout because of the production's limitations/adjustments.

 

Please DO NOT use the artworks of this game without our permission.

 

Should you have any comments or questions, feel free to contact us at editions.fantasy@gmail.com or on Facebook.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Version Française / French version

 

 

 

À propos

Ceci est la campagne française de Dice Seadog, qui a pour but de faire fabriquer ce jeu en France.

Dice Seadog est un jeu simple et fluide dans lequel des capitaines pirates s'affrontent afin de déterminer qui sera le nouveau roi des Pirates. Revivez la grande aventure de la Piraterie, dès 2 joueurs, jouable jusqu’à 4 joueurs !

Nombre de joueurs : 2-4      À partir de : 10 ans      Durée d'une partie : 4 à 45 min
Genre : Jeu apéritif (aléatoire)

Amusant - Jeu rapide et interactif, sans temps mort.
Facile - Règles apprises en 5 minutes.
Stratégique - Élaborez votre plan de victoire et influencez celui des autres joueurs.

Le livre de règles : retrouvez le livret de règles ici.

 

Si le palier de 8 000 euros est atteint, Dice Seadog sera imprimé.

Le matériel de Dice Seadog contiendra :

  • 1 plateau de jeu (10,5 x 29,7 cm) représentant une coupe longitudinale d'un navire.
  • 20 cubes en bois représentant les membres d'équipage (rouge), l'or (jaune), les vivres (bleu), les tissus (violet) et les épices (vert).
  • 6 dés vierges. Un dé pour chaque couleur ( jaune, vert,violet, rouge et bleu) de ressource et un pour le dé aventure (blanc).
  • 6 plaquettes d'autocollants, une pour chaque dé.
  • 1 livret de règles
Si le palier de 14 000 euros est atteint, Dice Seadog sera imprimé et l'ensemble des dés gravé. Bonus :
  • 1 ex-libris d'une illustration de Dice Seadog faite par Kevin Wandrol et dédicacé.
  • 1 Plateau de jeu "mini extension" qui permet de jouer le Kraken "Poulpy" au lieu d'un pirate.
 
Si le palier de 17 000 euros est atteint, Dice Seadog sera imprimé avec les dés gravés. Bonus, la version PDF de la future extension de Dice Seadog contenant :
  • 6 extensions de plateaux représentant les fanions des 6 nations en présence (France, Espagne, Hollande, Angleterre, Portugal, Amérique). 
  • 30 tuiles fanions et leur support représentant les nations interdites dans les ports (5 tuiles par nation).
  • 1 Dé corsaire (noir), reprenant des faces d'autres dés et une nouvelle dédiée : le Corsaire ! (dé avec languette pour faciliter le montage)
  • 1 livret de règles, contenant les règles pour jouer jusqu'à 6, introduisant la notion de nation et la face corsaire.

 

  • La version imprimable de la future extension de Dice Seadog, introduisant la possibilité de jouer jusqu'à 6, de devenir corsaire et de nouvelles mécaniques rendant le jeu encore plus stratégique, sans perdre en vitesse de jeu.
  • Tous les contributeurs recevront un exemplaire du jeu imprimable, une fois le financement assuré.

  • Un T-shirt Dice Seadog, avec en illustration au dos, l'illustration promotionel faite par Kevin Wandrol sur le thême du Kraken.

  • Un jeu de dés, pour le jeu, phosphorescent.

  • Un jeu de dés, pour le jeu, en imitation de matières précieuses (ivoire, améthiste, jade, saphir, rubie et or)

Photos du prototype

Le plateau de jeu.

 Esquisse de l'Ex-libris

 

*Photos non contractuelles

Frais de port :

Les frais de ports, sont offerts à toute personne ayant acquis une des offres suivantes : Dice Seadog 2, Dice Seadog 3, Dice Seadog 4 et Dice Seadog 5.

Autrement, merci de nous consulter afin que nous puissions calculer les frais de port en fonction du nombre de produits que vous avez aquis et de votre pays (comptez un minimum de 7€).

 

À quoi va servir le financement ?

Le financement des participants nous permettra d'assurer deux éléments :

Premièrement, assurer la production du jeu sur le territoire Français. Ce qui implique un coût légèrement supérieur à la concurrence, mais pour une finition bien supérieure.

Mais aussi, garantir une qualité dans la production actuelle et future.

Merci de votre soutien.

 

À propos du porteur de projet

Les Éditions Fantasy sont éditeur de jeu de société.

Page Facebook des Éditions Fantasy et Blog du projet "Dice Seadog"

Nous créons et éditons des jeux qui vous racontent à chaque partie une histoire nouvelle.

story:
We as parents come across this sentence everyday

“PleaseMom, can I have a toy?”

Yes, toys play a big role in little one's learning and development. As parents, we seek the best toys for our kids. Although after purchase, it keeps us thinking, was it worth the spend considering the attention span of the kid and the lack of interest towards that particular toy after a few days of use? Then starts the follow up issues of storage and at the end, disposal. Even after this, it is very difficult to satisfy the constant curiosity of the kids and their urge to play with new toys.

This is where PleaseMom can help.

Toys rental platform with doorstep delivery/pickup.

First of a kind online library in Singapore offering Educational toys from age 0 to 13+ Everything from Rattles to Robotics.

We have created this solution that will drastically reduce the wastage of resources with respect to environment, money, storage space and time.

How it works ?

  • Login to https://www.pleasemom.sg
  • Select the Toy of your choice (We have built a well curated collection of toys which are simple to filter and learn how to play).
  • Select the date and place the Order.
  • A Beautiful personalised kit with selected toys will be at your door step in 3 working days.

Given the pandemic where our Kids spend most of the time indoor, we seek to introduce a contactless way to provide much needed versatile play time for Kids.

Whenever you want to replace the toy with a new set of toys, simply schedule a pickup from PleaseMom at your desired time.

Rent. Return. Repeat.  

Little more about world of Please mom

We have a selection of over 600 varieties of toys (as of now). We add 200+ new type of toys every month.

Toys are suitable for age starting from 0 to 13+

Depending on your membership you would be awarded with certain points. You spend these points to rent the toys. The value of the toys are anywhere from twice to four times the amount of points spent.

PleaseMom’s pocket friendly concept supports the idea of reuse - Saving the cost of purchase, storage and Disposal.

We have carefully curated the toys keeping in mind the Impact of the toys on a child's brain development, IQ, emotional and social growth, creativity, problem solving skills, concentration and development of their senses. 

We have further categorised and sub categorised each toy according to their genre and learning capabilities.

There are web links attached with the toys which requires a video guide to play them

 

Safety

This Pandemic has taught us an important lesson - safety doesn't happen by accident.

At PleaseMom, we have kept utmost care over safety and sanitisation during the entire pickup/delivery cycle.

After pickup, the toys go through the sanitisation. Our team cleans each toy, every part and piece thoroughly with steam cleaner (Sanitises without chemicals and cleans up to 99.999% of coronavirus and bacteria).
We use organic solutions as an anti-bacterial and anti-fungal agent to clean the surfaces that are not suitable for steam. The idea is, even a toddler sniffing or licking the toys will not come in contact with any chemical cleaner.

Please reach out to us over any queries regarding the working and brands of the cleaners and the research behind the effectiveness of these methods, or anything else.

We have designed reusable customised delivery bags for our little ones.

How about “Santa’s bag” experience all year round !!

Your Support

We believe that with everything changing around us, this is the ‘new normal’ as far as the toys are concerned due to the benefits of getting more by spending less and also for the implementation of the concept of Reuse and Recycle.

Your support will provide us the motivation and encouragement to serve our best. We have designed membership plans at discounted rates for our first supporters and promoters.

Although the discounted rates are for a period of 30 days, Member purchasing our subscription plans will retain their monthly membership at the same promotional rates for 6 months.

We would like you to be a part of this journey from raising funds to delivering your toys. stay connected with us on

https://www.facebook.com/PleaseMom-101306115504457

https://www.instagram.com/pleasemomsg/

so that we can update you at every step.

Along with your support, we are also seeking your suggestions. This is a platform for the parents by the parents. You can help us explore a wide variety of toys by suggestions.

 

Our Team

 

We are a group of homeschooling parents who strongly believe in practical learning with toys. We have an educator running our team who wish to extend her knowledge to the society and celebrate the curiosity and desire of self exploration in kids.The toys are curated by a professional paediatric therapist in team, who has an extensive experience in designing activities to boost brain development in kids. Our technical lead in the team makes sure you have a pleasant journey through our website and online portals in the entire process of renting to delivery.

Please do check our website for a better understanding.

http://www.pleasemom.sg

Note : The website designing is still in process and the version here is just a glimpse of a few toys from our collection, filters to choose from and user friendliness.

Thank you for your time.

story:
Earn prestige by completing missions, discovering new planets, increasing population, and fulfilling your hidden objective. Variable player powers and game-changing events mean that every game is as different as the planets in our galaxy! 

  • Supports Multiple Play Styles: Based on who is playing, Stellar Leap can be semi-cooperative, really aggressive, or somewhere in between and you can win by playing in any of those ways. 
  • Custom Game Length: Change the play time easily by increasing or decreasing the number of events to complete the game.
  • Player Choice Matters: Choose your player power and hidden trait to help support your specific strategy, designate which planets and asteroids to place where they'll benefit you the most, and choose when the game ends by either causing events to trigger or avoiding them.
  • AI Variants: Experience the galaxy of Stellar Leap against a variety of opponents on your own or add an AI to your two player games to simulate the three or four player game.

 You can read Derek's full review here!

You can read Eric's full review here! 

*Fifth Player not shown above*

Game Contents: 

  • 5 Large Player Boards
  • 24 Planet and Asteroids Cards
  • 1 Kickstarter Exclusive Promo Card
  • 12 Event Cards
  • 5 Home Planets
  • 34 Mission Cards
  • 8 Trait Cards
  • 3 Universal Cards
  • 8 Species Cards
  • 8 Traits Cards
  • 6 Dice Cards
  • 50 Wooden Player Figures
  • 5 Dice, 2 16mm Black Dice, 3 Grey 12mm
  • 60 Player Tokens
  • 45 Wooden Cubes
  • 5 Reference Cards
  • 3 Solo AI Cards

You can read Jeremy's full review here!  

Check out David's review here!

You can learn from the full rules here (The rules are not final and will be formatted better in the final game).  We are working on getting the rules translated into German, Italian, and Spanish now. If you'd like us to add another language, please tell us! 

 

You can download the black and white, non graphical Print and Play here 

Check out Stellar Leap on Tabletopia: stellarleap.space/tabletopia

At the start of your turn, roll two dice. 

Choose between your unique Species Dice Power and the shared Universal Power to change the dice to what will benefit you the most.  

Planets now generate resources if they are in the columns matching the die values and the sum of the die values (up to three columns). Every player with at least one population on any planet located in the matching columns receives the resources noted on the planet card.

The four resources are fuel, water, food, and oxygen. Food and water are used to grow your population, fuel and oxygen are used to move around the galaxy, and all of them are used to complete missions to help those who need it. 

Next is the Action Phase! You get to perform two High Command Actions, activate any of your three Divisions, and move about the galaxy as you wish. 

The High Command actions include: increasing your population, discovering a new planet or asteroid, taxing to gain resources, and attacking your opponents to gain control of a planet. There are three Divisions at your disposal: Mining, which mines asteroids, Labor, which gains resources, and Intelligence, which completes missions. 

 Events are triggered by player actions during regular gameplay. In the case below, an entire solar system has been discovered! Events can be good or bad, instant or ongoing until the next event, and they're typically better for the player that triggered the event. 

Gameplay continues until six events are triggered, then players get an equal number of turns and the game is over! 

When the game ends, players tally up their scores by adding up their prestige gained from completing missions, their player board achievements, and from their no longer hidden trait. 

You can read the full Gameosity review here!  

You can read the full Board Gaming FTW review here! 

You can view Eric's full review here! 

You can read Jeremy's full review here!

You can read Derek's full review here! 

You can read David's full review here!

You can view Board Game Spotlight's full review here!

 

 

See the full Chit Chat review below!

 

 

  • One Copy of Stellar Leap
  • One Copy of Stellar Leap and One Copy of Stellar Leap: Frontiers 
  • One Copy of Stellar Leap and One Copy of Stellar Leap: Frontiers, plus a Custom Home Planet. You determine the color and name of this planet. Planet names can only be 7-26 characters, depending on the characters. 
  • One Copy of Stellar Leap and One Copy of Stellar Leap: Frontiers Frontiers, plus your name or pseudonym as the discoverer of a Planet! 

All reward levels include the HQ Digital Print & Play File. If you'd like the HQ Digital Print & Play File for the Stellar Leap: Frontiers Expansion, add $4 to your pledge. 

To add an add-on to your pledge, click the Manage Your Pledge button, click the Change Your Pledge button, then update the pledge amount to add either an additional $20 for every custom planet you would like or $42 for an additional game of Stellar Leap. 

You can watch the full Chit Chat review here! 

Stellar Leap: Frontiers adds another layer to the base Stellar Leap game and it's made for those who want to explore all reaches of the galaxy! It consists of resource focused planets, diverse asteroids, events that can either give or take away your available options, and traits that are more challenging than those in the base game, but that can seriously pay off, if you make the right choices! The expansion also adds a new type of card: Solar System Completion Bonuses. These allow the player who completed a solar system to change that system in a significant manner. The expansion isn't large, but it's definitely significant! Stellar Leap: Frontiers is suggested for those who want to explore the farthest frontiers of Stellar Leap. 

 

Expansion Contents:  

  • 12 new Planet and Asteroids Cards
  • 6 Event Cards  
  • 8 Trait Cards
  • 10 Solar System Completion Bonus Cards

 You can read the full Board Game Spotlight review here. 

People sometimes wonder why they should back instead of waiting to get the game later in retail. The most important reason not to wait with Stellar Leap is that we currently have no plans to put this game into distribution. If you wait, you may end up missing out as we won’t have many extra copies to sell and unless your local store backs the campaign, they won’t be carrying it either. 

  • Subsidized Shipping – We’re giving free shipping to the US, $10 to the EU and Canada and $15 to everyone else. We’re going to pay for the rest of the shipping costs. 
  • EU Friendly – copies will be sent from inside the EU to avoid VAT fees for backers. 

Most importantly, without you, Stellar Leap would not get created. We definitely appreciate every backer’s support in making our dream a reality.

We would love to support game stores by offering the Kickstarter versions of Stellar Leap to retailers during the campaign. Back the project for $1, send us a message, and we'll get back to you! An invoice will be sent to you before we ship your rewards

Shipping costs differ based on your location:  

Free for the United States 

  • $10 for the EU, Canada, and Australia 
  • $15 for the rest of the world 

We are working with several fulfillment partners to get Stellar Leap to you the proper way; Gamesquest for the EU, Snakes & Lattes for Canada, Aetherworks for Australia, and VFI Asia for all of Asia. We will personally be shipping out copies from the United States. 

 To order a second copy of Stellar Leap, add an additional $42 to your pledge with no additional shipping cost. 

 I am happy to discuss group orders larger than two copies, but these need to be handled on a country by country basis. Please send me a direct message including country and number of copies to discuss.

Stellar Leap is the second project of Weird Giraffe Games. Super Hack Override was our first project and it was delivered a month early to backers in March 2017. 

Weird Giraffe Games was founded to create games that are easy to learn and play, but layered with strategy.

Our team is made of the following people: 

  • Carla Kopp, Game Designer and Founder of Weird Giraffe Games
  • Nick Kopp, Game Developer and Founder of Weird Giraffe Games
  • Tyler Harris, Graphics Design and Illustration

We're looking forward to talking to you throughout this Kickstarter and after! Please feel free to reach out to us directly, in the comments, or in a variety of methods on social media if you have any questions, comments, or concerns. We would love to hear from you! 

  • Follow Weird Giraffe Games on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Board Game Geek or visit our website.

story_txt:
Earn prestige by completing missions, discovering new planets, increasing population, and fulfilling your hidden objective. Variable player powers and game-changing events mean that every game is as different as the planets in our galaxy! 

Supports Multiple Play Styles: Based on who is playing, Stellar Leap can be semi-cooperative, really aggressive, or somewhere in between and you can win by playing in any of those ways. 

Custom Game Length: Change the play time easily by increasing or decreasing the number of events to complete the game.

Player Choice Matters: Choose your player power and hidden trait to help support your specific strategy, designate which planets and asteroids to place where they'll benefit you the most, and choose when the game ends by either causing events to trigger or avoiding them.

AI Variants: Experience the galaxy of Stellar Leap against a variety of opponents on your own or add an AI to your two player games to simulate the three or four player game.
 You can read Derek's full review here!You can read Eric's full review here! *Fifth Player not shown above*Game Contents: 
5 Large Player Boards
24 Planet and Asteroids Cards
1 Kickstarter Exclusive Promo Card
12 Event Cards
5 Home Planets
34 Mission Cards
8 Trait Cards
3 Universal Cards
8 Species Cards
8 Traits Cards
6 Dice Cards
50 Wooden Player Figures
5 Dice, 2 16mm Black Dice, 3 Grey 12mm
60 Player Tokens
45 Wooden Cubes
5 Reference Cards
3 Solo AI Cards
You can read Jeremy's full review here!  Check out David's review here!You can learn from the full rules here (The rules are not final and will be formatted better in the final game).  We are working on getting the rules translated into German, Italian, and Spanish now. If you'd like us to add another language, please tell us! 

 
You can download the black and white, non graphical Print and Play here Check out Stellar Leap on Tabletopia: stellarleap.space/tabletopiaAt the start of your turn, roll two dice. Choose between your unique Species Dice Power and the shared Universal Power to change the dice to what will benefit you the most.  Planets now generate resources if they are in the columns matching the die values and the sum of the die values (up to three columns). Every player with at least one population on any planet located in the matching columns receives the resources noted on the planet card.The four resources are fuel, water, food, and oxygen. Food and water are used to grow your population, fuel and oxygen are used to move around the galaxy, and all of them are used to complete missions to help those who need it. Next is the Action Phase! You get to perform two High Command Actions, activate any of your three Divisions, and move about the galaxy as you wish. The High Command actions include: increasing your population, discovering a new planet or asteroid, taxing to gain resources, and attacking your opponents to gain control of a planet. There are three Divisions at your disposal: Mining, which mines asteroids, Labor, which gains resources, and Intelligence, which completes missions.  Events are triggered by player actions during regular gameplay. In the case below, an entire solar system has been discovered! Events can be good or bad, instant or ongoing until the next event, and they're typically better for the player that triggered the event. Gameplay continues until six events are triggered, then players get an equal number of turns and the game is over! When the game ends, players tally up their scores by adding up their prestige gained from completing missions, their player board achievements, and from their no longer hidden trait. You can read the full Gameosity review here!  You can read the full Board Gaming FTW review here! You can view Eric's full review here! You can read Jeremy's full review here!You can read Derek's full review here! You can read David's full review here!You can view Board Game Spotlight's full review here!

story:
¿Have you ever feel the sensation of an exclusive deck of cards on your hands? 

I've been constantly working on this project and now I'm excited to show it to the world. 

After a few months training cardistry and performing card tricks I've learnt that is not only about skill, practice and handling, you need a good deck to complement your effort, so I felt the need to create an outstanding deck of cards, but personally for me cards must gather some requirements to be considered as great: design, quality and exclusivity

Designed from scratch for cardists, card players and collectors, inspired by minimalism and geometric shapes. I've finally mixed both concepts into one and the result is just amazing.

The simplicity of white color plus a colorful background creates a pleasant look. Geometry adds an important sense of equality and visual effect.

A well designed deck of cards needs good quality too and FANTASY is not the exception, USPCC our manufacturer offers the best features on the global market.

We need a long-lasting paper to train tricks and perform different moves so we decided to use Casino quality paper, better quality paper than standard cards will give you a better sensation and more durability.

But the paper is not the only important factor when designing a great deck, we also need a good touch sensation for a better handling and effortless fanning, so we decided to choose magic finish (texturized paper known as air-cushion) with a special varnish to reach the best feel on hand.

With a deck of traditionally cut cards, getting a perfect faro shuffle it's easy and effortless, it's about having your hands in the right position and applying gentle inward pressure. The cards will do the rest.

A deck of cards every single collector will wish to have on their collections and every single cardist will wish to have on their hands.

TUCK BOX

An exclusive deck needs an exclusive box so we have created it following the same philosophy, design, quality and design.

 

 

SEAL

A seal it's a small part of a tuck box, however it's important, and we have designed a special numbered seal to make it even more exclusive.

 

Geometric shapes taken to another level, simple but visually clean.

Court cards must have a good design, and this isn't the exception, after many designs we finally found the best, straightforward and colorful, just imagine holding these on your hands.

A smooth and clean design, identical wildcards.

BACK

Geometric shapes will provide a great visual effect on a fan.

UNCUT SHEET

This is one of the most valued articles for collectors, a true masterpiece.

PRODUCTION

The FANTASY deck will be manufactured by The United States Playing Card Company (USPCC), one of the most experienced companies in the world. We are using the best features offered to get a durable and amazing deck.

 

SHIPPING

Can it get better?

Yes it can, Gambler's Warehouse will provide the fulfillment service for the FANTASY Deck, they offer one of the most reliable services in the world. Another perk with the following features:

-Global shipping.

-Shipping costs are lower.

-Safe and trusted packaging.

PRICES

(International shipping prices are without tracking)

GOALS

1st goal ($8.700) - The tuck box will be embossed.

2nd goal ($10.000) - Surprise.

I hope you're excited as I am,  please support this project and let's make it real, I bet you'll be satisfied.

Follow us on facebook and instagram as @fantasydeck

¿Still have a question? you can send me an email at: fantasydeckproject@gmail.com (English & spanish)
