story:
Short Summary

About 3 months ago, we realized that the other stores selling “offensive” content didn’t know shit about what it truly means. We were tired of seeing the same old barely offensive, unoriginal t-shirt with swear words on it as the only “offensive” product that you could buy online, so we decided to make our own products. We were also sick of seeing the big Tech companies censor the content and products on their platforms, so we made a store for all the believers in free speech. Here at The Offensive Store, we only use he or she pronouns and we definitely do not care about your feelings.


What We Need & What You Get


The funds will 100% be used to produce the Deport Who? Board game and its expansions (Impeach Who? & Audit Who?). All profit will be directly reinvested to the production of our other products in order for them to be available for purchases as soon as possible.

Deport Who? includes 2 game trays, 4 double-sided character sheets (2 for each game tray), 2 selectors and instructions for 2 players. Adult assembly required. Depending on the success of the campaign, we plan on making these two card expansion packs available.


The Impact


We’re a group of friends who saw a rise in censorship over what might be considered offensive by people, especially coming from the Left of the political isle. We’ve seen products being banned or taken hostage from Amazon and other retailers and we thought we could do something about it.  After spending months imagining, creating and figuring logistic, we arrived at the conclusion that it was going to be hard to start production without resorting to a crowdfunding platform, so here we are. We want to create original offensive products. Not the very boring t-shirts you can buy with “offensive” or vulgar words written on it. We want to create real products that have value, depth and originality. We have a full backlog of products that are ready to be launched but we need your help. We want to make our products cheap so that you can laugh with your friends and hopefully trigger your enemies at a reasonable price. Your help means that we can start the production of our various other offensive board games, offensive beverages, office and home supplies and customizable offensive products. For now, we need to have our production done by asian slaves, but rest assured that our ideas are totally developed by cis-white males. Our ultimate goal is to move production to America where we can employ Gender Studies graduates to have their tears bless our products during production.


Risks & Challenges


We’ve went through a few challenges thus far, proving us that we need to make a difference in the market. We’ve been trying to open social media accounts using our name and we’ve been banned every time for just using the word “offensive”. There is a serious problem to let a few big Tech companies control the internet. Especially, when they’re all run by Leftists. We want to offer the possibility for people to be a part of our change. As soon as our store is live, we’ll give our supporters the ability to help us in the creation of products and we’ll find a way to share the profits with you while we take care of the production. We won’t be selling on Amazon or any other sites because, because you know, commies like to ban competition.


Other Ways You Can Help


Are you the kind of person who likes free shit? Or maybe you're just a poor millennial and can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign if you believe in our game.
  • Share our Indiegogo page with friends. We condone pissing a few people off, because we are too! 

 

Disclaimer

Last updated: December 03, 2018

The information contained on www.theoffensivestore.com (the "Service") is for general information purposes only.

All characters in the game, even those based on real people--are entirely fictional. 

The Offensive Store assumes no responsibility for errors or omissions in the
contents on the Service. The Offensive Store does not condone violence or use of offensive languages. The Offensive Store does not condone hatred for any media personalities, politicians , person of color or any religious person. All products made by the Offensive Store do not endorse any sort of verbal or physical violence. The products and advertisement made by The Offensive Store are meant to be jokes and nothing more.

In no event shall The Offensive Store be liable for any special, direct, indirect, consequential, or incidental damages or any damages whatsoever, whether in an action of contract, negligence or other tort, arising out of or in connection with the use of the Service or the contents of the Service. The Offensive Store reserves the right to make additions, deletions, or modification to the contents on the Service at any time without prior notice. This Disclaimer for The Offensive Store is managed by TOS.

What We Need & What You Get
The funds will 100% be used to produce the Deport Who? Board game and its expansions (Impeach Who? & Audit Who?). All profit will be directly reinvested to the production of our other products in order for them to be available for purchases as soon as possible.
Deport Who? includes 2 game trays, 4 double-sided character sheets (2 for each game tray), 2 selectors and instructions for 2 players. Adult assembly required. Depending on the success of the campaign, we plan on making these two card expansion packs available.



The Impact
We’re a group of friends who saw a rise in censorship over what might be considered offensive by people, especially coming from the Left of the political isle. We’ve seen products being banned or taken hostage from Amazon and other retailers and we thought we could do something about it.  After spending months imagining, creating and figuring logistic, we arrived at the conclusion that it was going to be hard to start production without resorting to a crowdfunding platform, so here we are. We want to create original offensive products. Not the very boring t-shirts you can buy with “offensive” or vulgar words written on it. We want to create real products that have value, depth and originality. We have a full backlog of products that are ready to be launched but we need your help. We want to make our products cheap so that you can laugh with your friends and hopefully trigger your enemies at a reasonable price. Your help means that we can start the production of our various other offensive board games, offensive beverages, office and home supplies and customizable offensive products. For now, we need to have our production done by asian slaves, but rest assured that our ideas are totally developed by cis-white males. Our ultimate goal is to move production to America where we can employ Gender Studies graduates to have their tears bless our products during production.


Risks & Challenges
We’ve went through a few challenges thus far, proving us that we need to make a difference in the market. We’ve been trying to open social media accounts using our name and we’ve been banned every time for just using the word “offensive”. There is a serious problem to let a few big Tech companies control the internet. Especially, when they’re all run by Leftists. We want to offer the possibility for people to be a part of our change. As soon as our store is live, we’ll give our supporters the ability to help us in the creation of products and we’ll find a way to share the profits with you while we take care of the production. We won’t be selling on Amazon or any other sites because, because you know, commies like to ban competition.

Other Ways You Can Help
Are you the kind of person who likes free shit? Or maybe you're just a poor millennial and can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can’t help:

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign if you believe in our game.
Share our Indiegogo page with friends. We condone pissing a few people off, because we are too! 

 
Disclaimer
Last updated: December 03, 2018
The information contained on www.theoffensivestore.com (the "Service") is for general information purposes only.
All characters in the game, even those based on real people--are entirely fictional. 
The Offensive Store assumes no responsibility for errors or omissions in thecontents on the Service. The Offensive Store does not condone violence or use of offensive languages. The Offensive Store does not condone hatred for any media personalities, politicians , person of color or any religious person. All products made by the Offensive Store do not endorse any sort of verbal or physical violence. The products and advertisement made by The Offensive Store are meant to be jokes and nothing more.
In no event shall The Offensive Store be liable for any special, direct, indirect, consequential, or incidental damages or any damages whatsoever, whether in an action of contract, negligence or other tort, arising out of or in connection with the use of the Service or the contents of the Service. The Offensive Store reserves the right to make additions, deletions, or modification to the contents on the Service at any time without prior notice. This Disclaimer for The Offensive Store is managed by TOS.

story:
(Expert Survivor Pledge)

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

As these articles must be manufactured there could be some delays like Covid19 delays, production delays, shipping delays and customs delays. In any case, we have reached out to companies that are well-known in the board game and miniatures industry for the production of Memory Decompression. The estimated delivery date is December 2021, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Some rewards will arrive before others depending on the country and the items shipped. We, in Dark Green Games, can guarantee that we will do our absolute best to provide you with accurate information and to limit any delays to a minimum.

story:
Thus, our idea was born. One of the most millennial items out there.  A print & play board game about agency life.  Which is actually just a card game, but we wanted to include a KV as well.
Super easy, super fun, anyone can play it. A game about hilariously relatable daily creatives-client brawls.

 

How it works

There’s 2 teams, the creatives and the clients. To win the game, the creatives have to finish the campaign before the deadline. If not, the clients win.

If you’re a creative and you draw a DDL card, you’re out of the game. Unless! You play a STALL card, which buys you time and cancels it.      

The deck is made up of these cards that can save you from reaching the deadline before finishing the campaign, NOPE cards that stop the actions of the client, special abilities and, unfortunately, lots of client attacks.  

What to do with this game? Play it during breaks at the office. Play it after hours. With the client when he visits. Before pitches to lower anxiety. At parties to brag you’re working in advertising. Play it with your parents so they can finally understand what your job means.

 

Who we are

The game was created by creative duo Anca Stirbacu and Alexandra Iordache, with the help of the fantastic illustrator Raluca Mitarca. Put an art, a copy and an illustrator together and they'll come up with amazing over budget ideas. 

That's why we need your help

It's not easy and we definitely can't build this without you, but we have the brains, wits, drive and those tons of e-mails to develop this idea into your future favorite board game. *Not a board game, just cards.

We didn't want to just raise money to fund our trip. We wanted to do something incredibly cool. But for this we need your help, so we're inviting you to join and help make something very awesome happen.

You can help by donating any sum or purchasing the perks we're currently offering. Just make sure you tell us which one you chose and we will make sure you'll get it as soon as possible.

story:
Welcome to this Indiegogo community-driven campaign to bring the iconic legacy teams to the brand new PVC material.

By supporting this Indiegogo project, you will receive the following:

  • The Butcher's Guild: The Bloody Master in PVC
    • 6 Players, 1 Terrain Piece, 1 Goal, 1 Ball
  • The Butcher's Guild: The Scarlet Circle in PVC
    • 6 Players, 1 Terrain Piece, 1 Goal, 1 Ball
  • 12 Exclusive Alt. Art Cards - with unique artwork for the iconic Butcher's Captain Ox.

The Butcher’s Guild: The Bloody Master

“You’re just meat to them. Weak, tender, soft meat. And they’re the Butchers.”

— Greyscales, Fishermen’s Guild
 

Tougher than gristle, Ox sees Guild Ball as nothing but brutal bloodsport. More merciless maniac than athlete, the master butcher has transformed the pitch into a kitchen nightmare—cleavers, knives, hooks, you name it, his team wields it. Why the cutlery? Because to this deranged butcher, everyone—even his teammates—is a succulent meatbag, crying out for pain.

His team’s playstyle is simple: get to the opposing team and shred flesh until there’s nothing left. With a ruthless and unforgiving captain, it’s no surprise their bread and butter is mid- to late game, after they’ve broken the minds and bodies of their opponents. Coaches eager to skewer and maim will delight in the savage brutality of these Butchers.

The Butcher’s Guild: The Scarlet Circle

“I remember once we celebrated to see the Master Butcher dethroned, and absent from the pitch. How wrong we were. What came next is even worse.”

— Obulus, Mortician’s Guild

Inheritor of the Master Butcher’s throne, Fillet is one of the deadliest individuals throughout the Empire. A peerless duellist, she delights in playing with her opponents; dancing around them as she cuts bloody strips out of their exposed skin before bleeding them dry when she grows bored.

Like any Butcher team, Fillet’s side will punish their opponents mercilessly – but more frightening still is the command they hold over the pitch. Defensive players dominate the opposition, dragging the enemy around ruthlessly before the more aggressive players utilize unexpected bursts of speed. This team will allow coaches to really take the fight to their opponents.

Exclusive Alt. Art Cards

For supporting this community-driven campaign, along with receiving this product early we are giving Indiegogo backers a set of Exclusive Alt. Art Cards only available during this campaign. The iconic Butcher's Captain Ox card also features brand new artwork as shown above.

Shipping will be charged after the Indiegogo finishes based on actual costs incurred to ship and is collected via our pledge manager system. This allows us to charge fairly for all backers and avoid a 'one size fits all' mentality to shipping.  

Estimated shipping rates are presented below - we have based these on our current set weights/sizes so we expect little deviation from these prices - however these are just estimates:

  • UNITED KINGDOM: $5
  • EUROPE: $10
  • USA: $15
  • REST OF WORLD: $20

Any pledges confirmed after our pledge manager deadline will be shipped from the UK hub at a later date and will likely incur increased shipping costs. 

Below is the general schedule once the Indiegogo ends so you know when to expect money to be taken and our overall shipping plan. Again these are estimates: 

You will be charged immediately when you pledge.

Indiegogo Campaign Ends: 

  • 1-2 Months – Pledge Manager sent to backers confirming address details and taking payment for shipping. Deadline of closing determined after this.
  • 1 Month Before Shipping – Any late confirmations after this deadline will be shipped from the UK after all other pledges are completed and may incur additional cost. 

We are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

We have an experienced background in delivering multiple crowd-funded projects - such as the original Guild Ball. 

We are fully aware of potential delays that may happen with products that are produced in China, the common ones being delays in production, shipping, and customs.

We have estimated the delivery for November 2018, but please understand this is only an estimate. Due to the global logistics involved in shipping, some regions may receive their pledges sooner than others.

We have prepared as much as possible with our production for a successful campaign; however, we will refund pledges if for some unforeseen reason the game cannot be delivered at all.

======= 
Refunds 
=======

Refunds may be given within 60 days of the campaign ending, including fees. After that time, refunds may be given minus the Indiegogo and payment processing fees, as we will not be able to claim those back after 60 days.

We are unable to issue refunds once we have begun the packaging and shipment stages of the project (around 6–8 weeks before the actual shipping date).

Refunds within 60 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit/debit card. Refunds after 60 days of the campaign ending are processed via PayPal only.

This is a USD Indiegogo, however, refunds will be processed in GBP for the amount received, excluding any applicable fees dependent on the day on which the refund is processed as detailed above.

================= 
Terms and Conditions 
=================

If you do not confirm your shipping and pledge details within 10 weeks of our notification via email to confirm them, your pledge will be treated as abandoned. We will, however, look at each case sympathetically and try our best to satisfy each customer.

By pledging on this Indiegogo you agree that our responsibility to you is for shipping your order as entered into the pledge management system. You are responsible for import or other duties that may be payable to relevant tax authorities. You also accept that you are fully liable for incorrect shipping details and will risk your pledge being unable to be delivered or lost in transit.

If you do not accept the proposed terms please do not pledge on this Indiegogo project.

If you have any questions regarding this campaign, please contact support@steamforged.com

For retailers, please see our post HERE addressing any concerns regarding this campaign.

story:
Overview & Demo:


Key Features:  

A high fantasy in-depth adventure for gamers and non-gamers alike. 1-8+ players best with 2-6. Playtime: Customizable -Standard game is 60-90 minutes otherwise. 

50+ unique instances to explore, all with their own story and game dynamics. A real adventure in a box! Your adventure will include, but is not limited to: Angry Yeti’s, Fire Breathing Spider Kites (see Jorogumo, the Yokai from Japanese mythology), and a whole plethora of horribly gruesome ways to die.  

Takes less than 5 minutes to set up and learn.  

Unlimited re-play value! The starting keeps will change your opening play style, the random instances really mix up the middle, and the demon lord changes the end goal, story, and win conditions. A high fantasy adventure that will keep you coming back for more.  

Also including some of the most horribly interesting traditional demons from history! There’s even one that comes in riding a crocodile carrying a hawk! ...sadly the crocodile does not have laser beams on its head.. Yet. Stay tuned for the next expansion! Agares 2.0  

Semi-competitive or Cooperative. Can be played semi-competitively (Kind of like Gimli and Legolas during the Battle for Helms Deep) Or full on co-operatively.. where if your teammate is not doing well.. you should probably help them or you’re all probably going to die.  

It's customizable. You can make it harder or easier, longer or shorter, and expand it as you see fit and even change up the rules to give the game a different feel. So stay tuned for lots of great extras. I'm even currently working on a way to extend your campaign, so after you beat back the forces of hell and save the world.. you can push through the gate into the fiery underworld and bring the fight to them!  

And so much more!! But people hate reading and tell me I talk too much.. :(  

Base Game includes: 
50 Unique Instances each with their own dynamic and story. (Successfully navigating 3 will allow you to summon the Demon Lord... and there are 50! Replay Value out the wazoo.) 
9 Unique Demon Lords. Each demon lord hasit’s own fight dynamic and completely changes the end of the game both in play and in story. 
50 monsters (5 of each of the 10 unique monsters; each with their own special abilities that can combo for deadly effect) 
50 unique quests (Complete amazing-ish feats as well as your typical Heroic s.c.u.t. Work for coin!) 50 Weapons (10 unique, all awesome) 
8 Specialty dice (6 combat dice, weather cube, and chance cube) More tokens than you can count! (unless you can count to270ish.. Because there are about that many. 60 $1 resources, 60 $5 resources, 80 monster stones, 30 life/commander tokens, 40 mercenaries) 
8 Specialized keeps each with their own abilities and play style. (aggressive, defensive, tricky, tactical, economic, magical, etc etc) 
Rule booklet, Special Extras booklet, 8 cheat sheets/reminder cards, and more adventure than you could shake your magical stick at!

Special Note:
The Base Game Includes significantly more than the standard retail version probably will. Originally there were only 35 quests/instances/and monsters, 3 demon lords, and 6 keeps. Be sure not to miss out on all of these special extras and exclusives!

The co-op expansion: Demons: Oblivion - Malagar’s Wrath 
Co-op expansion includes more of everything you love, with a twist! (Requires the base game) 
25 weapons (5 unique new designs) 
25 monsters (5 unique new dangerous abilities, that combo with themselves and the base game) 
9 especially dangerous co-op “raid” instances 
3 co-op wars/major battles 
25 particularly difficult quests with special powerful rewards 
2 new powerful Keeps 
Rule Booklet, co-op special extras book, and more adventure than you could shake at least two magical sticks at.. while spending quality time saving the world with friends and loved ones.  

Pets and Heroes Expansion:

Comes with 10 new playable heroes and 10 adorable battle pets!

Each hero and pet all have their own unique game dynamics that combo with one another! Customize your kingdom and play strategy even further with our new pets and heroes!


Now introducing The Whimsy Pack!

Would you like an unreasonable amount of unreasonable things? Of course, you do! How about at a 50% discount!?!? Add this wonderful bundle of whimsical joy to your game to put a little more levity in your gaming life. Who says the apocalypse always has to be so serious?

The pack will possibly include:
A new demon lord! DJ Old Scratch.
Butch Spleen Stomper - The suspiciously buff unicorn
Poof - The Effeminate Dragon
Peevish McKnob - The Shiesty Lepricon
Chappy - The Spanked Monkey
Pontias Vanderdoosh - The Powerfully Bad Wizard - Vendor to the stars and pun-master. 

..and possibly even a unicorn-moose-beaver.. Beware! The Mighty Unimooseaver! 
(Final contents to be determined through votes/input of our backers and fans)

Commissions:
This project represents an open commission project where we'll be working with the community to create the best game possible. As a work in progress, some changes are to be expected in the final product.

Do you like to get free, rare, special extras when you buy stuff?
Well, we'll be adding things constantly throughout the rest of our campaign that you can't get anywhere else! Just for you! Yay! Here are just a few of the special extras that have been added so far!  

Each of the 10+ kingdoms plays like your favorite "archetypes" from every fantasy game. Rogue, Thief, Mage, Barbarian, Knight, Blacksmith, Merchant, etc etc etc. 6 in the base game, +2 exclusives, +2 in the co-op expansion and much more to come. Stay tuned. Next we'll be adding an exclusive weapon and an exclusive monster, as well as more contest winners for our exclusive art instances.  

Get all of our Special promo cards as well!

Meet Hipster goblin - He knew about Demons before it was cool.. and even backed the first printing. A special one of a kind treasure monster! 

First Look:
A special sneak peek at some of the cards and their new designs!  

Instances are at the heart of the game. There are 50+ Unique instances each with their own special rewards and challenges.  

Build up your kingdom and hone your combat strategy with 10+ unique weapons, keeps, and special abilities.  

9 Powerful demon lords each with their own unique game-changing dynamic, story, and philosophical conundrum with real consequences (and even more fun stuff in the optional "special rules" and extras section)

8 unique and interesting dice. Here are the original mockups I made a few years back before the re-design. The dice in the game will start with your standard plastic dice but will be upgraded as one of our first stretch goals. I'll be taking lots of suggestions and letting the backers vote for what they want most.  

We'll add more of whatever anyone shows interest in! Talk to us! Let us know what you think! ..and tell your friends and help us get the word out ;)

The Mighty Unimooseaver! (Final contents to be determined through votes/input of our backers and fans)Commissions:This project represents an open commission project where we'll be working with the community to create the best game possible. As a work in progress, some changes are to be expected in the final product.Do you like to get free, rare, special extras when you buy stuff?Well, we'll be adding things constantly throughout the rest of our campaign that you can't get anywhere else! Just for you! Yay! Here are just a few of the special extras that have been added so far!  Each of the 10+ kingdoms plays like your favorite "archetypes" from every fantasy game. Rogue, Thief, Mage, Barbarian, Knight, Blacksmith, Merchant, etc etc etc. 6 in the base game, +2 exclusives, +2 in the co-op expansion and much more to come. Stay tuned. Next we'll be adding an exclusive weapon and an exclusive monster, as well as more contest winners for our exclusive art instances.  Get all of our Special promo cards as well!Meet Hipster goblin - He knew about Demons before it was cool.. and even backed the first printing. A special one of a kind treasure monster! First Look:A special sneak peek at some of the cards and their new designs!  Instances are at the heart of the game. There are 50+ Unique instances each with their own special rewards and challenges.  Build up your kingdom and hone your combat strategy with 10+ unique weapons, keeps, and special abilities.  9 Powerful demon lords each with their own unique game-changing dynamic, story, and philosophical conundrum with real consequences (and even more fun stuff in the optional "special rules" and extras section)8 unique and interesting dice. Here are the original mockups I made a few years back before the re-design. The dice in the game will start with your standard plastic dice but will be upgraded as one of our first stretch goals. I'll be taking lots of suggestions and letting the backers vote for what they want most.  We'll add more of whatever anyone shows interest in! Talk to us! Let us know what you think! ..and tell your friends and help us get the word out ;)

story:
Aardvark’s Runaway Railroad is one of five finalists in the Hasbro Gaming Lab Fall 2016 Challenge!  We each need your support to get at least 100 backers on Indiegogo.

Support Aardvark and get a copy of the game by clicking on a "Perk" option.  The cost of shipping will be added, as needed.  (Within the USA: shipping one, two or three copies of the game doesn't change the shipping cost.)

(Prototype shown here; the exact appearance of final components will be subject to change)

What is a Runaway Railroad and who is Aardvark?

Aardvark’s Runaway Railroad is a cooperative game; everybody wins or everybody loses together.  More than luck determines the outcome.  The players need to discuss the options, trade track pieces and find a strategy to slow down the train engine or make the track form a loop.

Aardvark is a hard-working train engineer who is having trouble with the breaks on his engine today.  Aardvark’s friends will bring pieces of track to try and help him, but Kangaroo keeps bringing straight track which just makes the engine go faster. And some pieces of track are broken and must be avoided.

If more curves than straight track pieces are placed in front of Aardvark’s engine, then the engine will slow down and eventually stop.  Split tracks don’t slow down the engine, but do help to give Aardvark options.

Deceptively simple, Aardvark will typically run out of track if the players do not cooperate and trade track pieces effectively.  On the other hand, if the players check the distance the engine will move down the track and consider the order of player turns and the pieces they have remaining then they can frequently stop the engine.

How to Play Aardvark’s Runaway Railroad

A game of Aardvark’s Runaway Railroad takes between 10 and 25 minutes depending upon the number of players and how well they work together... and you can learn to play in less than that!  (Let's test that theory...)

Set the Engine Speed Indicator to the number of players plus one.  So if there are four players set the indicator to 5.

Place Aardvark’s engine on the Track Start.  Deal two pieces to each player, track-side up. Players should be encouraged to talk and make a plan.

Each player has two different pieces of track to choose from each turn.  Each player selects one piece of track to connect to the existing tracks.  (Warning: The engine can't run on broken track.)

Deal out another piece of track to each player, so they each have two pieces again.  Don’t move Aardvark just yet.  This is the end of Set Up.

If a player ever has two identical pieces in one hand, both pieces should be discarded and that player must take two new pieces.

 

Every Game Round each player first places one piece of track from their hand on their turn.

Now look at the Engine Speed Indicator and move Aardvark that many pieces of track.

Study the pieces Aardvark just covered this round (not including the piece he started on). Check to see if the engine is speeding up or slowing down.  Were there more plus one (+1 straight track) or more minus one (-1 curve track)?

Adjust the Engine Speed Indicator up or down one unit… or not at all if the curves and straight pieces have the same number.

 

Now players can choose to trade the piece they have remaining in their hand with any of the other players.  The players need to know how far Aardvark's engine will travel (just look at the Engine Speed) and then attempt to trade pieces to the best advantage of everyone.  In many cases the players have to choose between bad and worse options (straight or broken track).  The object of the game is to overcome these challenges with planning and cooperation.

 

And then deal one piece so all the players have two pieces again.  And remember, if you have two identical pieces you’ll have to discard them and get two new pieces.

Don’t overlap or cross the track... Don’t go faster than 7... And try not to run out of track!

End the game successfully by slowing the Engine Speed down to zero or…

…looping the track so it connects “smoothly” back to itself.

 

What’s in the Box?

Aardvark’s Runaway Railroad includes the following components:

1    Engine Speed Indicator Dial
1    Aardvark’s Engine
1    Track Start
58 Track pieces

 

Why is the Goal $6,000?

I’m asking to raise $6,000 to make a minimum production run of this game. I need to have a unique die (laser cut) created to cut out the track pieces. Maybe after this game comes out, stop-sign-shaped pieces will become so popular that I will be able to order them in bulk online. I doubt it, though.

 

About Aardvark

Once I settled on the idea of a game where players would work together to stop a train, I wondered who the story would be about.  I liked the idea of anthropomorphic animals for this game.  There are so many products that feature mice and rabbits; I felt I needed to steer clear of those.  I started from the top of the alphabet and ended right there: Aardvark.  I found several images of aardvarks and they immediately struck me as sympathetic characters.

 

FAQ

Question: Do I need to know how to operate a train engine to play Aardvark’s Runaway Railroad?
Answer: No. Actual experience operating a train engine will not be particularly helpful. However, experience operating a pretend or toy train could be useful.

Question: Can you play Aardvark’s Runaway Railroad on a train?
Answer: Yes. You’ll want one of the tables in the lounge car.

Question: Who did the artwork?
Answer: The artwork and design for Aardvark’s Runaway Railroad were created by Steve #3 Ehrensperger.

Question: How much is shipping?
Answer: We are currently shipping Aardvark’s Runaway Railroad only to the US and Canada. (When we can find a cost effective means of shipping around the world, we will update this. In the meantime, it seems unreasonable to ship something at a cost of more than triple its value.  This will be updated if I find a good solution.) Shipping costs are as follows:

US addresses: $10
Canadian addresses: $25

 

What you can do...

  • Back Aardvark!
  • Get an extra copy for your Railfan friends!
  • Follow our progress on facebook or twitter!
  • Share this campaign with friends who might enjoy a new train game by using the "Share This Project" buttons!
  • Get in touch with us by email with any questions or concerns!

 

Thanks for supporting the Hasbro Gaming Lab Fall 2016 Challenge! 

Be sure to check out the other designers and upcoming challenges:

Kelly Adams'          Chibi Quest!
Eugene Bryant's   Cloud Control
Michael Eskue's    Trash Pandas
Jason Wiser's        Monsters in the Elevator

story:
We have transformed Korea's traditional game "Yootnori" into an easy and entertaining board game "Yooting"

 

Yootnori has a history of 3-4,000 years in Korea and is deeply loved by the Koreans.

In order to widely spread Yootnori to other countries, we have formed "Team Katchup" to find out more ways that people around the world could enjoy Yootnori. 

Because of the slight differences in rules by region, we had to gather each region's rules and create an integrated rule for the global players. During this process, we have made several adjustments after testing the game as we found out that some people may not be accustomed to sitting on the floor or throwing the dice on the floor. 

Therefore, we have furbished the traditional Yootnori into Yooting, a board game with clear and simple rules that can be played on a table instead of the floor. 

After several modifications of the design and the guidelines, we are enlightened to introduce the finished version of Yooting.

 

  • Yooting is the name of this board game, but it also stands for the action of throwing the yoot.
  • Yoot is a new type of dice that is used in Yooting.
  • Goblins in Yooting is a piece that allows you to move on the board.

 

  1. Create 2-4 teams.

  2. Each team do Yooting and moves their goblins on the board according to the results.

  3. The team who can get all 4 goblins into the goal line first will be the winner.

 

Does it sound too simple and easy? Keep reading!

 

Flexible team arrangement

In Yooting, the number of people on each team can be different. For example, four people can individually create a team, or you can also divide the people into 3 teams: 2/1/1.

 

How do you do "Yooting"?

Unlike the typical cube shaped dice, Yooting uses a uniquely-shaped wooden dice called yoot. The instructions to roll the yoot is as follows.

 

(1) Place the yoot inside the round box.

(2) Shake the box to mix the yoots placed inside.

(3) Pull the dice box up and let the yoots spread on the floor.

 

Through yooting, you can create 6 different results. If you are lucky enough, you may result in Yoot or Tooy, which gives you another chance to yoot.

 

How to move the goblins

Unlike traditional board games like Monopoly where there is a one-way route, Yooting's board has 4 distinct routes. You can make a variety of choices depending on the Yooting results.

 

A new-type of dice with different probabilities for each result

All six different results have different probabilities, so when you end up with the result with less probability, the reward is bigger.

 

In addition, the yoot has been carefully made with two characteristics

  • Fall-protected wooden yoot has a warm texture and is made of strong material. The wood has a dust-reluctant black coating.
  • The high-quality wooden yoot is lettered with laser pieces, therefore the letters don't fade for a long time.

 

 

LUCK VS STRATEGY

Everytime you are Yooting, you must pray for Yoot or Tooy. Like we have mentioned in our rules, these two results would grant you another round of Yooting! What if the luck isn't on your side? The winner is not easily determined in this game. Luck is important but you can't ignore strategies in Yooting!

With strategic moves, you can select the paths that could block the enemy's moves or avoid their attacks! Don't forget that catching up with the enemy goblin could also give you another chance of Yooting.

Therefore, you can flip the game at any point in the game. The game isn't completely over until it is actually over.

 

Team Katchup is made up of 5 members who got together to share fun and exciting things to a lot of people. The team sincerely wish to provide enthusiastic experience for all the players purchasing Yooting.

Facebook page｜https://www.facebook.com/teamkatchup/

* To report issues or to request interview, send a private message to our fan page

story:
Dictators on the Rise

We have all seen the rise in authoritarianism on the news. So we decided, to take on the world's most dangerous dictators, by parodying them with a unique poker set and custom card game!

A Portion Goes to Charity

  • A portion of money raised will go to a 1 of 4 charities of your choice.  
  • Choose between ACLU, Liberty in North Korea, Building Ukraine Together, or Rainbow Road. (Please note, we are not endorsed by or affiliated with any of the above charities.)

 

Little Dictator comes with:

  • 72 Cards, a 2 in 1 card game (Little Dictator and 52 Poker Set)
  • A "Don't Make a Donald" or a "Don't Make a Hitler" Novelty Condom!

Here are all the cards:

story:
Lich is a new magazine (6 issues per year, 5.5" wide x 8.5" tall) for Game Masters of the Fifth Edition of the world's most popular fantasy RPG.  Lich will offer Game Masters running 5E games a number of aids in the form of ready-to-run adventures, articles, random tables, new magic items and much more. (The content in every issue of Lich magazine, however, will also be useful to GMs of other fantasy RPGs with some minor changes.)

Each issue of Lich provides a 5E adventure, complete with maps, room descriptions, random encounters, and props. Additionally, the magazine will offer random charts and tables plus one or more articles for GMs to ponder on between sessions.

The first issue of Lich currently consists of 40 pages of content (see list below) with no advertisements.  Unlike many gaming publications that don't start the writing process until a campaign ends, the content for Lich issue #1 listed below is 100% DONE... with the exception of stretch goals that can provide additional pages. Stretch goals that are reached will push this to 48 pages and maybe even further...

Lich magazine Issue 1 currently contains the following content:

 

----- ADVENTURE -----

Secret of the Shattered Fist Monastery  - A complete 18-page adventure that will have the players trying to solve the centuries-old mystery of why a group of monks up and abandoned their monastery in the middle of the night. Comes with 2 pages of maps, a printable prop handout, and a few random tables to make the adventure unique.

 

----- ARTICLES, PROPS, and PRINTABLE RESOURCES -----

The GM Roundtable - Article: Steal Your Campaign Setting from a Wargame

From the Library of Niloshis Whisperwalk -  List of 24 book titles and author names

Map Artifact - Printable prop

Wanted Poster - Printable prop

Growder's Tent - Printable magic item cards for players

Dolbin's Scrolls - Printable scroll spells for players

 

----- RANDOM CHARTS & TABLES (1 page each) -----

That Ogre is Waving! - Random charts/tables - Not all creatures want to attack!

Listen! You Smell Something? - Random charts/tables - Dungeon sights & sounds

Gurch's Anvil - Random charts/tables - What's Gurch making today? What's for sale?

Strange Place for a Crate - Random charts/tables - What could be inside?

Keeping Watch - Random charts/tables - Guard duty is never boring...

That Skeleton Looks Familiar! - Random charts/tables - Skeletons were people, too!

A Shady Character - Random charts/tables - What might they know or be selling?

Nemesis: Fighter - Random charts/tables - Every PC needs a nemesis...

The Ally: Cleric - Random charts/tables - Every party needs allies...

The Auction House - Random charts/tables - What's on the auction block today?

The Figure in the Corner - Random charts/tables - What's that person's story?

Merchant: Binga - Random charts/tables - Every party needs to buy stuff...

Town Militia - Random charts/tables - What kinds of people are protecting this town?

 

And here's a screenshot showing the thumbnails that have already been produced. Additional pages will be added from any stretch goals that are reached. Page orders may be altered. Maps have been covered (blue) to prevent spoilers to players!

 

Indiegogo allows me to order enough copies for backers PLUS a small number of extra copies (+10% - should any copies be lost or damaged in transit) so I avoid having a stack of 50 or 100 or more sitting on a shelf somewhere. Since I'll be ordering only the quantity necessary to fulfill print copy pledges, I don't have to take a financial risk by guessing how many copies I would need to order.

The minimum number of copies I will need to order is just 200, and I'm hoping there are at least 200 Game Masters out there looking for a fun, professionally-written and consistent magazine dedicated to 5E that this campaign will fund.

 

If the campaign meets its funding goals, PDF copies of Lich will be sent out to all supporters via an emailed link (using DrivethruRPG.com) as soon as any additional Stretch Goal content is completed and reviewed AND funding for the campaign has been transferred to my account by Indiegogo... about two weeks after the project ends.

Immediately after the campaign ends (September 15), I will also submit the files for Lich to the printer to speed up the delivery process to you; the printer requests between 1 and 2 weeks for delivery of the printed copies to me. This puts delivery to me around September 30th but hopefully sooner.

I will then send out the print copies of Lich to backers in a 9 inch x 7 inch sturdy protective cardboard mailer with First Class postage... NOT Media Mail. This means delivery in 5-7 business days typically, not 2-3 weeks! (If you're not familiar with Media Mail, the US Postal Service offers a cheaper way to send magazines and catalogs but it is SO SLOW.)

What all this means is the first print issue of Lich will start arriving in supporter mailboxes in early-to-mid October! (International supporters may take a little longer.)

 

Because this is a small, zine-format publication, there is a limit to the maximum page count when it comes to keeping my cost increases low and the quality of the binding high. 

I have coordinated with a reliable, quality printer for the content that is already created and ready to go, and the campaign will allow for additional pages to be added to the final version of Lich issue 1 by reaching the following Stretch Goals:

200 print copies backed -- Add 4 pages (for a total of 44 content pages)

300 print copies backed -- Add 2 pages (for a total of 46 content pages)

350 print copies backed -- Add 2 pages (for a total of 48 content pages)

400+ - We shall see...

Note: For some of the bonus pages added, I will poll supporters on what they would like to see in terms of content.

 

Lich issue #2 is already in progress.

At the time I'm pushing the launch button on this Indiegogo, I have about 15 pages for Lich #2 completed. My goal is to always have the next issue of Lich as close to completed as possible when it is ready to launch on Indiegogo. The plan is to release a new Lich every other month (6 issues per year).

Additionally, the magazine will offer random charts and tables plus one or more articles for GMs to ponder on between sessions.The first issue of Lich currently consists of 40 pages of content (see list below) with no advertisements.  Unlike many gaming publications that don't start the writing process until a campaign ends, the content for Lich issue #1 listed below is 100% DONE... with the exception of stretch goals that can provide additional pages. Stretch goals that are reached will push this to 48 pages and maybe even further...Lich magazine Issue 1 currently contains the following content: ----- ADVENTURE -----Secret of the Shattered Fist Monastery  - A complete 18-page adventure that will have the players trying to solve the centuries-old mystery of why a group of monks up and abandoned their monastery in the middle of the night. Comes with 2 pages of maps, a printable prop handout, and a few random tables to make the adventure unique. ----- ARTICLES, PROPS, and PRINTABLE RESOURCES -----The GM Roundtable - Article: Steal Your Campaign Setting from a WargameFrom the Library of Niloshis Whisperwalk -  List of 24 book titles and author namesMap Artifact - Printable propWanted Poster - Printable propGrowder's Tent - Printable magic item cards for playersDolbin's Scrolls - Printable scroll spells for players ----- RANDOM CHARTS & TABLES (1 page each) -----That Ogre is Waving! - Random charts/tables - Not all creatures want to attack!Listen! You Smell Something? - Random charts/tables - Dungeon sights & soundsGurch's Anvil - Random charts/tables - What's Gurch making today? What's for sale?Strange Place for a Crate - Random charts/tables - What could be inside?Keeping Watch - Random charts/tables - Guard duty is never boring...That Skeleton Looks Familiar! - Random charts/tables - Skeletons were people, too!A Shady Character - Random charts/tables - What might they know or be selling?Nemesis: Fighter - Random charts/tables - Every PC needs a nemesis...The Ally: Cleric - Random charts/tables - Every party needs allies...The Auction House - Random charts/tables - What's on the auction block today?The Figure in the Corner - Random charts/tables - What's that person's story?Merchant: Binga - Random charts/tables - Every party needs to buy stuff...Town Militia - Random charts/tables - What kinds of people are protecting this town? And here's a screenshot showing the thumbnails that have already been produced. Additional pages will be added from any stretch goals that are reached. Page orders may be altered. Maps have been covered (blue) to prevent spoilers to players! Indiegogo allows me to order enough copies for backers PLUS a small number of extra copies (+10% - should any copies be lost or damaged in transit) so I avoid having a stack of 50 or 100 or more sitting on a shelf somewhere. Since I'll be ordering only the quantity necessary to fulfill print copy pledges, I don't have to take a financial risk by guessing how many copies I would need to order.The minimum number of copies I will need to order is just 200, and I'm hoping there are at least 200 Game Masters out there looking for a fun, professionally-written and consistent magazine dedicated to 5E that this campaign will fund. If the campaign meets its funding goals, PDF copies of Lich will be sent out to all supporters via an emailed link (using DrivethruRPG.com) as soon as any additional Stretch Goal content is completed and reviewed AND funding for the campaign has been transferred to my account by Indiegogo... about two weeks after the project ends.Immediately after the campaign ends (September 15), I will also submit the files for Lich to the printer to speed up the delivery process to you; the printer requests between 1 and 2 weeks for delivery of the printed copies to me. This puts delivery to me around September 30th but hopefully sooner.I will then send out the print copies of Lich to backers in a 9 inch x 7 inch sturdy protective cardboard mailer with First Class postage... NOT Media Mail. This means delivery in 5-7 business days typically, not 2-3 weeks! (If you're not familiar with Media Mail, the US Postal Service offers a cheaper way to send magazines and catalogs but it is SO SLOW.)What all this means is the first print issue of Lich will start arriving in supporter mailboxes in early-to-mid October! (International supporters may take a little longer.) Because this is a small, zine-format publication, there is a limit to the maximum page count when it comes to keeping my cost increases low and the quality of the binding high. I have coordinated with a reliable, quality printer for the content that is already created and ready to go, and the campaign will allow for additional pages to be added to the final version of Lich issue 1 by reaching the following Stretch Goals:200 print copies backed -- Add 4 pages (for a total of 44 content pages)300 print copies backed -- Add 2 pages (for a total of 46 content pages)350 print copies backed -- Add 2 pages (for a total of 48 content pages)400+ - We shall see...Note: For some of the bonus pages added, I will poll supporters on what they would like to see in terms of content. Lich issue #2 is already in progress.At the time I'm pushing the launch button on this Indiegogo, I have about 15 pages for Lich #2 completed. My goal is to always have the next issue of Lich as close to completed as possible when it is ready to launch on Indiegogo. The plan is to release a new Lich every other month (6 issues per year).

story:
The Evolved is a 28mm mech focused game gives you control over mechs, infantry vehicles and The Evolved.  The game play is fast paced, full of tactics, and strategy.  The setting is based in the modern day with some futuristic advancements.  Players can look to see modern day weapons and vehicle designs.  The story is something new that we believe players will find fresh and intense, and we can’t wait to share it with you.

There are several additional units currently planned for each army.  The US army has an infantry team with large caliber sniper rifle, anti tank gun team, and anti infantry gun team. For US mechs, an anti infantry mech, a leader only mech, and a close quarters mech with pile driver.  For the Russians, a heavy cannon team, RPG team, and mortar team.  For the Russian mechs, a riot shield and shotgun armed mech, leader mech, and one armed with high explosive rockets.  The evolved will gain a heavy armored infantry unit, an infantry unit with ranged weapon, a faster moving large creature, and one with ranged.  

The evolved are humans that have the ability to control nanite swarms.  After being experimented on by scientists from the US, they broke free.  In their wake they left cities in ruins.  They lead armies of humans that  have been taken over by the nanites.  The nanites change the humans from the inside out.  The evolved brutes are formed from the melding of nanites with larger beasts and in other cases several human hosts.  They are the wrecking balls of the evolved armies.  The evolved have also learned how to use nanites to take control of mechs whose pilots have been killed but are otherwise still operable.  They are less accurate and agile, but provide  needed ranged attacks to the evolved armies.  The evolved army is a swarm army with powerful technomancers able to deal damage and heal thanks to their nanite abilities.
